1: 雷公問於黃帝曰：細子得受業，通于九鍼六十篇，旦暮勤服之，近者編絕，久者簡垢，然尚諷誦弗置，未盡解於意矣。「外揣」言渾束為一，未知所謂也。夫大則無外，小則無內，大小無極，高下無度，束之奈何？士之才力，或有厚薄，智慮褊淺，不能博大深奧，自強於學若細子。細子恐其散於後世，絕於子孫，敢問約之奈何？黃帝曰：善乎哉問也。此先師之所禁，坐私傳之也，割臂歃血之盟也，子若欲得之，何不齋乎。 Lei Gong asked the Huang Di, saying: Fu Zi can be received and practiced. It runs through the nine needles and sixty chapters, morning and evening practicing it, close ones weave it up, distant ones simplify the dirt, but it is still not complete in recitation, and it does not fully resolve its meaning. The phrase external weaving refers to a single bundle, and I do not know what this means. A great principle has no outside, and small things have no inside; large and small have no extremes, high and low have no measure, how will they be bound? The abilities of a gentleman may be shallow or deep, wise or simple-minded, unable to be profound and mysterious, and must strive in their studies like Fu Zi. Fu Zi is afraid that it will scatter in later generations and disappear from descendants, daring to ask about the pact. The Huang Di said: How wonderful this question is. This first teacher's taboo has been passed down privately, a bloody covenant, and if one wants to obtain it, why not fast?

2: 雷公再拜而起曰：請聞命於是也，乃齋宿三日而請曰：敢問今日正陽，細子願以受盟。黃帝乃與俱入齋室，割臂歃血，黃帝親祝曰：今日正陽，歃血傳方，有敢背此言者，反受其殃。雷公再拜曰：細子受之。黃帝乃左握其手，右授之書曰：慎之慎之，吾為子言之，凡刺之理，經脈為始，營其所行，知其度量，內刺五藏，外刺六府，審察衛氣，為百病母，調其虛實，虛實乃止，寫其血絡，血盡不殆矣。 Lei Gong knelt down and rose again, saying: I have heard your command; I fasted for three days and asked: 'Will you grant me an audience today when the sun is in its zenith? I would like to receive a pledge from Xiaozi.' The Yellow Emperor entered the room with him, severed his arm and shed blood. The Yellow Emperor said to him, 'Today, at the zenith of the sun, blood is passed on; whoever dares to defy this command shall suffer its consequences. Xiaozi receives it.' The Yellow Emperor then grasped his hand with his left hand and handed him a book, saying: 'Take heed, take heed! What I say to you is about needling. The channels are the starting point of all needles; regulate their flow, know their depths, needle the five organs internally and the six divisions externally, judge the vital energy, treat a hundred diseases, adjust their emptiness and fullness, and when emptiness and fullness are resolved, blood vessels will be completed, and there will be no further harm.'

3: 雷公曰：此皆細子之所以通，未知其所約也。黃帝曰：夫約方者，猶約囊也，囊滿而弗約，則輸泄，方成弗約，則神與弗俱。雷公曰：願為下材者，勿滿而約之。黃帝曰：未滿而知約之以為工，不可以為天下師。 Master Lái said: All these are the way the Fine Son makes things work, without knowing how they are interconnected. The Yellow Emperor said: What is called 'interconnection' is like storing something in a container. If the container is full and does not close properly, it will leak; when it is properly closed, it will not leak, but if the seal is not right, then spirit will not join together. Master Lái said: For common people, I wish that you would not fill them to the point of interconnection. The Yellow Emperor said: If they are not filled and their interconnection is understood as a craft, it cannot serve as a model for all under heaven.

4: 雷公曰：願聞為工。黃帝曰：寸口主中，人迎主外，兩者相應，俱往俱來，若引繩大小齊等。春夏人迎微大，秋冬寸口微大，如是者，名曰平人。 Lei Gong said: I wish to hear about the artisan. Emperor Huang said: The master is in charge of the inside, and the servant is in charge of the outside. Both respond to each other, going and coming as needed, with the cord neither too long nor too short. In spring and summer, the servants serve modestly, while in autumn and winter, the master serves modestly, so this is called the 'ordinary person'.

5: 人迎大一倍於寸口，病在足少陽，一倍而躁，在手少陽。人迎二倍，病在足太陽，二倍而躁，病在手太陽。人迎三倍，病在足陽明，三倍而躁，病在手陽明。盛則為熱，虛則為寒，緊則為痛痺，代則乍甚乍間。盛則寫之，虛則補之，緊痛則取之分肉，代則取血絡，且飲藥，陷下則灸之，不盛不虛，以經取之，名曰經刺。人迎四倍者，且大且數，名曰溢陽，溢陽為外格，死不治。必審按其本末，察其寒熱，以驗其藏府之病。 A person with a syndrome twice as strong as inch mouth has a disease in the foot, deficiency of Yang. Twice as severe, there is a condition in the hand, deficiency of Yang. A person with the syndrome four times as strong is called overflowing Yang, leading to external pathogenic factors and death that cannot be cured. One must carefully examine its beginning and end, discern whether it is cold or heat, and diagnose its visceral disease.

6: 寸口大於人迎一倍，病在足厥陰，一倍而躁，在手心主。寸口二倍，病在足少陰，二倍而躁，在手少陰。寸口三倍，病在足太陰，三倍而躁，在手太陰。盛則脹滿，寒中，食不化，虛則熱中、出糜、少氣、溺色變，緊則痛痺，代則乍痛乍止。盛則寫之，虛則補之，緊則先刺而後灸之，代則取血絡，而後調之，陷下則徒灸之，陷下者，脈血結於中，中有著血，血寒，故宜灸之，不盛不虛，以經取之。寸口四倍者，名曰內關，內關者，且大且數，死不治。必審察其本末之寒溫，以驗其藏府之病。 A point called Juice Mouth (Cun Kou) is located 1 cun above the tip of the foot, on the outside edge. When it is larger than the little toe and the big toe is embraced one time, the illness lies in the lower leg, in the back shin, one time agitated, in the heart of the palm. When Cun Kou is two times larger, the illness lies in the lower leg, in the small yin, two times agitated, in the heart of the little finger. When Cun Kou is three times larger, the illness lies in the lower leg, in the great yin, three times agitated, in the heart of the ring finger. If it is swollen, there will be fullness, and in the cold phase, food does not transform. If it is empty, there will be heat, ulceration, deficiency of essence, change of color, tight, and if it changes, there will be pain and numbness. If it is replaced, there will be sudden pain and then cessation. In the swollen state, write it; in the deficient state, supplement it, in the tight state, first puncture and then moxa; in the replaced state, take blood vessels and then regulate it, if sinking down, then moxa; those who sink down have stagnant blood in the middle, with blood congestion in the middle, cold blood, hence moxa is appropriate. Cun Kou four times larger is called Inner Gate (Nei Guan), and the Inner Gate is both large and complicated, without cure if dying. Must carefully examine its proximal and distal coldness and heat, and verify its storehouse palace's illness.

7: 通其營輸，乃可傳於大數。大數曰：盛則徒寫之，虛則徒補之，緊則灸刺，且飲藥，陷下則徒灸之，不盛不虛，以經取之。所謂經治者，飲藥，亦曰灸刺，脈急則引，脈大以弱，則欲安靜，用力無勞也。 To interpret the camp's strategy, it can be passed down in great numbers. Great numbers say: when it is full, it is only written; when it is empty, it is only supplemented; tighten and use acupuncture and moxibustion, and take medicine; if it falls, only use acupuncture; not full, not empty, take the classic method. The so-called classic treatment also uses acupuncture and moxibustion, and when the pulse is urgent, pull it; when the pulse is large but weak, want to calm down, using force does not require much effort. Note: This translation assumes that it refers to a medical or therapeutic approach rather than an actual camp or strategy, given the context of the passage provided.

docs.title: 異法方宜論
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問曰：醫之治病也，一病而治各不同皆愈何也。歧伯對曰：地勢使然也。故東方之域，天地之所始生也，魚鹽之地，海濱傍水，其民食魚而嗜鹹，皆安其處，美其食，魚者使人熱中，鹽者勝血，故其民皆黑色踈理，其病皆為癰瘍，其治宜砭石，故砭石者，亦從東方來。 Yellow Emperor asked: Why is the treatment of diseases different for each individual and yet they all recover? Hua Tuo replied: It is due to geographical factors. Therefore, in the eastern region, where heaven and earth were first created, the land of salted fish, near the sea, its people eat salted fish and enjoy saltiness, they are satisfied with their location and enjoy their food. The fish makes people warm and the salt strengthens blood, so the people's complexion is dark, and they often have skin lesions and tumors. Their treatment should be with a touchstone (a type of stone), thus the touchstone comes from the east.

2: 西方者，金玉之域，沙石之處，天地之所收引也，其民陵居而多風，水土剛強，其民不衣而褐薦，其民華食而脂肥，故邪不能傷其形體，其病生於內，其治宜毒藥，故毒藥者，亦從西方來。 In the west, there is a realm of gold and jade, a place of sand and stones, where heaven and earth converge and attract. The people live in tombs and are often visited by winds, their land has strong soil. Their people do not wear clothes but dwell in huts, they eat fine food and are fat with ointment, therefore evil cannot harm their bodies, their illnesses arise from within, and treatment should involve poisonous medicines; hence, poisonous medicines also come from the west.

3: 北方者，天地所閉藏之域也，其地高陵居，風寒冰冽，其民樂野處而乳食，藏寒生滿病，其治宜灸焫，故灸焫者，亦從北方來。 Northern regions, where heaven and earth are sealed up and hidden away; the land is high and mountainous, with cold winds and icy coldness. The people there prefer to live in wild places and subsist on milk. They suffer from cold-related diseases, and acupuncture and moxibustion are suitable treatments. Therefore, practitioners of acupuncture and moxibustion also come from the north.

4: 南方者，天地所長養，陽之所盛處也，其地下，水土弱，霧露之所聚也，其民嗜酸而食胕，故其民皆緻理而赤色，其病攣痺，其治宜微鍼，故九鍼者，亦從南方來。 In the southern region, it is nourished by heaven and earth, a place where yang is abundant. Below the ground, the soil is weak, a place where mist and dew collect. The people there like sour foods and eat millet. Therefore, their skin is smooth and red. Their diseases are mostly related to the hips and waist, and their treatment requires gentle acupuncture. Thus, the nine needles technique also originated from the southern region.

5: 中央者，其地平以濕，天地所以生萬物也眾，其民食雜而不勞，故其病多痿厥寒熱，其治宜導引按蹻，故導引按蹻者，亦從中央出也。故聖人雜合以治，各得其所宜，故治所以異而病皆愈者，得病之情，知治之大體也。 The central area, where the land is flat and humid, is the place where heaven and earth produce myriad things. The people there eat diverse foods without much labor. Therefore, they have many diseases such as weakness, cold, and fever. Treatment should be by guidance and regulation, and manipulation of the joints, which also originate from the central area. Thus, a sage would use diverse methods to treat illnesses, each according to what is appropriate for the individual, so that treatment may differ but all recover. This shows an understanding of the nature of the disease and the method of treatment.

docs.title: 五色
docs.text:
1: 雷公問於黃帝曰：五色獨決於明堂乎？小子未知其所謂也。黃帝曰：明堂者，鼻也；闕者，眉間也；庭者，顏也；蕃者，頰側也；蔽者，耳門也。其間欲方大，去之十步，皆見於外，如是者壽，必中百歲。 Lei Gong asked Yellow Emperor: Is the decision of the five colors made in the Bright Hall? The boy does not know what it means. Yellow Emperor said: The Bright Hall is the nose; the threshold is between the eyebrows; the courtyard is the face; the border is at the corner of the eye; and the screen is the ear gate. If one can fit all these into a small space, remove it by ten steps, and see everything from outside, such a person will live to be 100 years old.

2: 雷公曰：五言之辨，奈何？黃帝曰：明堂骨高以起，平以直，五藏次於中央，六府挾其兩側，首面上於闕庭，王宮在於下極，五藏安於胸中，真色以致，病色不見，明堂潤澤以清，五官惡得無辨乎？ Lei Gong said: How shall I judge five-character phrases? Huang Di replied: The Hall of Light is raised high, with a level and straight base; the Five Organs are placed in the center, with the Six Ministries flanking them on either side. The supreme countenance is above the gateway, the Royal Palace is situated below. The Five Organs are secure within the chest, the true form is manifested, and the sickly appearance does not show. Is it not to be regretted that the Hall of Light is damp and overgrown, and the Five Senses are hard to discern?

3: 雷公曰：其不辨者，可得聞乎？黃帝曰：五色之見也，各出其色部。部骨陷者，必不免於病矣。其色部乘襲者，雖病甚，不死矣。 Lei Gong said: For those who cannot discern it, can you hear about it? The Yellow Emperor said: For the five colors of appearance, each has its color department. If the bone department is sunken, there will be no escape from illness. If the color department is invaded, although the illness is severe, one will not die.

Translation: Lei Gong asked if those who cannot recognize it can hear about it. The Yellow Emperor replied that each of the five colors has a corresponding color department. If the bone department is sunken, one cannot escape from illness. If the color department is attacked, although the illness may be severe, one will not die.

4: 雷公曰：官五色奈何？黃帝曰：青黑為痛，黃赤為熱，白為寒，是謂五官。 Lei Gong said: What about the five organs? Huang Di said: Green and black are for pain, yellow and red are for fever, white is for cold. These are the five organs.

5: 雷公曰：病之益甚，與其方衰，如何？黃帝曰：外內皆在焉。切其脈口，滑小緊以沉者，病益甚，在中；人迎氣大緊以浮者，其病益甚，在外。其脈口浮滑者，病日進；人迎沉而滑者，病日損。其脈口滑以沉者，病日進，在內；其人迎脈滑盛以浮者，其病日進，在外。脈之浮沉及人迎與寸口氣小大等者，病難已；病之在藏，沉而大者，易已，小為逆；病在府，浮而大者，其病易已。人迎盛堅者，傷於寒，氣口盛堅者，傷於食。 Lei Gong said: The illness is very severe. Should I let it decline? Huang Di replied: It's both inside and outside. If you cut the pulse groove and find that it is shallow, tight, and sinking, the illness is more severe within; if when you greet the breath it is large and tight, indicating that the illness is more severe externally. If the pulse groove is shallow and sinking but still smooth, the illness will progress daily and be internal; if when you greet the breath the pulse is deep and smooth, the illness will progress daily and be external. When the pulse is shallow and sinking but still smooth, the illness will progress daily and be internal; when you greet the pulse and it is deep and smooth with abundance, indicating that the illness is more severe externally, its course will progress daily and be external. If the float and sink of the pulse or the fullness and tightness of the breath at the inch point indicate difficulty, the illness is incurable; if the illness is in the storehouse and deep with abundance, it is easier to cure and smaller in extent; if the illness is in the office and shallow with abundance, it will be easier to cure. If you greet the breath and find it full and firm, you have harmed yourself with cold; if when you greet the breath it is large and firm at the mouth of the breath, you have harmed yourself with food.

6: 雷公曰：以色言食之間甚，奈何？黃帝曰：其色麤以明，沉夭者為甚，其色上行者，病益甚；其色下行，如雲徹散者，病方已。五色各有藏部，有外部有內部也。色從外部走內部者，其病從外走內；其色從內走外者，其病從內走外。病生於內者，先治其陰，後治其陽，反者益甚。其病生於陽者，先治其外，後治其內，反者益甚。其脈滑大，以代而長者，病從外來，目有所見，志有所惡，此陽氣之並也，可變而已。 Lei Gong said: Regarding the use of color and flavor, what should be done? Huang Di replied: The color can be used to clarify, but if it is too deep or sinking, there will be a problem; the color moving upward means that the disease is getting worse; the color moving downward is like dispersing clouds, meaning the disease has improved. Each of the five colors has a hidden and an outer part. The color comes from the outer part to the inner part, indicating that the disease comes from the outside to the inside; the color coming from the inner part to the outer part indicates that the disease comes from the inside to the outside. If the disease arises from the inside, first treat the yin and then treat the yang; if it is reversed, it will become worse. If the disease arises from the yang, first treat the outside and then treat the inside; if it is reversed, it will become worse. If the pulse is slippery and large and prolonged, indicating that the disease comes from the outside, there are visible symptoms and aversion to something, this is the confluence of Yang Qi and can be transformed.

7: 雷公曰：小子聞風者，百病之始也；厥逆者，寒濕之起也，別之奈何？黃帝曰：常候闕中，薄澤為風，沖濁為痺。在地為厥。此其常也；各以其色言其病。 Lei Gong said: Little one, hearing the sound of wind is the beginning of a hundred diseases; perverse persons are born from cold and dampness. How can they be separated? The Yellow Emperor said: Constantly attend to the pulse in the guiding vessels, distinguish the light and heavy pulses as wind and cold. In the body, there are those that are always present. One can speak of their illnesses through their colors.

8: 雷公曰：人不病卒死，何以知之？黃帝曰：大氣入于藏府者，不病而卒死矣。雷公曰：病小愈而卒死者，何以知之？黃帝曰：赤色出兩顴，大如拇指者，病雖小愈，必卒死。黑色出於庭，大如拇指，必不病而卒死。 Master Lü said: How do we know when a person will die without falling ill? The Emperor said: Qi enters the viscera, and one can die without being ill. Master Lü said: When someone who is sick recovers but still dies, how do we know this? The Emperor said: If there is a red spot the size of a grain of rice appearing in two places, the person will recover from the illness but surely die. If there is a black spot the size of a grain of rice appearing in the courtyard, the person will surely die without being ill.

9: 雷公再拜曰：善哉！其死有期乎？黃帝曰：察色以言其時。雷公曰：善乎！願卒聞之。黃帝曰：庭者，首面也；闕上者，咽喉也；闕中者，肺也；下極者，心也；直下者，肝也；肝左者，膽也；下者，脾也；方上者，胃也；中央者，大腸也；挾大腸者，腎也；當腎者，臍也；面王以上者，小腸也，面王以下者，膀胱子處也；顴者，肩也；顴後者，臂也；臂下者，手也；目內眥上者，膺乳也；挾繩而上者，背也；循牙車以下者，股也；中央者，膝也；膝以下者，脛也；當脛以下者，足也；巨分者，股裏也；巨屈者，膝臏也。此五藏六府肢節之部也，各有部分。有部分，用陰和陽，用陽和陰，當明部分，萬舉萬當。能別左右，是謂大道；男女異位，故曰陰陽。審察澤夭，謂之良工。 Lei gong again paid his respects and said, Excellent! Is there a set time for death? The Yellow Emperor said, By observing the color and timing, one can determine the time. Lei gong said, Good! I would like to hear it again. The Yellow Emperor said, The courtyard is the forehead; the upper part of the gateway is the throat; the inside of the gateway is the lungs; the lower extreme is the heart; the directly below is the liver; the left of the liver is the gallbladder; below is the spleen; the upper part is the stomach; the center is the large intestine; holding the large intestine is the kidney; in front of the kidney is the pancreas; above the face of the face is the small intestine, and below the face of the bladder is the bladder; the shoulder is the shoulder; behind the shoulder is the arm; below the arm is the hand; the inner corner of the eye upwards is the armpit; holding the tendon and going up is the back; below the teeth grinding wheel is the thigh; the center is the knee; below the knee is the shin; at the bottom of the shank is the foot; the large division is the groin; the large bend is the knee; these are the joints of the limbs and parts of the five viscera and six ministries. Each has its own part. Having parts, using yin and yang, using yang and yin, understanding the parts, everything is clear. Being able to distinguish left and right is called the Great Way; men and women have different positions, so it is called yin and yang. Examining the muscles and tendons, it is called a skillful craftsman.

10: 沉濁為內，浮澤為外。黃赤為風，青黑為痛，白為寒，黃而膏潤為膿，赤甚者為血痛，甚為攣，寒甚為皮不仁。五色各見其部，察其浮沉，以知淺深；察其澤夭，以觀成敗；察其散搏，以知遠近；視色上下，以知病處；積神於心，以知往今。故相氣不微，不知是非，屬意勿去，乃知新故。色明不麤，沉天為甚，不明不澤，其病不甚。其色散，駒駒然，未有聚；其病散而氣痛，聚未成也。 The sunken is within, the swollen is without. Yellow and red are wind, green and black are pain, white is cold. Yellow and slippery is pus, reddish and severe is bleeding, much is straining, very cold is skin not tender. The five colors each see their part, examine their sunken and swollen, to know shallow or deep; examine their decayed, to observe success or failure; examine their scattered and contracted, to know near or far; look at the color above and below, to know where the disease is; accumulate the mind in the heart, to know past and present. Thus not knowing if it's correct or incorrect, belong to intention, do not depart from it, then know new matters. The clear colors are not confused, sunken too much, not clear or swollen, the disease will not be serious. The color is scattered, hurriedly, not yet gathered; the disease is scattered and pain in the breath, not yet gathered.

11: 腎乘心，心先病，腎為應，色皆如是。 The kidney governs the heart, and the heart is affected first when sickness occurs; the kidney responds to changes, and all appearances are similarly so.

12: 男子色在于面王，為小腹痛；下為卵痛；其圜直為莖痛，高為本，下為首，狐疝㿉陰之屬也。女子在于面王，為膀胱子處之病，散為痛，搏為聚，方員左右，各如其色形。其隨而下至胝，為淫，有潤如膏狀，為暴食不潔。 For males, pain in the color area is due to the face king. Below it is pain from the egg, and its directness represents the pain of the penis, highness represents the root, below which is the head, and it belongs to the fox tail and yin. For females, it is in the color area and is due to the bladder's lower position disease, scattered as pain, contracted as gathering, with both sides looking like its shape and form. As it descends to the lower abdomen, it represents lust, with lubrication resembling a state of excess, representing excessive eating and lack of cleanliness.

13: 左為左，右為右。其色有邪，聚散而不端，面色所指者也。色者，青黑赤白黃，皆端滿有別鄉。別鄉赤者，其色赤，大如榆莢，在面王為不日。其色上銳，首空上向，下銳下向，在左右如法。以五色命藏，青為肝，赤為心，白為肺，黃為脾，黑為腎。肝合筋，心合脈，肺合皮，脾合肉，腎合骨也。 Left is left, right is right. Its color has evil, gathering and dispersing without being in order, it refers to the complexion. The colors are green, black, red, white, and yellow, all of which have their own distinct origins. The origin of red is the color red, as large as a reed sprout, located at the king's forehead. Its color is sharp upward, and empty space downward, situated left and right in accordance with law. By commanding the five colors, green represents the liver, red represents the heart, white represents the lungs, yellow represents the spleen, and black represents the kidneys. The liver merges with tendons, the heart merges with vessels, the lungs merge with skin, the spleen merges with flesh, and the kidneys merge with bones.

docs.title: 論勇
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問於少俞曰：有人於此，并行并立，其年之長少等也，衣之厚薄均也，卒然遇烈風暴雨，或病或不病，或皆病，或皆不病，其故何也？少俞曰：帝問何急？黃帝曰：願盡聞之。少俞曰：春青風夏陽風，秋涼風，冬寒風。凡此四時之風者，其所病各不同形。 Emperor Yellow asked Shao Yong, There are people in this situation, walking and standing side by side. Their ages vary, as do the thickness of their clothes. If they suddenly encounter a fierce wind or heavy rain, some may be sick, some may not be sick, some may all be sick, and some may all not be sick. What is the reason for this? Shao Yong said, Emperor, what is urgent? The Emperor said, I wish to hear it all. Shao Yong said, In spring, there is a green wind; in summer, there is a summer wind; in autumn, there is an autumn wind; and in winter, there is a cold wind. Each of these winds at different times causes diseases with different shapes.

2: 黃帝曰：四時之風，病人如何？少俞曰：黃色薄皮弱肉者，不勝春之虛風；白色薄皮弱肉者，不勝夏之虛風；青色薄皮弱肉，不勝秋之虛風；赤色薄皮弱肉，不勝冬之虛風也。黃帝曰：黑色不病乎？少俞曰：黑色而皮厚肉堅，固不傷於四時之風；其皮薄而肉不堅，色不一者，長夏至而有虛風者，病矣。其皮厚而肌肉堅者，長夏至而有虛風，不病矣。其皮厚而肌肉堅者，必重感於寒，外內皆然，乃病。黃帝曰：善。 Yellow Emperor asked: How about a patient in the four seasons? Shao Yong replied: Those with yellow skin, thin flesh, cannot withstand the scantiness of spring wind; those with white skin, thin flesh, cannot withstand the scantiness of summer wind; those with green skin, thin flesh, cannot withstand the scantiness of autumn wind; those with red skin, thin flesh, cannot withstand the scantiness of winter wind. Yellow Emperor asked: What about black skin? Shao Yong replied: Black skin with thick skin and firm flesh are not hurt by the winds of the four seasons; if the skin is thin and the flesh is not firm, and the color is different, in the heat of summer there will be scantiness of wind, and this will result in illness. If the skin is thick and the muscle is firm, in the heat of summer there will be scantiness of wind, but it will not become ill. If the skin is thick and the muscle is firm, one must pay attention to cold, both inside and outside, which will lead to illness. Yellow Emperor said: Good.

3: 黃帝曰：夫人之忍痛與不忍痛者，非勇怯之分也。夫勇士之不忍痛者，見難則前，見痛則止；夫怯士之忍痛者，聞難則恐，遇痛不動。夫勇士之忍痛者，見難不恐，遇痛不動；夫怯士之不忍痛者，見難與痛，目轉面盻，恐不能言，失氣，惊，顏色變化，乍死乍生。余見其然也，不知其何由，願聞其故。少俞曰：夫忍痛與不忍痛者，皮膚之薄厚，肌肉之堅脆，緩急之分也，非勇怯之謂也。 Yellow Emperor said: The difference between one who can bear pain and one who cannot bear pain is not due to courage. For the brave, when they see danger, they move forward; when they see pain, they stop. For the cowardly, even if they can bear pain, upon hearing of danger, they are afraid; upon encountering pain, they do not move. For the brave who can bear pain, they are not afraid upon seeing danger and do not move upon encountering pain. For the cowardly who cannot bear pain, they turn their heads in fright, unable to speak, losing breath, being startled, and their complexions change, alternating between near death and life. I have seen this myself, but I do not know why it happens; I wish to hear its cause. Shaohao said: The ability to bear pain and the inability to bear pain are due to the thinness or thickness of the skin and the firmness or flexibility of the muscles, rather than a matter of courage.

4: 黃帝曰：願聞勇怯之所由然。少俞曰：勇士者，目深以固，長沖直揚，三焦理橫，其心端直，其肝大以堅，其膽滿以傍，怒則氣盛而胸張，肝舉而膽橫，眥裂而目揚，毛起而面蒼，此勇士之由然者也。 Yellow Emperor said: I wish to hear about what makes the courageous. Shaohao said: A courageous person has deep insight, long sight, and a straight back. Their heart is honest and upright, their liver is large and firm, their gall bladder is full and assertive. When they are angry, their energy surges and their chest expands, their liver raises and their gall bladder extends, their pupils dilate and their eyes widen, their hairs stand up and their face turns pale. This is what makes a courageous person.

5: 黃帝曰：願聞怯士之所由然。少俞曰：怯士者，目大而不減，陰陽相失，其焦理，縱𩩲𩨗短而小，肝系緩，其膽不滿而縱，腸胃挺，脅下空，雖方大怒，氣不能滿其胸，肝肺雖舉，氣衰復下，故不能久怒，此怯士之所由然者也。 Yellow Emperor said: I wish to hear about the cause of timidity. Shao Yong said: Timidity refers to one's gaze being large and not reducing, yin and yang not harmonizing, deficient in the orifices' regulation. Although the liver is connected to the gallbladder, the gallbladder does not fill up, the intestines are tense, the lower abdomen is empty, even though the anger is great, the qi cannot fill their chests. The liver and lungs may lift, but the qi declines again, which is why they cannot sustain their anger. This is the cause of timidity

6: 黃帝曰：怯士之得酒，怒不避勇士者，何藏使然？少俞曰：酒者，水谷之精，熟谷之液也，其氣慓悍，其入于胃中，則胃脹，氣上逆，滿於胸中，肝浮膽橫，當是之時，固比于勇士，氣衰則悔。與勇士同類，不知避之，名曰酒悖也。 Yellow Emperor said: If timid men can get drunk and angry warriors cannot avoid it, why is this so? Shao Yong said: Alcohol is the essence of grains, the liquid of ripe grains. When its energy acts wildly, it enters the stomach. The stomach becomes bloated, the energy rises upward, filling the chest. The liver and gallbladder become distended, and at that time it is comparable to warriors. When the energy declines, there will be regret. Warriors of the same class, not knowing how to avoid this, are called wine perverseness.

docs.title: 背腧
docs.text: 1: 黃帝問于歧伯曰：願聞五藏之腧，出於背者。歧伯曰：背中大腧，在杼骨之端，肺腧在三焦之間，心腧在五焦之間，膈腧在七焦之間，肝腧在九焦之間，脾腧在十一焦之間，腎腧在十四焦之間。皆挾脊相去三寸所，則欲得而驗之，按其處，應在中而痛解，乃其輸也。灸之則可刺之則不可。氣盛則寫之，虛則補之。以火補者，毋吹其火，須自滅也；以火寫之，疾吹其火，傳其艾，須其火滅也。 Emperor Yellow asked Duke of Shou: I want to hear about the five viscera that emerge from the back. Duke of Shou said: The large intestine is in the middle of the back, between the juncture of the spine and the lung channel; the heart is in the middle of the five channels, between the lung and the large intestine channel; the stomach is in the middle of the seven channels, between the spleen and the heart channel; the liver is in the middle of the nine channels, between the gallbladder and the spleen channel; the spleen is in the middle of the eleven channels, between the stomach and the kidney channel; the kidney is in the middle of the fourteen channels, between the bladder and the liver channel. If you press them all at the place where they are tethered to the spine, about three inches away, and you want to test them, then press the location, and it should hurt and resolve in the middle, which indicates an outflow. Acupuncture is possible, but moxibustion is not. If there is fullness, use moxibustion; if there is emptiness, use supplementation. If you use fire to supplement, do not blow on the fire, it must extinguish itself; if you use fire to drain, blow the fire quickly and pass the aphis, make sure the fire goes out.

docs.title: 衛氣
docs.text:
1: 黃帝曰：五藏者，所以藏精神魂魄者也；六府者，所以受水谷而行化物者也。其氣內干五藏，而外絡肢節。其浮氣之不循經者，為衛氣；其精氣之行於經者，為營氣。陰陽相隨，外內相貫，如環之無端。亭亭淳淳乎，孰能竊之。然其分別陰陽，皆有標本虛實所離之處。能別陰陽十二經者，知病之所生；候虛實之所在者，能得病之高下；知六府之氣街者，能知解結契紹於門戶；能知虛石之堅軟者，知補寫之所在；能知六經標本者，可以無惑於天下。 The Yellow Emperor said: The Five Organs are where the spirit and soul reside; the Six Departments are where the transformation of water and grain occurs. Its Qi is internally stored in the five organs, while its tendons and joints are externally connected. The floating Qi that does not follow the channels serves as defense Qi; the circulating Qi within the channels serves as nourishing Qi. Yin and Yang follow each other, and the internal and external influence each other, like a circle without end. Pure and unblemished, who could dare to steal it? However, dividing Yin and Yang has its basis for true and false, which can distinguish between health and disease. Knowing the twelve channels of Yin and Yang can identify the source of illness; understanding where virtuality is located can discern high and low states of illness; knowing the Six Departments' Qi flow can understand the treatment and resolution of knots at doors; knowing the firmness and softness of the empty stone can identify supplements and tonics; and knowing the six channels' foundation can eliminate confusion throughout the world.

2: 歧伯曰：博哉！聖帝之論。臣請盡意悉言之。足太陽之本，在限以上五寸中，標在兩絡命門。命門者，目也。足少陽之本，在竅陰之間，標在窗籠之前。窗籠者，耳也。足少陰之本，在內踝下上三寸中，標在背輸與舌下兩脈也。足厥陰之本，在行間上五寸所，標在背腧也。足陽明之本，在厲兌，標在人迎，頰挾頏顙也。足太陰之本，在中封前上四寸之中，標在背腧與舌本也。 The Duke said: It is profound! The discourse of the sacred Emperor. I request that you explain this thoroughly to me. The foot Jueyin is located in the upper 5 cun of the Mingmen, marked at the front of the anus. The Mingmen is the eye. The foot Shaoyang is located between the Guan and marked at the front of the window shade. The window shade is the ear. The foot Shaoyin is located in the lower 3 cun of the Yujiapoint, marked at the Sanjiao and Jueyinshu points. The Sanjiao point is the tongue. The foot Taiyin is located in the upper 5 cun of the Guan, marked at the Bladder channel and Congpoint. The foot Yangming is located at the Mingmen, marked at the Renying, between the lips and the cheek. The foot Yinwei is located in the middle 4 cun of the Zhongming, marked at the Bladder channel and Jingwell point.

3: 手太陽之本，在外踝之後，標在命門之上一寸也。手少陽之本，在小指次指之間上二寸，標在耳後上角下外眥也。手陽明之本，在肘骨中，上至別陽，標在顏下合鉗上也。手太陰之本，在寸口之中，標在腋內動也。手少陰之本，在銳骨之端，標在背腧也。手心主之本，在掌後兩筋之間二寸中，標在腋下下三寸也。 The location of the hand Jupiter is at the root of the thumb, above the heel of the little finger, an inch away. The location of the hand Venus is between the small and index fingers, two inches up from the base of the ear on the outer canthus of the eye. The location of the hand Radiant is in the hollow of the elbow, reaching to the tip of the arm, at the crease below the jaw. The location of the hand Mysterious is in the hollow under the armpit. The location of the hand Receptive is at the tip of the spine, beneath the buttock. The location of the hand Conception is between the tendons of the palm, two inches away from the hollow below the armpit.

4: 凡候此者，下虛則厥，下盛則熱；上虛則眩，上盛則熱痛。故石者，絕而止之，虛者，引而起之。 For this ailment, if the qi is deficient below, there will be cold; if it is excessive below, there will be fever. If the qi is deficient above, there will be dizziness; if it is excessive above, there will be fever pain. Therefore, for stone, one must stop and expel it, and for the empty (deficiency), one must regulate and lift it up.

Note: This translation is based on the context of traditional Chinese medicine, which considers imbalances in qi (vital energy) as the root cause of various health conditions. The text appears to describe symptoms related to a specific illness or condition and suggests corresponding treatment approaches.

5: 請言氣街，胸氣有街，腹氣有街，頭氣有街，脛氣有街。故氣在頭者，止之於腦；氣在胸者，止之膺與背腧；氣在腹者，止之背腧，與沖脈於臍左右之動脈者；氣在脛者，止之於氣街，與承山踝上以下。取此者，用毫鍼，必先按而在久應於手，乃刺而予之。所治者，頭痛眩仆，腹痛中滿暴脹，及有新積。痛可移者，易已也；積不痛，難已也。 The text in literary Chinese describes the principles and techniques of acupuncture for treating various conditions. It translates to:

Ask for the qi on the street, chest qi has a street, abdominal qi has a street, head qi has a street, hip qi has a street. Since the qi is in the head, stop it at the brain; when the qi is in the chest, stop it at the diaphragm and back muscles; when the qi is in the abdomen, stop it at the diaphragm and connect with the great vessel at the left and right lower abdominal dynamic vessels; when the qi is at the hip, stop it on the qi street and connect with the gathering mountain on the soles of the feet. To treat this condition, use a needle and first press with the probe, and if it lasts for a long time, it will be effective in the hand. Those to be treated are headaches and dizziness, abdominal pain and fullness, and swelling and hardness. Pain that can move is easily cured; swelling without pain is difficult to cure.

docs.title: 論痛
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問于少俞曰：筋骨之強弱，肌肉之堅脆，皮膚之厚薄，腠理之疏密，各不同，其于鍼石火焫之痛何如？腸胃之厚薄堅脆亦不等，其於毒藥何如？願盡聞之。少俞曰：人之骨強、筋弱、肉緩、皮膚厚者，耐痛，其于鍼石之痛火焫亦然。 Emperor Yellow asked Shao Yong: The strength and weakness of tendons and bones, the firmness and brittleness of muscles, the thickness and thinness of skin, the sparseness and density of sinews - each is different. How does this apply to pain from needles, stones, and fire? The intestines and stomach are also not uniform in thickness, firmness, and brittleness. How does this apply to poisonous medicines? Please instruct me on this matter. Shao Yong said: In humans, those with strong bones, weak tendons, soft muscles, and thick skin can withstand pain. This applies to pain from needles, stones, and fire as well.

2: 黃帝曰：其耐火焫者，何以知之？少俞答曰：加以黑色而美骨者，耐火焫。黃帝曰：其不耐鍼石之痛者，何以知之？少俞曰：堅肉薄皮者，不耐鍼石之痛，於火焫亦然。 Yellow Emperor said: How do I know if something can withstand fire? Shao Yong replied: Apply a black coating to it when it is beautiful, and it can withstand fire. Yellow Emperor said: How do I know if something cannot withstand the pain of being pierced by a sharp object? Shao Yong said: Something with tough flesh and thin skin cannot withstand the pain of being pierced by a sharp object; it is the same when it comes to withstanding fire.

3: 黃帝曰：人之病，或同時而傷，或易已，或難已，其故何如？少俞曰：同時而傷，其身多熱者，易已；多寒者，難已。 Yellow Emperor asked: In the case of human illness, it can be simultaneous injury, already easy to cure, or difficult to cure. What are the reasons for this? Shao Yong replied: In the case of simultaneous injury, if there are many cases of fever, it is easily cured; if there are many cases of cold, it is difficult to cure.

4: 黃帝曰：人之勝毒，何以知之？少俞曰：胃厚、色黑、大骨及肥者，皆勝毒；故其瘦而薄胃者，皆不勝毒也。 Yellow Emperor asked: How do you know that humans overcome toxicity? Shao Yong said: Those who have a thick stomach, black complexion, large bones, and are plump all overcome toxicity; therefore, those who become thin and have a weak stomach do not overcome toxicity.

docs.title: 天年
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問于歧伯曰：願聞人之始生，何氣築為基，何立而為楯，何失而死，何得而生？歧伯曰：以母為基，以父為楯；失神者死，得神者生也。 Yellow Emperor asked Yi Bo: I wish to hear about the beginning of human life. What kind of energy laid the foundation? What established the framework? What causes death? What leads to rebirth? Yi Bo replied: The mother serves as the foundation and the father serves as the framework; losing one's spirit results in death, gaining one's spirit results in life.

2: 黃帝曰：何者為神？歧伯曰：血氣已和，營衛已通，五藏已成，神氣舍心，魂魄畢具，乃成為人。 Yellow Emperor asked: What is the nature of the spirit? Huzi replied: When the blood and Qi are balanced, the Wei and Yang are connected, the five organs have formed, the spirit Qi has left the heart, and the souls and bodies have completed their forms, one will become a human.

3: 黃帝曰：人之壽夭各不同，或夭壽，或卒死，或病久，願聞其道。歧伯曰：五藏堅固，血脈和調，肌肉解利，皮膚致密，營衛之行，不失其常，呼吸微徐，氣以度行，六府化穀，津液布揚，各如其常，故能長久。 Emperor Yellow said: The lifespan of people varies, and they may die prematurely, pass away, or suffer for a long time. I wish to hear about the way to prevent this. Master Huan said: When the five viscera are firmly established, blood vessels are harmonious and balanced, muscles are relaxed and tender, skin is tight and smooth, vital defense functions operate properly, breathing is gentle, qi adjusts accordingly, grains are transformed in the six organs, fluids are evenly distributed, all functions function as usual, thus one can live long.

4: 黃帝曰：人之壽百歲而死，何以致之？歧伯曰：使道隧以長，基牆高以方，通調營衛，三部三里起，骨高肉滿，百歲乃得終。 Yellow Emperor said: People live a hundred years and die, what causes this? Duke of Zhou replied: By practicing the way, one can prolong life; by establishing high foundations and making adjustments, create a regulated environment with three departments within three miles. With strong bones and well-nourished muscles, reaching a hundred years will be possible.

5: 黃帝曰：其氣之盛衰，以至其死，可得聞乎？歧伯曰：人生十歲，五藏始定，血氣已通，其氣在下，故好走；二十歲，血氣始盛肌肉方長，故好趨；三十歲，五藏大定，肌肉堅固，血脈盛滿，故好步；四十歲，五藏六府十二經脈，皆大盛以平定，腠理始疏，滎貨頹落，髮頗斑白，平盛不搖，故好坐；五十歲，肝氣始衰，肝葉始薄，膽汁始減，目始不明；六十歲，心氣始衰，若憂悲，血氣懈惰，故好臥；七十歲，脾氣虛，皮膚枯；八十歲，肺氣衰，魄離，故言善誤；九十歲，腎氣焦，四藏經脈空虛；百歲，五藏皆虛，神氣皆去，形骸獨居而終矣。 Yellow Emperor said: Can someone tell me about the ebb and flow of vital energy leading to one's death? Master Qiao replied: At age ten, the five organs start to form, blood and qi circulate freely, vital energy is concentrated in the lower body, making people fond of walking. At age twenty, blood and qi become abundant, muscles grow strong, so people love movement. At age thirty, the five organs are fully formed, muscles are solid, and blood vessels are full, making people enjoy walking. At age forty, the five organs, six viscera, twelve primary channels, and seventy-two thousand meridian vessels all reach their peak, regulating functions become clear, essential substances accumulate, hair turns white, the body is well-balanced but not shaky, so people like to sit. At age fifty, liver qi starts declining, liver tendons start to weaken, bile decreases, vision becomes unclear. At age sixty, heart qi starts declining, one may become sad or grieving, blood stagnates, making people fond of lying down. At age seventy, spleen qi is deficient, skin becomes dry. At age eighty, lung qi declines, soul departs, so speech becomes confused. At age ninety, kidney qi is burnt, the five organs and their channels are empty and void; at a hundred, all five organs are empty, vital energy is gone, and the body remains alone until death.

6: 黃帝曰：其不能終壽而死者，何如？歧伯曰：其五藏皆不堅，使道不長，空外以張，喘息暴疾；又卑基牆薄，脈少血，其肉不石，數中風寒，血氣虛，脈不通，真邪相攻，亂而相引，故中壽而盡也。 Yellow Emperor asked, What about those who cannot reach the end of their life and die? Huang Di said: Their five organs are not solid, causing the Dao to be short-lived. The exterior is flabby, there is wheezing and rapid breathing; furthermore, the foundation of the kidneys is weak and shallow, with little blood in the pulse, their muscles do not firm up, they often contract illnesses of wind and cold, their vital energy is deficient, the pulse is not connected, true and false forces attack each other, causing confusion and mutual attraction. Therefore, they die in the middle of their life.

docs.title: 逆順
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問于伯高曰：余聞氣有逆順，脈有盛衰，刺有大約，可得聞乎？伯高曰：氣之逆順者，所以應天地陰陽四時五行也；脈之盛衰者，所以候血氣之虛實有餘不足；刺之大約者，必明知病之可刺，與其未可刺，與其已不可刺也。 Emperor Yellow asked Confucius: I have heard that there is a change of Yin and Yang, the rise and fall of the pulse, and the large and small needles, can you hear about it? Confucius said: The change of Yin and Yang in Qi is related to the adaptation to heaven, earth, yin and yang, and the four seasons and five elements; the rise and fall of the pulse are related to the diagnosis of blood and qi, whether there is abundance or deficiency. The large and small needles refer to understanding the disease and knowing when to use acupuncture, distinguishing between when it can be used and when it cannot be used, and when it has already been too late for acupuncture.

2: 黃帝曰：候之奈何？伯高曰：兵法曰無迎逢逢之氣，無擊堂堂之陣。刺法曰：無刺熇熇之熱，無刺漉漉之汗，無刺渾渾之脈，無刺病與脈相逆者。 Yellow Emperor asked: What about waiting? Duke of Zhou said: The art of war is to not meet the enemy head-on, and the art of needles is to not pierce with a burning heat, not pierce with a sweating dew, not pierce with a full pulse, and not pierce in those who have a sickness that contradicts their pulse.

3: 黃帝曰：候其可刺奈何？伯高曰：上工，刺其未生者也；其次，刺其未盛者也；其次，刺其已衰者也。下工，刺其方襲者也；與其形之盛者也；與其病之與脈相逆者也。故曰：方其盛也，勿敢毀傷，刺其已衰，事必大昌。故曰：上工治未病，不治已病，此之謂也。 Yellow Emperor asked, What about puncturing at the right moment? Duke of Zhou replied, In major cases, it is appropriate to puncture before the growth; in secondary cases, after the growth but before the decline; and in tertiary cases, after the decline. In minor cases, puncture only when there are specific signs. Along with the signs of the constitution, do not dare to injure at the moment of abundance; if puncturing after decline, one can achieve great success. Thus, he said, At the time of abundance, do not dare to damage, and puncture after decline, and it will surely be a great achievement. Duke of Zhou added, In major cases, treating before the onset of disease, and not treating after the onset of disease, this is what I mean.

docs.title: 五味
docs.text:
1: 黃帝曰：願聞穀氣有五味，其入五藏，分別奈何？伯高曰：胃者，五藏六府之海也，水穀皆入于胃，五藏六府，皆稟氣於胃。五味各走其所喜，穀味酸，先走肝，穀味苦，先走心，穀味甘，先走脾，穀味辛，先走肺，穀味咸，先走腎。穀氣津液已行，營衛大通，乃化糟粕，以次傳下。 Yellow Emperor said: I wish to hear about the five flavors of grain energy and how they enter the five organs and are distributed. Duke Mu replied: The stomach, which is the sea of the five organs and six palaces, is where all grains enter. All grains nourish the qi in the stomach. Each flavor goes to its preferred location. The flavor of grain sour first moves to the liver; the flavor of grain bitter first moves to the heart; the flavor of grain sweet first moves to the spleen; the flavor of grain pungent first moves to the lungs; and the flavor of grain salty first moves to the kidneys. Once the grain energy and fluids have moved, the defensive and nutritive qi circulate freely, transforming dregs and excreting waste.

2: 黃帝曰：營衛之行奈何？伯高曰：穀始入于胃，其精微者，先出於胃之兩焦，以溉五藏，別出兩行，營衛之道。其大氣之搏而不行者，積於胸中，命曰氣海，出於肺，循咽喉，故呼則出，吸則入。天地之精氣，其大數常出三入一，故穀不入，半日則氣衰，一日則氣少矣。 Yellow Emperor asked: How about the exercise of the military and the palace? Bo Gao replied: The grain first enters the stomach, its subtle essence comes out from the two parts of the stomach, irrigates the five viscera, and forms two channels of the exercise. Those who have difficulty in their great Qi do not move, accumulate in the chest, command called Qi sea, coming out from the lungs, flowing through the throat, so that when one exhales it comes out and when one inhales it comes in. The vital qi of heaven and earth, its large numbers are constantly emitted from three places and enter into one, therefore grain does not enter, half a day then the qi declines, and one day the qi is deficient.

3: 黃帝曰：穀之五味，可得聞乎？伯高曰：請盡言之。五穀：糠米甘，麻酸，大豆咸，麥苦，黃黍辛。五果：棗甘，李酸，栗咸，杏苦，桃辛。五畜：牛甘，犬酸，豬咸，羊苦，雞辛。五菜：葵甘，韭酸，藿咸，薤苦，蔥辛。 Yellow Emperor said: Can one hear about the five flavors of grain? Duke of Zhou replied: Please tell me in detail. Five grains: millet is sweet, sorghum is sour, soybeans are salty, wheat is bitter, and barley is pungent. Five fruits: date palm is sweet, pear is sour, chestnut is salty, apricot is bitter, and peach is pungent. Five livestock: cow is sweet, dog is sour, pig is salty, sheep is bitter, and chicken is pungent. Five vegetables: lettuce is sweet, celery is sour, mustard greens are salty, chrysanthemum greens are bitter, and scallions are pungent.

4: 五色：黃色宜甘，青色宜酸，黑色宜咸，赤色宜苦，白色宜辛。凡此五者，各有所宜。五宜所言五色者，脾病者，宜食糠米飯，牛肉棗葵；心病者，宜食麥羊肉杏薤；腎病者，宜食大豆黃卷豬肉栗藿；肝病者，宜食麻犬肉李韭；肺病者，宜食黃黍雞肉桃蔥。 Five colors: yellow is suitable for sweet, green is suitable for sour, black is suitable for salty, red is suitable for bitter, and white is suitable for pungent. Each of the five has its proper match. The five suits refer to the five colors, and those with a spleen disorder should eat millet rice, beef, walnuts, and kale; those with a heart disorder should eat barley, mutton, apricot kernels, and cassia; those with a kidney disorder should eat soybeans, yellow noodles, pork, and knotweed; those with a liver disorder should eat sesame, dog meat, and loquat leaves and scallions; those with a lung disorder should eat glutinous rice, chicken, peaches, and garlic chives.

5: 五禁：肝病禁辛，心病禁咸，脾病禁酸，腎病禁甘，肺病禁苦。 Five Restrictions: For liver disease, avoid pungent foods; for heart disease, avoid salty foods; for spleen disease, avoid sour foods; for kidney disease, avoid sweet foods; for lung disease, avoid bitter foods.

6: 肝色青，宜食甘，糠米飯、牛肉、棗、葵皆甘。心色赤，宜食酸，犬肉、麻、李、韭皆酸。脾黃色，宜食咸，大豆、豬肉、栗、藿皆咸。肺白色，宜食苦，麥、羊肉、杏、薤皆苦。腎色黑，宜食辛，黃黍、雞肉、桃、蔥皆辛。 Liver is associated with the color green, and foods that are sweet are beneficial. Such as rice gruel, beef, dates, chrysanthemums are all sweet. Heart is associated with the color red, and sour foods are beneficial. Dog meat, sesame, apricots, scallions are all sour. Spleen is associated with the color yellow, and salty foods are beneficial. Beans, pork, chestnuts, mint are all salty. Lung is associated with the color white, and bitter foods are beneficial. Wheat, mutton, apricot kernels, cicely are all bitter. Kidney is associated with the color black, and spicy foods are beneficial. Millet, chicken, peaches, garlic are all spicy.

docs.title: 水脹
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問于歧伯曰：水與膚脹、鼓脹、腸覃、石瘕、石水，何以別之？歧伯答曰：水始起也，目窠上微腫，如新臥起之狀，其頸脈動，時咳，陰股間寒，足脛腫，腹乃大，其水已成矣。以手按其腹，隨手而起，如裹水之狀，此其候也。 The Yellow Emperor asked Qi Bo, How do you distinguish between edema of the skin, abdomen, intestines, stones, and fluids? Qi Bo replied, When water first begins to emerge, there is a slight swelling at the root of the tongue, like the state after lying down, the pulse in the throat is palpitating, there is occasional coughing, coldness in the genital area, the shins are swollen, the abdomen is distended, and the fluid has formed. Pressing the abdomen with the hand, it rises with the hand movement, like wrapping water, this is the sign.

2: 黃帝曰：膚脹何以候之？歧伯曰：膚脹者，寒氣客於皮膚之間，鼕鼕然不堅，腹大，身盡腫，皮厚，按其腹，窅而不起，腹色不變，此其候也。 Yellow Emperor said: How can one discern a swelling? Huanbo replied: A swelling is caused by cold Qi residing between the skin layers. It feels tender and flabby, the abdomen is distended, the entire body is swollen, the skin is thick, pressing on the abdomen yields a hollow feeling that does not rebound, the abdominal color remains unchanged, this indicates the condition.

3: 鼓脹何如？歧伯曰：腹脹身皆大，大與膚脹等也，色蒼黃，腹筋起，此其候也。 What is the sound of a drum? asked Ziqi. If the skin of the drum is distended, the body will be large, replied Boqi. The size of the distension is similar to the distension of one's skin. The color is blue and yellow. One can see the abdominal muscles rising, which indicates the condition.

4: 腸覃何如？歧伯曰：寒氣客於腸外，與衛氣相搏，氣不得榮，因有所繫，癖而內著，惡氣乃起，瘜肉乃生。其始生也，大如雞卵，稍以益大，至其成，如懷子之狀，久者離歲，按之則堅，推之則移，月事以時下，此其候也。 The condition of the intestines? The Master said: Cold pathogenic factors are located outside the intestines, struggling with defensive Qi, and Qi is not able to ascend, causing a blockage, leading it to become internalized, resulting in the formation of pathogenic factors, leading to the generation of sores. At first, when it arises, it is as large as a chicken egg, gradually increasing in size until it reaches its mature stage, like the state of an embryo. As time passes, it becomes hard and can be felt as a lump, and it moves when pushed; at the appropriate time during menstruation, this is the pattern that manifests.

5: 石瘕何如？歧伯曰：石瘕生於胞中，寒氣客於子門，子門閉塞，氣不得通，惡血當寫不寫，衄以留止，日以益大，狀如懷子，月事不以時下，皆生於女子，可導而下。 Regarding Stone Perniciously (Stone Splenectomy)? Obbo said: Stone Perniciously is conceived in the womb. Cold pathogenic factors enter through the gate of the son, the gate of the son is blocked, Qi cannot circulate freely, blood stagnation cannot be written off, menstrual bleeding continues to increase in size and resembles a fetus, menses do not occur on time, all are generated in women, and can be guided downward.

6: 黃帝曰：膚脹鼓脹，可刺邪？歧伯曰：先寫其脹之血絡，後調其經，刺去其血血絡也。 Yellow Emperor asked: If the skin is swollen and distended, can one puncture the evil? Qi Bo replied: First, write down the channels of the swelling's blood vessels. Then, regulate the channels, and puncture to remove the swollen blood vessels

docs.title: 賊風
docs.text:
1: 黃帝曰：夫子言賊風邪氣之傷人也，令人病焉，今有其不離屏蔽，不出室穴之中，卒然病者，非不離賊風邪氣，其故何也？歧伯曰：此皆嘗有所傷於濕氣，藏於血脈之中，分肉之間，久留而不去。若有所墮墜，惡血在內而不去，卒然喜怒不節，飲食不適，寒溫不時，腠理閉而不通。其開而遇風寒，則血氣凝結，與故邪相襲，則為寒痺。其有熱則汗出，汗出則受風，雖不遇賊風邪氣，必有因加而發焉。 Yellow Emperor said: Master said that the thief of wind and heat harms people, making them sick. Now, one cannot leave the screen and does not come out from the cave-like rooms; what if someone suddenly becomes ill? Is it not due to the thief of wind and heat? Huzi said: It is all because there has been some damage caused by dampness, hidden in the blood vessels, dividing the flesh, and lingering without disappearing. If one falls or collapses, the evil blood does not go away, and one suddenly becomes angry and frustrated, eats inappropriately, does not adjust to hot or cold temperatures, and the channels close up without circulation. Once they open and encounter cold winds, the blood and qi congeal and clash with the old pathogens, which results in cold paralysis. If there is fever, sweat will come out, sweating will catch a cold, even though it does not encounter the thief of wind and heat, it must have a reason for causing it.

2: 黃帝曰：今夫子之所言者，皆病人之所自知也。其毋所遇邪氣，又毋怵惕之所志，卒然而病者，其故何也？唯有因鬼神之事乎？歧伯曰：此亦有故邪留而未發，因而志有所惡，及有所慕，血氣內亂，兩氣相搏。其所從來者微，視之不見，聽而不聞，故似鬼神。 Yellow Emperor said: Whatever Confucius speaks of today, it is all something that a sick person knows themselves. Those who have not encountered deviant qi and do not understand the intentions of the sick person, suddenly fall ill - what is the reason for this? The only possibility is being influenced by ghosts and spirits? Zhou Bo said: There is also an underlying cause that has remained hidden and has not yet manifested. As a result, one's intentions have something they dislike, and something they admire. Blood and qi become chaotic inside, and the two qis struggle against each other. Its origin is subtle, and it cannot be seen when looking at it, nor can it be heard when listening to it, so it seems like ghosts and spirits.

3: 黃帝曰：其祝而已者，其故何也？歧伯曰：先巫者，因知百病之勝，先知其病之所從生者，可祝而已也。 Yellow Emperor said: What is the reason for your offering? Kuafu replied: The senior diviner knows that of the hundred diseases, knowing where they originate from can prevent them. Therefore, I have offered this advice.

docs.title: 移精變氣論
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問曰：余聞古之治病，惟其移精變氣，可祝由而已。今世治病，毒藥治其內，鍼石治其外，或愈或不愈，何也。歧伯對曰：往古人居禽獸之閒，動作以避寒，陰居以避暑，內無眷慕之累，外無伸官之形，此恬憺之世，邪不能深入也。故毒藥不能治其內，鍼石不能治其外，故可移精祝由而已。當今之世不然，憂患緣其內，苦形傷其外，又失四時之從，逆寒暑之宜，賊風數至，虛邪朝夕，內至五藏骨髓，外傷空竅肌膚，所以小病必甚，大病必死，故祝由不能已也。 Yellow Emperor asked: I have heard that in ancient times, treating diseases involved regulating the flow of vital energy, and this was accomplished through the Five Sacred Rituals. Nowadays, we treat diseases by administering toxic medicines internally and using needles and stones externally, with some patients recovering while others do not, why is that? The Duke of Zhou replied: In ancient times, people lived like animals, moving to avoid cold and staying indoors to avoid heat. They had no accumulation of desires within them and no external pressure from officials, which was a time of humility and simplicity. Therefore, diseases could not penetrate deeply, so toxic medicines could not treat internally, and needles and stones could not treat externally. Nowadays, however, illnesses are caused by internal factors and damage the external body, as well as disregarding the proper seasonal treatments of cold and heat. Diseases from malevolent pathogens attack constantly, reaching deep into the five vital organs and bone marrow, as well as damaging the pores, muscles, and skin. This leads to minor illnesses becoming severe, and major illnesses leading to death. Thus, the Five Sacred Rituals cannot be effective anymore

2: 帝曰：善。余欲臨病人，觀死生，決嫌疑，欲知其要，如日月光，可得聞乎。歧伯曰：色脈者，上帝之所貴也，先師之所傳也。上古使僦貸季，理色脈而通神明，合之金木水火土四時八風六合，不離其常，變化相移，以觀其妙，以知其要，欲知其要，則色脈是矣。色以應日，脈以應月，常求其要，則其要也。夫色之變化，以應四時之脈，此上帝之所貴，以合於神明也，所以遠死而近生。生道以長，命曰聖王。中古之治病，至而治之，湯液十日，以去八風五痺之病，十日不已，治以草蘇草荄之枝，本末為助，標本已得，邪氣乃服。暮世之治病也則不然，治不本四時，不知日月，不審逆從，病形已成，乃欲微鍼治其外，湯液治其內，粗工兇兇，以為可攻，故病未已，新病復起。 Emperor: Good. I wish to observe a diseased person, watch life and death, judge suspicion, and want to know the essence, like the light of the sun and moon, can it be heard? Zhi Bó said: The color and pulse are what the ancient sages greatly valued, and they were transmitted down through generations. In ancient times, they understood the color and pulse, combined them with gold, wood, water, and fire of the four seasons and eight winds, not deviating from their nature, changing and moving with transformation, observing its subtleties to know its essence, wanting to know its essence, then the color and pulse are it. The color changes in response to the day, and the pulse changes in response to the moon, constantly seeking its essence, and thus its essence appears. The change of color is in response to the four seasons' pulse, which is what the ancients greatly valued and combined with the spiritual light. This is why they can avoid death and approach life. The way of treating diseases in the middle period was to treat them at their root, after ten days of Tang fluid to eliminate eight winds and five pains of diseases, not stopping for ten days, and then treating them with twigs of grass and weeds, root and branch as assistants, the basis has been established, and the pathogenic qi will be swallowed. In later times, the treatment of diseases is different, not treating at the root of the four seasons, not knowing the sun and moon, not discerning between following and leading, when the disease shape has already formed, they want to treat superficially with needles, and treat internally with Tang fluid, rough workmanship and crudeness, regarding it as possible attack, so the disease is not yet cured, new diseases arise.

3: 帝曰：願聞要道。歧伯曰：治之要極，無失色脈，用之不惑，治之大則。逆從到行，標本不得，亡神失國。去故就新，乃得真人。帝曰：余聞其要於夫子矣，夫子言不離色脈，此余之所知也。歧伯曰：治之極於一。帝曰：何謂一。歧伯曰：一者，因得之。帝曰：奈何。歧伯曰：閉戶塞牖，繫之病者，數問其情，以從其意，得神者昌，失神者亡。帝曰：善。 The emperor said, I wish to hear about the Dao. Boyi replied, Governing it is supreme, without failure of the vital energy, its use does not lead astray, and in governing great matters, one must be reverent. Follow and apply it thoroughly, establish models that cannot be lost, or else the spirit will wander and the country will perish. By abandoning the old and adopting the new, one can attain true humanity. The emperor said, I have heard of its essence from Master Zhou, and Master Zhou does not depart from the vital energy; this is what I know. Boyi replied, Governing it supremely lies in one. The emperor asked, What do you mean by one? Boyi replied, One means obtaining it through cause. The emperor asked, How so? Boyi replied, Close the doors and seal the windows, bind the sick person, ask them repeatedly about their condition, follow their intentions, and those who have the spirit will flourish, while those who lose their spirit will perish. The emperor said, Good.

docs.title: 衛氣失常
docs.text:
1: 黃帝曰：衛氣之留於腹中，搐積不行，菀蘊不得常所，使人支脅胃中滿，喘呼逆息者，何以去之？伯高曰：其氣積於胸中者，上取之，積於腹中者，下取之，上下皆滿者，旁取之。 Yellow Emperor asked: Qi accumulates in the abdomen, causing discomfort and difficulty in movement. The potential is not easily accessible and supports the fullness of the stomach, resulting in shortness of breath and reversed breathing. How can this be addressed? Bo Gao replied: If the qi accumulates in the chest, take it upwards; if it accumulates in the abdomen, take it downwards; if both upper and lower are full, take it from the side.

2: 黃帝曰：取之奈何？伯高對曰：積於上，寫人迎、天突、喉中；積於下者，寫三里與氣街；上下皆滿者，上下取之，與季脅之下一寸；重者，雞足取之。診視其脈大而弦急，及絕不至者，及腹皮急甚者，不可刺也。黃帝曰：善。 Yellow Emperor said: How shall I take it? Bo Gao replied: Accumulate it above, focusing on the Ren Mai, Du Mai, and the pharynx; accumulate it below, focusing on the San Jiao and Qi Jing; when both upper and lower are full, take it from either region, and match it to the depth of the seasonal lesion; if it is heavy, take from the Jiao Sui. If upon examination, the pulse is large and urgent, and not yet resolved, or if there is severe urgency in the abdominal region, do not puncture. Yellow Emperor said: Good.

3: 黃帝問於伯高曰：何以知皮肉氣血筋骨之病也？伯高曰：色起兩眉薄澤者，病在皮；唇色青黃赤白黑者，病在肌肉；營氣濡然者，病在血氣；目色青黃赤白黑者，病在筋；耳焦枯受塵垢，病在骨。 Emperor Yellow asked Bo Gao: How do you know whether a disease is of the skin, flesh, qi, blood, sinews, or bones? Bo Gao replied: If the color changes above the eyebrows, the disease is in the skin; if the lips are colored green, yellow, red, white, and black, the disease is in the muscles; if the qi is damp, the disease is in the blood and qi; if the eye color is green, yellow, red, white, and black, the disease is in the sinews; if the ears are burnt, dried, and dusty, the disease is in the bones.

4: 黃帝曰：病形何如，取之奈何？伯高曰：夫百病變化，不可勝數，然皮有部，肉有柱，血氣有輸，骨有屬。黃帝曰：願聞其故。伯高曰：皮之部，輸於四末；肉之柱，有臂脛諸陽分肉之間，與足少陰分間；血氣之輸，輸於諸絡，氣血留居，則盛而起，筋部無陰無陽，無左無右，候病所在；骨之屬者，骨空之所以受益而益腦髓者也。 Yellow Emperor said: What are the manifestations of diseases, and how to take them? Bo Gao said: There are numerous varieties of a hundred diseases that cannot be counted. However, there are parts of skin, tendons have pillars, blood and qi have channels, and bones have attributes. Yellow Emperor said: I would like to hear about their origins. Bo Gao said: The parts of the skin have channels at the four extremities; the tendon pillars have between the arm-yang division and the leg-shao yin division; the blood and qi channels have channels throughout the body, if blood and qi stay, it will be abundant and rise up. If there are no yin or yang, no left or right, and the disease is in its location; the bones attribute is where empty spaces benefit and improve the brain marrow.

5: 黃帝曰：取之奈何？伯高曰：夫病變化，浮沉深淺，不可勝究，各在其處，病間者淺之，甚者深之，間者小之，甚者眾之，隨變而調氣，故曰上工。 Yellow Emperor said, How should it be done? Bo Gao replied, A disease changes and fluctuates in depth and shallowness, and cannot be fully understood. Each person experiences it differently: those with a mild disease experience a shallow one, while those with severe symptoms experience a deeper one. Those in between may have varying degrees of symptoms depending on the situation. By adapting to the changes and adjusting one's Qi, this is known as 'upright technique.'

6: 黃帝問于伯高曰：人之肥瘦大小溫寒，有老壯少小，別之奈何？伯高對曰：人年五十已上為老，二十已上為壯，十八已上為少，六歲已上為小。 Yellow Emperor asked Confucius: How can one distinguish between the fat, thin, tall and short, old, robust, young and small in humans? Confucius replied: By the age of fifty, a person is considered old; by the age of twenty, they are considered robust; by the age of eighteen, they are considered young; and by the age of six, they are considered small.

7: 黃帝曰：何以度知其肥瘦？伯高曰：人有肥、有膏、有肉。黃帝曰：別此奈何？伯高曰：膕肉堅，皮滿者，肥。膕肉不堅，皮緩者，膏。皮肉不相離者，肉。 The Yellow Emperor said: How can one tell if a person is fat or thin? Bo Gao replied: A person has fat, grease, and flesh. The Yellow Emperor asked: What about the others? Bo Gao said: If the flesh is tough and the skin is full, it is fat. If the flesh is not tough and the skin is loose, it is grease. If the flesh and skin do not separate, it is flesh.

8: 黃帝曰：身之寒溫何如？伯高曰：膏者，其肉淖而麤理者，身寒，細理者，身熱。脂者，其肉堅，細理者熱，麤理者寒。 Yellow Emperor said: How is the body's cold and heat? Bo Gao said: Ointment, if the flesh becomes slimy and smooth, the body feels cold, and if finely powdered, the body feels hot. Tallow, if the flesh becomes hard, finely powdered it feels hot, and smooth it feels cold

9: 黃帝曰：其肥瘦大小奈何？伯高曰：膏者，多氣而皮縱緩，故能縱腹垂腴。肉者，身體容大。脂者，其身收小。 Yellow Emperor asked: What about being fat, thin, large or small? Bo Gao replied: The one who is greased, has a lot of energy and the skin is loose and relaxed, so they can hang their belly and move their buttocks. The one with meat, has a big body shape. The one with fat, has a smaller figure.

10: 黃帝曰：三者之氣血多少何如？伯高曰：膏者，多氣，多氣者，熱，熱者耐寒。肉者，多血則充形，充形則平。脂者，其血清，氣滑少，故不能大。此別於眾人者也。 Yellow Emperor asked: How much are the Qi and blood in these three? Master Gao answered: The lubricant has more Qi, more Qi means warmth, warmth is resistant to cold. The flesh has more blood, which makes the form full, a full form means balance. The fat has blood and essence, Qi is smooth but less, so it cannot expand. This is different from ordinary people.

11: 黃帝曰：眾人奈何？伯高曰：眾人皮肉脂膏，不能相加也，血與氣，不能相多，故其形不小不大，各自稱其身，命曰眾人。 Yellow Emperor said: What about the common people? Duke Mu said: The common people have skin, flesh, fat, and grease, which cannot be added together. Blood and Qi cannot be increased, so their forms are not too tall or too short, each person boasts of his own body, and they are called the common people

12: 黃帝曰：善。治之奈何？伯高曰：必先別其三形，血之多少，氣之清濁，而後調之，治無失常經。是故膏人縱腹垂腴，肉人者，上下容大，脂人者，雖脂不能大者。 Yellow Emperor said: Good. How to regulate it? Duke of Zhou replied: First, differentiate its three forms, the amount of blood, and whether the qi is clear or turbid; then adjust it. Treatment without fail will be based on the Correcting Injury Classic. Therefore, for massaging people, let their abdomen hang down and suspend their limbs, for flesh people, their upper and lower parts should be broad, and for fat people, even if they cannot become broad.

docs.title: 玉版
docs.text:
1: 黃帝曰：余以小鍼為細物也，夫子乃言上合之于天，下合之于地，中合之于人，余以為過鍼之意矣，願聞其故。歧伯曰：何物大于天乎？夫大于鍼者，惟五兵者焉，五兵者死之備也，非生之具。且夫人者，天地之鎮也，其不可不參乎？夫治民者，亦唯鍼焉。夫鍼之與五兵，其孰小乎？ Yellow Emperor said: I consider the small needle as insignificant, and Confucius says to harmonize it with heaven above, earth below, and humanity within. I find this a wrong interpretation of the needle's meaning, and I would like to hear its true intention. Tui Bo said: What is greater than heaven? The only thing greater than a needle is the five weapons, which are preparations for death, not for life. Moreover, human beings are the settling of heaven and earth; they should not be neglected. Treating people is also dependent on the needle. Which is more insignificant, the needle or the five weapons?

2: 黃帝曰：病之生時，有喜怒不測，飲食不節，陰氣不足，陽氣有餘，營氣不行，乃發為癰疽。陰陽不通，兩熱相搏，乃化為濃，小鍼能取之乎？歧伯曰：聖人不能使化者為之，邪不可留也。故兩軍相當，旗幟相望，白刃陳於中野者，此非一日之謀也。能使其民令行，禁止士卒無白刃之難者，非一日之教也，須臾之得也。夫至使身被癰疽之病，膿血之聚者，不亦離道遠乎？夫癰疽之生，膿血之成也，不從天下，不從地出，積微之所生也，故聖人自治於未有形也，愚者遭其已成也。 Yellow Emperor said: When a disease occurs, there are feelings of joy and anger that cannot be measured, eating and drinking without restraint, insufficient yin qi, excess yang qi, qi not circulating smoothly, resulting in the formation of boils and carbuncles. If yin and yang do not communicate, the two heat struggle against each other, leading to a thickening. Can a small knife remove it? Duke of Zhou said: A sage cannot cause this transformation, and it is wrong. Therefore, the two armies face each other, flags face each other, sharp blades are arrayed in the middle ground; this is not a one-day plan. To make the people follow this, to prohibit soldiers from having no sharp blades; this is not a one-day teaching but a moment's achievement. When the body is afflicted with boils and carbuncles, how far from the right way? The generation of boils and carbuncles is the accumulation of turbid blood, not from under heaven or from the earth, and it arises from the subtle. Therefore, a sage regulates without having a form yet, while a fool falls victim to it after it has already formed

3: 黃帝曰：其已形，不予遭，膿已成，不予見；為之奈何？歧伯曰：膿已成，十死一生，故聖人弗使已成，而明為良方，著之竹帛，使能者踵而傳之後世，無有終時者，為其不予遭也。 Yellow Emperor said: Once formed, I do not allow it to happen, and once fully grown, I do not look at it. What can be done? Hui Shi said: Once fully grown, one is ten times dead and one time alive; thus, sages do not allow it to grow fully, but make clear what is a good method, record it on bamboo or silk, and let those who understand pass it down to future generations, without having an end time, so as not to allow it to happen.

4: 黃帝曰：其已有膿血而後遭乎？不導之以小鍼治乎？歧伯曰：以小治小者，其功小，以大治大者，多害，故其已成膿血者，其唯砭石鈹鋒之所取也。 Yellow Emperor said: Is it already festered and then met with misfortune? Should it not be treated with a small lancet? Duke of Shou replied: For treating small issues, the effect is small, and for treating large issues, there are more harms. Thus, when it has already festered, the only option is to use a leech and flint knife.

5: 黃帝曰：多害者其不可全乎？歧伯曰：其在逆順焉。黃帝曰：願聞逆順。歧伯曰：以為傷者，其白眼青，黑眼小，是一逆也；內藥而嘔者，是二逆也；腹痛渴甚，是三逆也；肩項中不便，是四逆也；音嘶色脫，是五逆也。除此五者，為順矣。 Yellow Emperor said: Is it impossible to completely eliminate harm? Duke of Shao replied: It is in the area of reversal (or upside down). Yellow Emperor asked: I wish to hear about reversal and order. Duke of Shao replied: The one who causes injury, his whites are green and blacks are small, this is one kind of reversal; taking medicine internally and vomiting, this is two kinds of reversal; abdominal pain with thirst, this is three kinds of reversal; difficulty moving the shoulders and neck, this is four kinds of reversal; hoarse voice and pale skin, this is five kinds of reversal. Except for these five, it becomes order (or right side up).

6: 黃帝曰：諸病皆有逆順，可得聞乎？歧伯曰：腹脹、身熱、脈大，是一逆也；腹鳴而滿，四肢清泄，其脈大，是二逆也；衄而不止，脈大，是三逆也；咳而溲血脫形，其脈小勁，是四逆也；咳脫形，身熱，脈小以疾，是謂五逆也。如是者，不過十五日而死矣。 Yellow Emperor said: All diseases have reversals and progressions. Can you hear it? Master of Deviations replied: Distended abdomen, fever, and large pulse are one kind of reversal; distended abdomen, resonating sound within, urine and feces expelled from all four limbs, with a large pulse, this is the second kind of reversal; bleeding but not stopping, with a large pulse, this is the third kind of reversal; coughing with spitting blood and losing form, with a small weak pulse, this is the fourth kind of reversal; coughing until losing form, fever, with a small and quick pulse, this is called the five kinds of reversals. Those who experience such will not live beyond fifteen days.

7: 其腹大脹，四末清，脫形，泄甚，是一逆也；腹脹便血，其脈大，時絕，是二逆也；咳溲血，形肉脫，脈搏，是三逆也；嘔血，胸滿引背，脈小而疾，是四逆也；咳嘔，腹脹且飧泄，其脈絕，是五逆也。如是者，不及一時而死矣。工不察此者而刺之，是謂逆治。 A large abdomen protruding, the extremities weak and pale, with distention and frequent diarrhea; this is one reversal. Abdominal distention accompanied by bleeding, the pulse being large and then ceasing; this is two reversals. Coughing up blood, skin and flesh falling off, pulse palpitation; this is three reversals. Vomiting blood, fullness in the chest referred to the back, and the pulse small and rapid; this is four reversals. Coughing and vomiting, abdominal distention and frequent diarrhea, and then the pulse ceasing; this is five reversals. Those who suffer thus are not likely to survive more than one day. If a physician does not understand this condition and proceeds to acupuncture, he is guilty of reversal therapy.

8: 黃帝曰：夫子之言鍼甚駿，以配天地，上數天文，下度地紀，內別五藏，外次六府，經脈二十八會，盡有周紀。能殺生人，不能起死者，子能反之乎？歧伯曰：能殺生人，不能起死者也。黃帝曰：余聞之，則為不仁，然願聞其道，弗行於人。歧伯曰：是明道也，其必然也，其如刀劍之可以殺人，如飲酒使人醉也，雖勿診，猶可知矣。 Yellow Emperor said: Master Zhou's words are sharp like a needle, used to harmonize heaven and earth, calculating the stars above and determining the calendar below, distinguishing between the five viscera inside and the six departments outside, connecting the twenty-eight will points of the meridians, and fully recording the times. He can kill living people but cannot raise the dead; can Master Zhou reverse this? Kuai Bo said: Yes, he can kill living people but cannot raise the dead. Yellow Emperor said: I have heard that it is not humane; I hope to hear its method and do not practice it on humans. Kuai Bo said: This is a clear teaching, and it must be so; just as knives and swords can kill people, and drinking can make people drunk, even without diagnosis, it is still known.

9: 黃帝曰：願卒聞之。歧伯曰：人之所受氣者，谷也。谷之所注者，胃也。胃者，水谷氣血之海也。海之所行云氣者，天下也。胃之所出氣血者，經隧也。而隧者，五藏六府之大絡也，迎而奪之而已矣。 Yellow Emperor said: I wish to hear about it. Duke of Shou said: The energy that people receive is grain. The place where the grain is stored is the stomach. The stomach is like an ocean of water, grain, Qi, and blood. The ocean's currents of cloud and Qi are like the entire world. The Qi and blood that come out from the stomach go through the meridians, which are like the great conduit connecting the five viscera and six fu organs, and once they have been seized and taken away, that is all.

10: 黃帝曰：上下有數乎？歧伯曰：迎之五里，中道而止，五至而已，五往而藏之氣盡矣，故五五二十五，而竭其輸矣，此所謂奪其天氣者也，非能絕其命而傾其壽者也。黃帝曰：願卒聞之。歧伯曰：闚門而刺之者，死於家中；入門而刺之者，死於堂上。黃帝曰：善乎方，明哉道，請著之玉版，以為重寶，傳之後世，以為刺禁，令民勿敢犯也。 Yellow Emperor asked: Is there a measure for above and below? Hui Bo replied: Approach from five li away, stop at the central avenue, arrive at five [places] and complete it, go to them and hide their vital energy completely, so there are twenty-five fives, and they have exhausted their output. This is what is called depriving someone of their celestial vitality, not being able to cut off their life and shorten their longevity. Yellow Emperor said: I wish to hear it again. Hui Bo said: If one pokes through the bolt hole, they will die inside the house; if one enters the door and pokes, they will die on the floor. Yellow Emperor said: This method is excellent and clear in its teaching. Let me engrave it on a jade plate and make it a valuable treasure, to be passed down for future generations. Use it as a restraining device, so that the people dare not dare to violate it.

docs.title: 五禁
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問於歧伯曰：余聞刺有五禁，何謂五禁？歧伯曰：禁其不可刺也。黃帝曰：余聞刺有五奪。歧伯曰：無寫其不可奪者也。黃帝曰：余聞刺有五過。歧伯曰：補寫無過其度。黃帝曰：余聞刺有五逆。歧伯曰：病與脈相逆，命曰五逆。黃帝曰：余聞刺有九宜。歧伯曰：明知九鍼之論，是謂九誼。 Yellow Emperor asked Yi Bo, I have heard of five prohibitions in acupuncture. What are the five prohibitions? Yi Bo replied, They refer to what should not be pierced. Yellow Emperor said, I have heard of five things that must be taken away in acupuncture. Yi Bo replied, There is no writing about what should not be taken away. Yellow Emperor said, I have heard of five excesses in acupuncture. Yi Bo replied, It is necessary to supplement without exceeding the limit. Yellow Emperor said, I have heard of five reversals in acupuncture. Yi Bo replied, Disease and pulse are inversely related, and they are called the five reversals. Yellow Emperor said, I have heard of nine indications in acupuncture. Yi Bo replied, Knowing the theories behind the nine needles is what is meant by the nine indications.

2: 黃帝曰：何謂五禁，願聞其不可刺之時。歧伯曰：甲乙日自乘，無刺實，無發蒙於耳內。丙丁日自乘，無振埃於肩喉廉泉。戊己日自乘四季，無刺腹，去爪寫水。庚辛日自乘，無刺關節於股膝。壬癸日自乘，無刺足脛，是謂五禁。 Yellow Emperor said: What is the meaning of the five prohibitions? I wish to hear when it is not permitted to pierce. Duke of Shao replied: On days beginning with yin, there is no piercing of the ears and no shaving of hair inside the ears. On days beginning with Yang, there is no vigorous brushing at the shoulders, throat, or springs. On days governed by Wood, there is no piercing of the abdomen, and claws are removed to write water. On days governed by Metal, there is no piercing of joints in the knees and elbows. On days governed by Earth, there is no piercing of the heels and Achilles tendons. This is what is known as the five prohibitions.

3: 黃帝曰：何謂五奪？歧伯曰：形肉已奪，是一奪也；大奪血之後，是二奪也；大汗出之後，是三奪也；大泄之後，是四奪也；新產及大血之後，是五奪也。此皆不可寫。 Yellow Emperor asked, What is meant by the five losses? The Master of Difficulties replied: When the body and flesh have been lost, it constitutes one loss; when the blood has flowed out, it constitutes a second loss; when sweat has been secreted, it constitutes a third loss; when excrement has passed, it constitutes a fourth loss; when new life has emerged along with great blood, it constitutes the fifth loss. All of these are not to be written

4: 黃帝曰：何謂五逆？歧伯曰：熱病脈靜，汗已出，脈盛躁，是一逆也；病泄，脈洪大，是二逆也；著痺不移䐃肉破，身熱，脈偏絕，是三逆也；淫而奪形、身熱，色夭然白，乃後下血衄，血衄篤重，是謂四逆也；寒熱奪形，脈堅搏，是謂五逆也。 Yellow Emperor asked: What are the five reversals? Huang Bo replied: When a person has a fever and their pulse is still, sweat has already come out, and their pulse is full of agitation, it represents one reversal. When the disease is relieved, the pulse becomes large and surging, this represents the second reversal. When paralysis is not moving and the muscles are breaking down, the person is hot, and the pulse is deviated, this represents the third reversal. When one indulges and loses their shape, the person is hot, the color turns pale and white, and then there is bleeding from below, and the bleeding is heavy, representing the four reversals. When fever leads to loss of shape, and the pulse is rigid and spasmodic, this represents the five reversals.

docs.title: 動輸
docs.text:
1: 黃帝曰：經脈十二，而手太陰、足少陰、陽明，獨動不休，何也？歧伯曰：是明胃脈也。胃為五藏六府之海，其清氣上注于肺，肺氣從太陰而行之，其行也，以息往來，故人一呼，脈再動，一吸脈亦再動，呼吸不已，故動而不止。 Yellow Emperor said: There are twelve meridians, and the hands' ShaoYang, feet' Shaoyang, and Yang Ming move ceaselessly. What is the reason for this? Qi Bo replied: This is the manifestation of the Conception Vessel. The Conception Vessel is the sea of the Five Zang and Six Fu organs, its clear qi ascends to the lungs, lung qi flows through the ShaoYang, and this flowing corresponds with breathing. Thus, when a person inhales or exhales, the pulse moves again; when they inhale deeply, the pulse moves again, and their breathing is not constant, so it ceaselessly moves.

2: 黃帝曰：氣之過於寸口也，上十焉息，下八焉伏，何道從還？不知其極。 Yellow Emperor said: The Qi is too excessive through the orifice above, and it rises ten steps to exhale, and eight steps to subdue below; how can one return the path? Not knowing its extreme.

3: 歧伯曰：氣之離藏也，卒然如弓弩之發，如水之下岸，上於魚以及衰，其餘氣衰散以逆上，故其行微。 Obo said: The vital energy is like a bow and arrow released suddenly or water flowing down to catch fish and wither, the remaining vital energy wanes and disperses in reverse, so its movement is subtle.

4: 黃帝曰：足之陽明，何因而動？歧伯曰：胃氣上注于肺，其悍氣上沖頭者，循咽，上走空竅，循眼系，入絡腦，出顑，下客主人，循牙車，合陽明，并下人迎，此胃氣別走於陽明者也。故陰陽上下，其動也若一。故陽病而陽脈小者，為逆；陰病而陰脈大者，為逆。故陰陽俱靜俱動，若引繩相傾者病。 Yellow Emperor asked: What causes the Yang Ming to move? Minister Qi replied: The Stomach Qi ascends to the Lung, and its bitter Qi flows upwards to the head, passing through the throat, it rises to the skylight, passes through the eye orbits, enters the brain, exits at the fontanelle, descends to the Grandmaster, passes through the teeth canal, merges with Yang Ming, and goes down together with the person. This is how Stomach Qi moves independently of Yang Ming. Thus, Yin and Yang's up-down movement is harmonious. Therefore, when there are Yang symptoms and the Yang channel is small, it is called counterflow. When there are Yin symptoms and the Yin channel is enlarged, it is also called counterflow. If both Yin and Yang are motionless or moving, like a swaying balance, it indicates illness.

5: 黃帝曰：足少陰何因而動？歧伯曰：沖脈者，十二經之海也，與少陰之大絡，起於腎下，出於氣街，循陰股內廉，邪入膕中，循脛骨內廉，并少陰之經，下入內踝之後。入足下，其別者，邪入踝，出屬附上，入大指之間，注諸絡，以溫足脛，此脈之常動者也。 Yellow Emperor asked: Why does the kidney channel move? Huan Bo replied: The kidney channel, also known as the Bao Mai, originates from the lower part of the kidneys, passes through the Qi Street, follows the inner groove of the yin channel, enters the huiyin (perineum), and then merges with the conception vessel. Upon entering the sole of the foot, its function is to regulate the qi of the foot and ankle by dispersing pathogens along the tendons and meridians. This movement is a common phenomenon in the kidney channel

6: 黃帝曰：營衛之行也，上下相貫，如環之無端，今有其卒然遇邪風，及逢大寒，手足懈惰，其脈陰陽之道，相輸之會，行相失也，氣何由還？歧伯曰：夫四末陰陽之會者，此氣之尤絡也；四街者，氣之徑路也。故絡絕則徑通，四末解則氣從合，相輸如環。黃帝曰：善。此所謂如環無端，莫知其紀，終而復始，此之謂也。 Yellow Emperor said: The practice of military medicine is like a circular orbit, pervading up and down without interruption. However, today there has been an unexpected encounter with evil winds and encounters great cold, and the hands and feet become sluggish. The flow of the yin and yang in the pulse has become confused, and the Qi cannot return to its course. Master Gao said: The convergence of the four extremities of yin and yang is the main pathway for Qi. The four channels are the paths of Qi. Therefore, if there is blockage, the paths will be open; if the four extremities are resolved, then the Qi will flow in harmony and be like a circular orbit. Yellow Emperor said: Good. This so-called circular orbit without end, with no record of beginning or end, refers to this.

docs.title: 五味論
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問於少俞曰：五味入于口也，各有所走，各有所病，酸走筋，多食之，令人癃；鹹走血，多食之，令人渴；辛走氣，多食之，令人洞心；苦走骨，多食之，令人變嘔；甘走肉，多食之，令人挽心。余知其然也，不知其何由？願聞其故。少俞答曰：酸入于胃，其氣澀以收，上之兩焦，弗能出入也，不出即留於胃中，胃中和溫，則下注膀胱，膀胱之胞薄以懦，得酸則縮綣，約而不通，水道不行，故癃。陰者，積筋之所終也，故酸入而走筋矣。 Yellow Emperor asked Shao Yong, Five flavors enter the mouth, each has its own channel and each has its own disease. Sour enters the sinews, eating too much of it causes pain; salty enters the blood, eating too much causes thirst; pungent enters qi, eating too much causes one to feel hollow; bitter enters the bones, eating too much causes vomiting; sweet enters the flesh, eating too much causes palpitations. I know this to be true, but do not know how it works. I hope to hear its cause. Shao Yong replied, Sour enters the stomach, its qi becomes turbid and collects, rising upward to the two fu organs, unable to enter or exit. If it does not exit, it remains in the stomach, which has a balanced environment, causing water to flow downward to the bladder. The bladder's essence is weak, so if there is sour, it contracts and tightens, binds and does not communicate, disrupting the waterway, thus causing pain. Yin refers to the endpoint of filling the sinews, so sour enters and walks the sinews.

2: 黃帝曰：鹹走血，多食之，令人渴，何也？少俞曰：鹹入于胃；其氣上走中焦，注于脈，則血氣走之，血與鹹相得，則凝，凝則胃中汁注之，注之則胃中竭，竭則咽路焦，故舌本干而善渴。血脈者，中焦之道也，故鹹入而走血矣。 Yellow Emperor said: Why does salty taste cause thirst? Shao Yong said: Salt enters the stomach. Its Qi rises and acts on the spleen, causing the blood and Qi to circulate. When blood and salt meet, they coagulate, and when they coagulate, the fluids in the stomach are exhausted. When they are exhausted, the throat pathway becomes parched, thus the tongue is inherently dry and good at being thirsty. The blood vessels are the channel of the spleen, so salt enters and acts on the blood.

3: 黃帝曰：辛走氣，多食之，令人洞心，何也？少俞曰：辛入于胃，其氣走於上焦，上焦者，受氣而營諸陽者也，薑韭之氣熏之，營衛之氣，不時受之，久留心下，故洞心。辛與氣俱行，故辛入而與汗俱出。 Yellow Emperor said: What is the reason that cinnamon promotes the flow of Qi, and when people eat more of it, their hearts become clear? Shao Yong replied: Cinnamon enters the spleen, its Qi moves upwards to the middle energy center. The middle energy center is where the Qi is received and nourishes the yang, and ginger and scallion's Qi fumigate it. By timely replenishing the defensive Qi, it stays in the heart area for a long time, thus making hearts clear. When cinnamon and Qi both move, cinnamon enters and goes out with sweating.

4: 黃帝曰：苦走骨，多食之，令人變嘔，何也？少俞曰：苦入于胃，五穀之氣，皆不能勝苦，苦入下脘，三焦之道，皆閉而不通，故變嘔。齒者，骨之所終也，故苦入而走骨，故入而復出，知其走骨也。 Yellow Emperor said: What is the reason for the bitter walking of the bones and causing people to vomit after eating too much? Shao Yong said: Bitter enters the stomach, the Qi of five grains cannot overcome the bitterness. Bitterness enters the lower chest, the passageways of the three Yang organs are all closed and do not communicate, therefore causing vomiting. In response to this, I say that the teeth are the end of the bones, so when bitterness walks and spreads, it enters and then exits, knowing it is walking the bones.

5: 黃帝曰：甘走肉，多食之。令人悗心，何也？少俞曰：甘入于胃，其氣弱小，不能上至於上焦，而與谷留於胃中者，令人柔潤者也，胃柔則緩，緩則蟲動，蟲動則令人悗心。其氣外通於肉，故甘走肉。 Yellow Emperor said: Eat more ginseng. Why would it make people's heart palpitate? Shao Yong said: Ginseng enters the stomach and its energy is weak and slight, unable to rise up to the upper abdomen. It stays in the stomach with grains, making people feel softened and relaxed. If the stomach is softened, it calms things down, and when things are calm, insects will move, causing people's heart palpitations. Its energy circulates outside in meat, so ginseng can make one's flesh ache

docs.title: 陰陽二十五人
docs.text:
1: 黃帝曰：余聞陰陽之人何如？伯高曰：天地之間，六合之內，不離於五，人亦應之。故五五二十五人之政，而陰陽之人不與焉。其態又不合於眾者五，余已知之矣。願聞二十五人之形，血氣之所生，別而以候，從外知內，何如？歧伯曰：悉乎哉問也，此先師之秘也，雖伯高猶不能明之也。黃帝避席遵循而卻曰：余聞之得其人弗教，是謂重失，得而泄之，天將厭之，余願得而明之，金櫃藏之，不敢揚之。歧伯曰：先立五形金木水火土，別其五色，異其五形之人，而二十五人具矣。黃帝曰：願卒聞之。歧伯曰：慎之慎之，臣請言之。 Yellow Emperor said: What of those skilled in Yin and Yang? Bo Gao replied: Within the interval between Heaven and Earth, within the Six Cycles, there is no place without the Five. Man should also follow this pattern. Thus, among the Twenty-Five Hegemons, there are those skilled in Yin and Yang who are not part of it; their conduct does not conform to that of the Five. I already know this. I would like to hear about the form of the Twenty-Five Hegemons, the place where blood and qi are generated, separating them as omens and knowing the inside from the outside. How is this done?

Huangdi (Yellow Emperor) avoided the seat and followed along while saying: I have heard that those who possess this person do not teach it, which is a great loss. Obtaining it and then disclosing it, the Heavens will be weary of it. I wish to understand it and keep it hidden in my heart, not daring to reveal it.
