Huangdi (Yellow Emperor) said: Please allow me to hear about this one more time. Huangdi (Yellow Emperor) replied: Please proceed with caution. My lord, may I dare speak of it?

First establish the Five Forms of Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, and Earth, distinguish their five colors, and differentiate the forms of the people among the Twenty-Five Hegemons, and they will be complete. Yellow Emperor said: Please allow me to hear this one more time. Huangdi (Yellow Emperor) replied: Proceed with great care. My lord, may I dare speak about it?

First establish the Five Forms of Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, and Earth, distinguish their five colors, and differentiate the forms of the people among the Twenty-Five Hegemons, and they will be complete. Yellow Emperor said: Please allow me to hear this one more time.

2: 木形之人，比于上角似於蒼帝，其為人蒼色，小頭，長面大肩背直身小，手足好。有才，勞心少力多憂，勞於事，能春夏不能秋冬感而病生。足厥陰，佗佗然，大角之人比於左足少陽，少陽之上遺遺然。左角之人比於右足少陽，少陽之下隨隨然。鈦角之人，比於右足少陽，少陽之上推推然。判角之人比於左足少陽，少陽之下枯枯然。 The man with wooden limbs was like the Azure Emperor in his left corner, having an azure complexion, a small head, a long face, broad shoulders, and straight back, and his hands and feet were well-formed. He had talent but worked hard and was weak and often worried. When he engaged in tasks, he could not withstand the heat of spring and summer but could not bear the chill of autumn and winter, resulting in illness. His left foot had excess yin, dragging along carelessly, while his large horned man was like the left foot's slightly yang, lingering carelessly. The right-horned man was like the right foot's slightly yang, following along carelessly. The ox-horned man was like the right foot's slightly yang, gently pushing along. The goat-horned man was like the left foot's slightly yang, withering away carelessly.

3: 火形之人，比於上徵，似於赤帝。其為人赤色廣䏖脫面小頭，好肩背，髀腹小手足，行安地疾心，行搖肩背肉滿。有氣輕財少信多慮，見事明好顏，急心不壽暴死。能春夏不能秋冬，秋冬感而病生，手少陰核核然。質徵之人，比於左手太陽，太陽之上，肌肌然，少徵之人比於右手太陽，太陽之下慆慆然，右徵之人比於右手太陽，太陽之上鮫鮫然。質判之人，比於左手太陽，太陽之下支支頤頤然。 The person with fire marks is like the upper summoning and resembles the Red Emperor. This person has a red skin broad face, narrow head, is good at shoulders and back, hips and abdomen, small hands and feet, moves securely on land, and moves nimbly while shaking shoulders and back with flesh filling. They have qi that is light, wealthy, and has little belief but much thought, see events clearly with a beautiful countenance, are anxious about the heart without having longevity and suffer violent death. They can adapt to spring and summer but not autumn and winter. In autumn and winter, they become cold and sick, their hands have yin cores that are like grains of sand. The person seeking quality is like the left hand Yang, on Yang's upper part, muscle-like, the person seeking little is like the right hand Yang, on Yang's lower part, dazed-like, and the person seeking on the right hand Yang, on Yang's upper part, fish-like. The person judging quality is like the left hand Yang, on Yang's lower part supportive and trembling-like

4: 土形之人，比於上宮，似於上古黃帝，其為人黃色圓面、大頭、美肩背、大腹、美股脛、小手足、多肉、上下相稱行安地，舉足浮。安心，好利人不喜權勢，善附人也。能秋冬不能春夏，春夏感而病生，足太陰，敦敦然。大宮之人比於左足陽明，陽明之上婉婉然。加宮之人，比於左足陽明，陽明之下坎坎然。少宮之人，比於右足陽明，陽明之上，樞樞然。左宮之人，比於右足陽明，陽明之下，兀兀然。 People of the Earth, compared to those in the Upper Palace, resemble the ancient Yellow Emperor. They are characterized by a yellow human form, round face, large head, beautiful shoulders and back, large abdomen, beautiful thighs and calves, small hands and feet, abundant flesh, and are stable and secure when standing or moving. They dislike powerful people, are good at attaching themselves to others, and can withstand autumn and winter but not spring and summer. In spring and summer, they are affected and fall ill, having a weak Taiyin condition, appearing feeble. The Upper Palace people resemble the left foot Yangming, with delicate movements. The Middle Palace people resemble the left foot Yangming, with fluctuating movements. The Lower Palace people resemble the right foot Yangming, with stable movements. The Right Palace people resemble the right foot Yangming, with fluctuating movements

5: 金形之人比於上商，似於白帝，其為人方面白色、小頭、小肩背小腹、小手足如骨發踵外，骨輕。身清廉，急心靜悍，善為吏，能秋冬，不能春夏，春夏感而病生。手太陰敦敦然，釱商之人比於左手陽明，陽明之上，廉廉然。右商之人，比於左手陽明，陽明之下脫脫然。左商之人比於右手陽明，陽明之上監監然。少商之人，比於右手陽明，陽明之下，嚴嚴然。 The man of metal compares to the Sage Emperor Shun, and resembles the Emperor of White. He is fair-skinned, small-headed, small-shouldered, and has a small waist and small hands and feet like bones protruding at the heels. His bones are light. He is clean and upright, with a keen heart and quick to act, skilled in serving as an official, proficient in autumn and winter but unable to handle spring and summer, feeling unwell in spring and summer. His left hand resembles Taoyin, with Taoyin's man resembling Yangming above, clear and clean. The right hand resembles Shang, with Shang resembling Yangming below, slipping away and clean. The left hand resembles the left hand of Yangming, standing above in a watchful manner. The Shaohao man resembles the right hand of Yangming, Yangming below, strict and stern.

6: 水形之人，比於上羽，似於黑帝，其為人，黑色面不平，大頭廉頤，小肩大腹動手足，發行搖身下尻長，背延延然。不敬畏善欺紹人，戮死。能秋冬不能春夏，春夏感而病生。足少陰汗汗然。大羽之人，比於右足太陽，太陽之上，頰頰然。少羽之人，比於左足太陽，太陽之下潔潔然。眾之為人，比於右足太陽，太陽之下潔潔然。桎之為人，比於左足太陽，太陽之上安安然。是故五形之人二十五變者，眾之所以相欺者是也。 People shaped like water are compared to Yu (rain), resembling the Black Emperor. Their skin is black and not flat, with a large head and chubby cheeks, small shoulders and a big belly, moving their hands and feet nimbly, swaying their hips as they walk, and their backs extended. They are not afraid of showing disrespect or being deceitful towards the Shu people and will kill them. Those who can endure autumn and winter but cannot handle spring and summer become sick from the heat. Their sweaty feet have lots of yin sweat. People shaped like great wings are compared to the right foot Yang, on top of the Yang. Little wing-shaped people are compared to the left foot Yang, beneath it in a clean manner. The majority of people are compared to the right foot Yang, beneath it in a clean manner. And the reed-shaped people are compared to the left foot Yang, above it in peace. Therefore, the five shapes of people have 25 variations, and this is what the crowd uses to deceive each other.

7: 黃帝曰：得其形，不得其色何如？歧伯曰：形勝色，色勝形者，至其勝時年加，感則病行，失則憂矣。形色相得者，富貴大樂。黃帝曰：其形色相勝之時，年加可知乎？歧伯曰：凡年忌下上之人，大忌常加七歲，十六歲、二十五歲、三十四歲、四十三歲、五十二歲、六十一歲皆人之大忌，不可不自安也，感則病行，失則憂矣，當此之時，無為姦事，是謂年忌。 Yellow Emperor asked: What if one acquires the form but not the complexion? How about that? Boyi replied: The form is superior to the complexion, and the complexion is superior to the form at its peak time. When years add on, one feels ill and suffers from diseases. If they are both obtained, great happiness and honor result. Yellow Emperor asked: At the time when the form and complexion are both superior, can one know when the years add on? Boyi replied: Anyone who is above seventy years old, the major taboo is to add seven years every ten years, sixteen years, twenty-five years, thirty-four years, forty-three years, fifty-two years, and sixty-one years. These are major taboos that one must not neglect oneself, feel ill and suffer from diseases. At such a time, without doing anything improper, this is what we call the taboo of adding years.

8: 黃帝曰：夫子之言脈之上下，血氣之候似知形氣，奈何？歧伯曰：足陽明之上血氣盛則髯美長，血少氣多則髯短，故氣少血多則髯少，血氣皆少則無髯。兩吻多畫，足陽明之下血氣盛則下毛美長至胸，血多氣少則下毛美短至臍，行則善高舉足，足趾少肉足善寒，血少氣多則肉而善瘃，血氣皆少則無毛有則稀、枯悴，善痿厥，足痺。 Yellow Emperor said: The Master's words relate to the flow of blood and qi above and below. How does this pertain to the formation and appearance of hair? Boyang replied: Abundant blood and qi in the foot Jueyin channel lead to long and luxuriant eyebrows, while deficient blood and abundant qi cause short eyebrows. Hence, if qi is deficient and blood is abundant, the eyebrows will be sparse; if both are deficient, there will be no eyebrows. The upper lips are filled with lines, and in the foot Jueyin channel below, abundant blood and qi lead to long and luxuriant pubic hair that reaches the chest, while an excess of blood and deficient qi results in short pubic hair that is close to the genitals, leading to good gait and high-stepping feet. The soles of the feet have less flesh, which makes them suitable for cold climates. A deficiency of blood and abundance of qi will result in fleshy growths and suitability for sweating. If both are deficient, there may be hair but it will be sparse and dry, leading to weakness, numbness of the feet, and a tendency towards paralysis.

9: 足少陽之上，氣血盛則通髯美長，血多氣少則通髯美短，血少氣多則少髯，血氣皆少則無鬚，感於寒濕則善痺。骨痛爪枯也。足少陽之下，血氣盛則脛毛美長，外踝肥；血多氣少則脛毛美短，外踝皮堅而厚，血少氣多則胻毛少，外踝皮薄而軟，血氣皆少則無毛，外踝瘦無肉。 Above the foot yang channel, when qi and blood are abundant, the beard is long and beautiful, and the mustache is long. When there is more blood and less qi, the beard is short, but the mustache is still beautiful. If there is a deficiency of both qi and blood, then there will be no beard. If one is affected by cold and dampness, it is beneficial for the genitals. Bone pain and brittle nails are also indicative. Below the foot yang channel, when qi and blood are abundant, the hair on the calves is beautiful and long, and the outer ankles are plump. When there is more blood but less qi, the hair on the calves is short, the skin of the outer ankles is tough and thick. If there is a deficiency of qi and blood, the hip hair is sparse, the skin of the outer ankles is thin and soft, there will be no hair, and the outer ankles are emaciated with little flesh

10: 足太陽之上，血氣盛則美眉，眉有毫毛血多氣少則惡眉，面多少理，血少氣多則面多肉，血氣和則美色，足太陽之下，血氣盛則跟肉滿，踵堅，氣少血多則瘦，跟空，血氣皆少則善轉筋，踵下痛。 Above the Jueyin (足太陽) channel, when blood and qi are abundant, there will be beautiful eyebrows; if there is more blood but less qi, the eyebrows will be bad; face with some reason, more blood and less qi result in a meaty face. When blood and qi are balanced, there will be a beautiful complexion. Below the Jueyin channel, when blood and qi are abundant, there is full calf flesh and firm heels. If there is less qi and more blood, one becomes thin, with hollow calves and heels. Blood and qi deficient leads to flexibility of the tendons, and pain in the soles of the feet.

11: 手陽明之上，血氣盛則髭美。血少氣多則髭惡，血氣皆少則無髭。手陽明之下血氣盛則腋下毛美，手魚肉以溫，氣血皆少則手瘦以寒。 Above the Hand Shao Yang, when blood and qi are abundant, the eyebrows are beautiful. If there is a deficiency of blood and an excess of qi, the eyebrows will be unsightly; if both blood and qi are deficient, there will be no eyebrows. Below the Hand Shao Yang, when blood and qi are abundant, the armpit hair is beautiful; the hand is warm, and there is no deficiency of either blood or qi.

12: 手少陰之上，血氣盛則眉美以長，耳色美，血氣皆少則耳焦惡色。手少陽之下，血氣盛則手卷多肉以溫，血氣皆少則寒以瘦，氣少血多則瘦以多脈。 When there is a lack of yin on the upper hand, and qi is abundant, the eyebrows are beautiful and long, and the ear color is attractive. When there is a deficiency of yang below the hand, and the qi is abundant, the hands will have many tendons and be warm; when there is a lack of yin and yang and the qi is deficient, one will become thin due to coldness and have many pulse points.

13: 手太陽之上，血氣盛則有多鬚，面多肉以平，血氣皆少則面瘦惡色。手太陽之下，血氣盛則掌肉充滿，血氣皆少則掌瘦以寒。 Above the Hand Sun (Meridian), when Qi is abundant, there are abundant whiskers, and the face is full and round; when Qi is deficient, the face is thin and has a bad complexion. Below the Hand Sun Meridian, when Qi is abundant, the palm muscles are full; when Qi is deficient, the palm is weak and cold.

14: 黃帝曰：二十五人者，刺之有約乎？歧伯曰：美眉者，足太陽之脈，氣血多，惡眉者，血氣少，其肥而澤者，血氣有餘，肥而不澤者，氣有餘，血不足，瘦而無澤者，氣血俱不足，審察其形氣有餘不足而調之，可以知逆順矣。 Yellow Emperor said: Are there any patterns in the twenty-five men? Duke of Shao replied: Those with good brows, they have an abundance of Qi and blood from the foot Yin (Conception Vessel) channel. Those with bad brows, they have a deficiency of Qi and blood. If someone is fat and not bright, there is an excess of Qi but a deficiency of blood. If someone is thin and not bright, both Qi and blood are deficient. By examining their forms and determining if there is an excess or deficiency, one can discern if they are favorable or unfavorable.

15: 黃帝曰：刺其諸陰陽奈何？歧伯曰：按其寸口人迎，以調陰陽，切循其經絡之凝澀，結而不通者，此於身皆為痛痺，甚則不行，故凝澀，凝澀者，致氣以溫之血和乃止。其結絡者，脈結血不和，決之乃行，故曰：氣有餘於上者，導而下之，氣不足於上者，推而休之，其稽留不至者，因而迎之，必明於經隧，乃能持之，寒與熱爭者，導而行之，其宛陳血不結者，則而予之，必先明知二十五人則血氣之所在，左右上下，刺約畢也。 Yellow Emperor asked: How to pierce the Jueyin? Duke of Shou replied: Press the Conception and Governor points, regulate Yin and Yang, follow the channels and collaterals, tie those that do not connect, in the body all these are painful and stiff, sometimes they cannot move, therefore follow the channels and collaterals, follow the channels and collaterals to regulate the Qi, warm the blood, and bring harmony. For those who are tied, there is excess Qi above, guide it downwards; if the Qi is insufficient above, push it gently; when they hesitate and do not reach the appropriate point, approach it; you must master the path of the channels, so as to be able to hold them. When cold and heat contend, guide them along the path; for those who have no knotted blood, give them medicine; you must first understand the location of the blood and Qi in the twenty-five men, left right upper and lower, pierce and complete.

docs.title: 五音五味
docs.text:
1: 右徵與少徵，調右手太陽上。左商與左徵，調左手陽明上。少徵與大宮，調左手陽明上。右角與大角，調右手少陽下。大徵與少徵，調左手太陽上。眾羽與少羽，調右足太陽下。少商與右商調右手太陽下。桎羽與眾羽，調右足太陽下。少宮與大宮，調右足陽明下。判角與少角，調右足少陽下。釱商與上商，調右足陽明下。釱商與上角，調左足太陽下。 Right Wrist and Little Wrist, regulate the Right Hand Yuan-source. Left Market and Left Wrist, regulate the Left Hand Yang-Ming. Little Wrist and Great Palace, regulate the Left Hand Yang-Ming. Right Corner and Great Corner, regulate the Right Hand Shao-yang. Great Wrist and Little Wrist, regulate the Left Hand Yuan-source. Crowing Feathers and Little Feathers, regulate the Right Foot Yang-ming. Little Market and Right Market, regulate the Right Hand Yuan-source. Lesser Wing and Corner, regulate the Right Foot Shao-yang. Hailen Merchant and Lesser Merchant, regulate the Right Foot Yang-ming. Hailen Merchant and Upper Merchant, regulate the Left Foot Tai-yang.

2: 上徵與右徵同穀麥、畜羊、果杏，手少陰藏心，色赤味苦，時夏。上羽與大羽，同穀大豆，畜彘，果栗，足少陰藏腎，色黑味鹹，時冬。上宮與大宮同穀稷，畜牛，果棗，足太陰藏脾，色黃味甘，時季夏。上商與右商同穀黍，畜雞，果桃，手太陰藏肺，色白味辛，時秋。上角與大角，同穀麻、畜犬、果李，足厥陰藏肝，色青味酸，時春。 Above Prognostication and Right Prognostication both pertain to grain, livestock, fruits of peaches, the hands have secretive yin, color is red, bitter taste, in summer. Above Feathers and Great Feathers both pertain to great beans, livestock are horses, fruits are walnuts, hands have secretive yin concealing the kidneys, color is black, salty taste, in winter. Above Palace and Great Palace both pertain to millet, livestock are oxen, fruits are jujubes, sufficient for yang concealed at the spleen, color is yellow, sweet taste, in summer and autumn. Above Market and Right Market both pertain to wheat, livestock are chickens, fruits are peaches, hands have concealed yang at the lungs, color is white, pungent taste, in autumn. Above Horns and Great Horns both pertain to hemp, livestock are dogs, fruits are apricots, feet have concealed yin at the liver, color is green, sour taste, in spring.

3: 大宮與上角，同右足陽明上，左角與大角，同左足陽明上，少羽與大羽同右足太陽下，左商與右商，同左手陽明上，加宮與大宮同左足少陽上，質判與大宮，同左手太陽下，判角與大角同左足少陽下，大羽與大角，同右足太陽上，大角與大宮同右足少陽上，右徵、少徵、質徵、上徵、判徵、右角、釱角、上角、大角、判角。右商、少商、釱商、上商、左商。少宮、上宮、大宮、加宮、左角宮。眾羽、桎羽、上羽、大羽、少羽。 The Great Palace and the Upper Room are together at the right side of Yinman above, the Left Room and the Grand Room are together at the left side of Yinman above. The Lesser Feather and the Grand Feather are together at the right side of the Sun below, the Left Merchant and the Right Merchant are together at the left side of the Sun hand, the Added Palace and the Grand Palace are together at the left side of the Sun foot Little Yangming above, the Quality Judge and the Grand Palace are together at the left hand of the Sun below, the Judging Angle and the Grand Angle are together at the left side of the Sun foot Little Yangming below. The Grand Feather and the Grand Angle are together at the right side of the Sun above, the Grand Angle and the Grand Palace are together at the right side of the Sun foot Little Yangming above, Right Probe, Lesser Probe, Quality Probe, Upper Probe, Judge Probe, Right Angle, Nail Angle, Upper Angle, Grand Angle, Judge Angle. Right Merchant, Lesser Merchant, Nail Merchant, Upper Merchant, Left Merchant. Lesser Palace, Upper Palace, Grand Palace, Added Palace, Left Angle Palace. Crow Feather, Hemp Feather, Upper Feather, Grand Feather, Lesser Feather.

4: 黃帝曰：婦人無鬚者，無血氣乎？歧伯曰：沖脈任脈皆起於胞中，上循背裏，為經絡之海，其浮而外者，循腹右上行，會於咽喉，別而絡唇口，血氣盛則充膚熱肉，血獨盛者澹滲皮膚，生毫毛。今婦人之生有餘於氣，不足於血以其數脫血也，沖任之脈，不榮口唇，故鬚不生焉。 Yellow Emperor said: Women without beards, do they have blood and vital energy? Duke of Ou replied: The Chong and Ren vessels both originate from the umbilicus, ascending along the spine to form the sea of Ying and Yang, with their superficial parts running along the right side of the abdomen, meeting at the throat, then branching off to connect the lips and mouth. When there is ample blood and vital energy, they nourish the skin and flesh, causing the blood to suffuse the pores and generate hair and beards. In women, their remaining vital energy is insufficient for blood, leading them to lose some of their blood, and thus the beards do not grow.

5: 黃帝曰：士人有傷於陰，陰氣絕而不起，陰不用，然其鬚不去，其故何也？宦者獨去何也？願聞其故。歧伯曰：宦者去其宗筋，傷其沖脈，血寫不復，皮膚內結，唇口不榮故鬚不生。 Yellow Emperor said: A gentleman has an injury to the yin. Yin qi is cut off and cannot rise; yin is not used, yet his hair does not fall out. Why so? And why do officials alone lose their hair? May I hear the reason? Duke of Zhou replied: The official cuts his ancestral sinews and injures his great vessel. Blood stagnates and no longer circulates, and the skin forms a knot. Therefore, the lips and mouth are not honored, and the hair does not grow.

6: 黃帝曰：其有天宦者，未嘗被傷，不脫於血，然其鬚不生其故何也？歧伯曰：此天之所不足也，其任沖不盛、宗筋不成，有氣無血，唇口不榮，故鬚不生。 Yellow Emperor said: Those who hold high office in Heaven have never been injured and do not shed blood. Yet their hair does not grow - what is the reason for this? Duke of Zhou said: This is an insufficiency of Heaven. Their mandate is weak and their governing power is unsuccessful, they have qi without blood, their lips and mouth are not honored, so their hair does not grow.

7: 黃帝曰：善乎哉！聖人之通萬物也，若日月之光影，音聲鼓響，聞其聲而知其形，其非夫子，孰能明萬物之精。是故聖人，視其顏色黃赤者，多熱氣，青白者少熱氣，黑色者多血少氣，美眉者，太陽多血；通髯極須者，少陽多血，美鬚者陽明多血，此其時然也。 Yellow Emperor said: Excellent! A sage's understanding of myriad things is like the light and shadow of the sun and moon, the sounds and reverberations, hearing their sound and knowing their shape. What about the gentleman? Can he understand the essence of a thousand things? Therefore, a sage observes the color yellow or red, which has much heat energy; green or white, which has little heat energy; black, which has much blood but little heat energy; beautiful eyebrows mean an abundance of yang blood; through the beard, one can tell the extreme yin and yang, with beautiful hair meaning an abundance of yang light. This is indeed so

8: 夫人之常數，太陽常多血少氣，少陽常多氣少血，陽明常多血多氣，厥陰常多氣少血，少陰常多血少氣，太陰常多血少氣，此天之常數也。 The nature of a woman is constant, the sun has more blood and less Qi, Shaoyang has more Qi and less blood, Yangming has more blood and more Qi, Bianyin has more Qi and less blood, ShaoYin has more blood and less Qi, Taiyin has more blood and less Qi. This is the constant nature of heaven as well.

In classical Chinese medicine terms: - Sun (Taiyang) - More Blood, Less Qi - Shaoyang - More Qi, Less Blood - Yangming - More Blood, More Qi - Bianyin (Liver and Lung) - More Qi, Less Blood - ShaoYin (Heart and Kidney) - More Blood, Less Qi - Taiyin (Spleen and Large Intestine) - More Blood, Less Qi.

docs.title: 百病始生
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問于歧伯曰：夫百病之始生也，皆生於風雨寒暑，清濕喜怒，喜怒不節則傷藏，風雨則傷上，清濕則傷下。三部之氣所傷異類，願聞其會，歧伯曰：三部之氣各不同或起於陰或起於陽請言其方，喜怒不節則傷藏，藏傷則病起於陰也，清濕襲虛，則病起於下，風雨襲虛，則病起於上，是謂三部，至於其淫泆，不可勝數。 Emperor Yellow asked Master Qi Bo: All hundred diseases are caused by external factors such as wind, rain, heat and cold, joy and anger. If joy and anger are not regulated, they will harm the interior; if there is an attack of wind and rain, it harms the exterior; if there is an attack of cold and dampness, it harms the lower part. I want to know how the three departments of Qi are affected differently, and how they may arise from Yin or Yang. Master Qi Bo replied: The three departments of Qi have different manifestations depending on whether they originate from Yin or Yang. If joy and anger are not regulated, it harms the interior, thus giving rise to diseases in the Yin; if there is an attack by cold and dampness, it targets the lower part, thus giving rise to diseases below; if there is an attack by wind and rain, it targets the upper part, thus giving rise to diseases above. This is how the three departments of Qi can be affected, and their excesses are countless.

2: 黃帝曰：余固不能數，故問先師願卒聞其道，歧伯曰：風雨寒熱不得虛，邪不能獨傷人。卒然逢疾風暴雨而不病者，蓋無虛，故邪不能獨傷人。此必因虛邪之風，與其身形，兩虛相得，乃客其形。兩實相逢，眾人肉堅，其中於虛邪也因於天時，與其身形，參以虛實，大病乃成，氣有定舍，因處為名，上下中外，分為三員。 Yellow Emperor said: I am indeed unable to count [on the body's defensive Qi], so I ask Master Qi to please explain its function. Qi Bo said: Wind and rain, cold and heat cannot harm [the body] when it is empty (without defensive Qi). Those who encounter sudden fever, windstorm, and heavy rain but do not fall ill are because they are empty, so the pathogenic factor cannot harm them. This must be due to the relationship between the defensive and pathogenic Qi and their bodily form. When one's body is robustly healthy, the pathogenic factor will have no place to attach. The disease arises from the interaction of defensive and pathogenic Qi at a particular time in accordance with one's bodily form. Therefore, there are three divisions: upper, middle, and lower.

3: 是故虛邪之中人也，始於皮膚，皮膚緩則腠理開，開則邪從毛髮入，入則抵深，深則毛髮立，毛髮立則淅然，故皮膚痛。留而不去，則傳舍於絡脈，在絡之時，痛於肌肉，故痛之時息，大經乃代，留而不去，傳舍於經，在經之時，洒淅喜驚。留而不去，傳舍於輸，在輸之時，六經不通四肢，則肢節痛，腰脊乃強，留而不去，傳舍於伏衝之脈，在伏衝之時體重身痛，留而不去，傳舍於腸胃，在腸胃之時，賁響腹脹，多寒則腸鳴飱泄，食不化，多熱則溏出糜。留而不去，傳舍於腸胃之外，募原之間，留著於脈，稽留而不去，息而成積，或著孫脈，或著絡脈，或著經脈，或著輸脈，或著於伏衝之脈，或著於膂筋，或著於腸胃之募原，上連於緩筋，邪氣淫泆，不可勝論。 Therefore, people who are possessed by demons and spirits, start from the skin. When the skin is loose, the hair-pores open up, and when they open up, the evil enters through the hairs. Once it has entered deeply, the hairs stand on end, which causes a state of bewilderment. Hence, there is pain in the skin. If one does not remove it, it passes into the sinews, at the time of the sinews there is pain in the muscles, thus at the time of the muscles one sighs, and the Great Classic speaks metaphorically. If one does not remove it, it passes into the channels, at the time of the channels there is dizziness, joy, and shock. If one does not remove it, it passes into the network vessels, at the time of the network vessels, the six channels do not connect to the limbs, causing joint pain, the loins and back become strong. If one does not remove it, it passes into the buried tendons' vessels, at the time of the buried tendons' vessels, the body feels heavy and aches in the entire body, if one does not remove it, it passes into the intestines and stomach, at the time of the intestines and stomach, there is distension in the abdomen. If there is cold, then the intestines make gurgling sounds and leak, digestion is impaired. If there is heat, then there is discharge of pus. If one does not remove it, it passes into the outside of the intestines and the original region, lodging in the vessels, accumulating further and sometimes attaching to the branch vessel, sometimes to the network vessel, sometimes to the channel vessel, sometimes to the drainage vessel, sometimes to the buried tendons' vessel, sometimes to the sinews and muscles, sometimes to the intestines and stomach's original region, ascending to the relaxed tendons, evil qi flows wantonly and cannot be described in detail.

4: 黃帝曰：願盡聞其所由然。歧伯曰：其著孫絡之脈而成積者，其積往來上下，臂小孫絡之居也，浮而緩，不能句積而止之，故往來移行腸胃之間，水湊滲注灌，濯濯有音，有寒則䐜䐜滿雷引，故時切痛，其著於陽明之經則挾臍而居，飽食則益大，飢則益小。其著於緩筋也，似陽明之積，飽食則痛，飢則安。其著於腸胃之募原也，痛而外連於緩筋，飽食則安，飢則痛。其著於伏沖之脈者，揣之應手而動，發手則熱氣下於兩股，如湯沃之狀。其著於膂筋，在腸後者飢則積見，飽則積不見，按之不得。其著於輸之脈者，閉塞不通，津液不下，孔竅干壅，此邪氣之從外入內，從上下也。 Yellow Emperor said: I wish to hear its origin clearly. Guan Pu said: It is due to the accumulation of Sun SiMiao's channels, which come and go up and down. The Small Intestine channel is related to Sun SiMiao, floating and slow, unable to stop the accumulation, so it comes and goes, moving between the stomach and intestines, regulating water, and generating sound and cold, causing pain when full. When it reaches the Yang Ming Meridian, it lodges in the connective tissue, and when one is overfed, it increases, while when hungry, it decreases. It lodges in the Shen Jin (tendons) and seems similar to the Yang Ming accumulation. When overfed, it causes pain, and when hungry, it becomes comfortable. It lodges in the source of the intestines and connects with the tendons outside, causing discomfort when hungry and pain when full. It lodges in the Fuai Meridian's channel, where it can be felt as a lump when hungry and not seen when full, and pressing on it is painful. It lodges in the vessel (Yin Wei) channel, where it can be felt by pressing the hand and moving the hand generates heat that goes down to the knees, like boiling water. It lodges in the Jue Yin Meridian, where pressing it causes discomfort at the back of the muscles of the intestines when hungry and not seen when full, and pressing on it is painful. It lodges in the Xuan Yin channel, which is blocked and does not circulate, leading to a buildup of body fluids, stuffiness in the orifices, and this is external pathogenic qi invading internally from outside and from above and below.

5: 黃帝曰：積之始生，至其已成，奈何？歧伯曰：積之始生，得寒乃生，厥乃成積也，黃帝曰：其成積奈何？歧伯曰：厥氣生足悗，悗生脛寒，脛寒則血脈凝澀，血脈凝澀則寒氣上入于腸胃，入于腸胃則䐜脹，䐜脹則腸外之汁沫迫聚不得散，日以成積。卒然多食飲，則腸滿，起居不節，用力過度，則絡脈傷，陽絡傷則血外溢，血外溢則衄血，陰絡傷則血內溢，血內溢則後血。腸胃之絡傷則血溢於腸外，腸外有寒，汁沫與血相搏，則併合凝聚不得散，而積成矣。卒然中外於寒，若內傷於憂怒，則氣上逆，氣上逆則六俞不通，溫氣不行，凝血蘊裏而不散，津液澀滲，著而不去，而積皆成矣。 Yellow Emperor asked: What do you mean by accumulating something that is just beginning to form, and what happens when it has been completed? Qi Bo replied: When something is just beginning to form and accumulates, it requires cold to be generated, and it reaches completion through yin. Yellow Emperor asked: And how does it become complete? Qi Bo replied: When the qi becomes abundant, the kidney qi generates cold, which causes the blood vessels to congeal and thicken. Congealed and thickened blood vessels cause cold qi to ascend into the stomach and intestines, leading to nausea and bloating. Nausea and bloating cause digestive fluids to clump together and not be able to disperse, eventually resulting in accumulation. If one eats and drinks excessively, the stomach becomes full, leading to irregular posture and overstraining of the tendons and vessels, causing injury to the yang vessels, which results in bleeding externally. Injury to the yin vessels causes bleeding internally, leading to dark blood. Injury to the stomach and intestines' vessels causes bleeding outside of the stomach, where cold exists, and digestive fluids clash with blood, causing them to coagulate and not disperse, eventually resulting in accumulation. In cases of excess internal and external cold, if one injures oneself internally due to worry and anger, qi will rise reversely, leading to the six channels becoming blocked, with stagnant qi not circulating, clotting blood within the vessels and not dispersing, causing fluids to become thick and sticky, leading to accumulation.

6: 黃帝曰：其生於陰者，奈何？歧伯曰：憂思傷心，重寒傷肺，忿怒傷肝，醉以入房，汗出當風傷脾，用力過度，若入房汗出洛，則傷腎，此內外三部之所生病者也。 Yellow Emperor asked: What about the one born of Yin? Huangdi replied: Sorrow, grief, and anxiety strain the heart; anger strains the liver; drinking leads to entering a room, sweating in the wind strains the spleen; overexertion can lead to sweating in Liao, thereby straining the kidneys. These are the diseases caused by internal and external organs.

7: 黃帝曰：善治之奈何？歧伯答曰：察其所痛，以知其應，有餘不足，當補則補，當寫則寫，毋逆天時，是謂至治。 Yellow Emperor asked, What is the way of good governance? The Duke of Zhou replied, Inspect what causes suffering and know what it requires. If there is not enough, one should supplement; if something needs to be written, then write it. Do not oppose heaven's decrees. This is the ultimate in governance.

docs.title: 行鍼
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問于歧伯曰：余聞九鍼於夫子，而行之於百姓，百姓之血氣，各不同形，或神動而氣先鍼行；或氣與鍼相逢；或鍼已出，氣獨行；或數刺乃知；或發鍼而氣逆；或數刺病益劇。凡此六者，各不同形，願聞其方。 The Yellow Emperor asked Yu the Great: I have heard of the Nine Needles from Confucius, but I am not sure how to apply them to common people. Their blood and qi are different in form, and sometimes the qi moves before the needle is inserted; sometimes the qi and the needle meet; sometimes the needle is already out when the qi acts; sometimes the number of needles can tell when the disease has changed; sometimes inserting a needle causes the qi to flow backwards; sometimes the number of needles used indicates that the illness becomes more severe. There are six different ways this can happen, and I would like to know how to treat each case

2: 歧伯曰：重陽之人，其神易動，其氣易往也。黃帝曰：何謂重陽之人？歧伯曰：重陽之人，熇熇高高，言語善疾，舉足善高，心肺之藏氣有餘，陽氣滑盛而揚，故神動而氣先行。 Duke of Zhou said: People who are akin to the autumn equinox, their spirits are easily changeable and their vitality is easily mobile. Emperor Yellow said: What do you mean by people who are akin to the autumn equinox? Duke of Zhou said: People who are akin to the autumn equinox are lively and lofty in spirit, speak eloquently and rapidly, lift their feet skillfully and nimbly, have an excess of vital energy in the heart-lung meridian, the Yang energy is smooth and abundant, causing the spirits to be changeable and the vitality to lead the way.

3: 黃帝曰：重陽之人而神不先行者，何也？歧伯曰：此人頗有陰者也。黃帝曰：何以知其頗有陰也。歧伯曰：多陽者，多喜；多陰者，多怒，數怒者，易解，故曰頗有陰。其陰陽之離合難，故其神不能先行也。 Yellow Emperor said: What do you mean by someone who is a descendant of Zhongyang but whose spirit does not precede? Guo Bo said: This person has some Yin quality. Yellow Emperor asked: How can you tell that this person has some Yin quality? Guo Bo said: Someone with more Yang tends to be joyful, while someone with more Yin tends to be angry, and people can easily tell if someone is often angry. Therefore, it can be inferred that the person has some Yin quality. The difficulty in separating Yin and Yang makes it so that their spirit cannot precede

4: 黃帝曰：其氣與鍼相逢，奈何？歧伯曰：陰陽和調，而血氣淖澤滑利，故鍼入而氣出，疾而相逢也。 Yellow Emperor said: When the qi meets with the needle, what should be done? Qi Bo replied: Yin and Yang are in harmony, and blood and qi flow smoothly, so when the needle enters, the qi comes out swiftly, causing them to meet.

5: 黃帝曰：鍼已出而氣獨行者，何氣使然？歧伯曰：其陰氣多而陽氣少，陰氣沉而陽氣浮者內藏，故鍼已出，氣乃隨其後，故獨行也。 Yellow Emperor said: What causes the needle to come out and the Qi to move independently? Huang Di said: The person has an excess of yin Qi and a deficiency of yin Qi, with yin Qi sinking and yang Qi rising. Therefore, the needle is inserted and then removed, and the Qi follows afterwards, causing it to move independently

6: 黃帝曰：數刺乃知，何氣使然？歧伯曰：此人之多陰而少陽，其氣沉而氣往難，故數刺乃知也。 Yellow Emperor said: By piercing several times, how does it know the energy? Huzi said: This person has more Yin and less Yang. Their energy is deep and difficult to reach, so by piercing several times, one can understand it.

7: 黃帝曰：鍼入而氣逆者，何氣使然？歧伯曰：其氣逆與其數刺病益甚者，非陰陽之氣，浮沉之勢也。此皆麤之所敗，工之所失，其形氣無過焉。 Yellow Emperor said: When the needle is inserted and the qi turns over, what kind of qi is this? Qi Bo replied: The turning qi is due to the number of needles used in treating the disease and the advancement of the disease. This is a defeat for the craftsman and a failure for the technician. Its form and qi are not flawed.

docs.title: 上膈
docs.text:
1: 黃帝曰：氣為上膈者，食飲入而還出，余已知之矣。蟲為下膈。下膈者，食焠時乃出，余未得其意，願卒聞之。歧伯曰：喜怒不適，食飲不節，寒溫不時，則寒汁流於腸中。流於腸中則蟲寒，蟲寒則積聚，守於下管，則腸胃充郭，衛氣不營，邪氣居之。人食則蟲上食，蟲上食則下管虛，下管虛則邪氣勝之，積聚以留，留則癰成，癰成則下管約。其癰在管內者，即而痛深，其癰在外者，則癰外而痛浮，癰上皮熱。 Yellow Emperor said: Qi is the upper yang, entering and exiting through food and drink. I already understand this. Worms are the lower yin. Lower yin occurs when food is not fully digested, and I do not yet understand its meaning; may I ask about it further? Kuang-hi Bo said: If joy and anger are not properly expressed, if food and drink are not properly consumed, if cold and heat are not timely, then the cold fluid flows in the stomach. When the fluid flows in the stomach, worms arise, worms accumulate, guard in the lower guan, leading to the stomach and intestines being distended, defensive Qi not circulating, and evil Qi residing there. When people eat, worms also eat, when worms eat, the lower guan becomes hollow, the hollow lower guan leads to evil Qi dominating, accumulating and remaining, resulting in a node's formation, and when the node is formed, the lower guan contracts. If the node is within the guan, it hurts deeply, if the node is outside, it hurts superficially and floats, and the skin over the node feels hot.

2: 黃帝曰：刺之奈何？歧伯曰：微按其癰，視氣所行，先淺刺其傍，稍內益深，逐而刺之，毋過三行，察其沈浮，以為深淺。已刺必熨，令熱入中，日使熱內，邪氣益衰，大癰乃潰。伍以參禁，以除其內，恬憺無為，乃能行氣，後以咸苦，化谷乃下矣。 Yellow Emperor asked: How should it be treated? Hua Tuo replied: Gently press the area of the boil, observe its movement, first superficially pierce around it, gradually deepen the puncture, proceeding in stages, and then pierce it. Do not exceed three times. Examine whether it sinks or rises, determining whether it is deep or shallow. After piercing, moxibustion must be applied, allowing the heat to enter deeply, causing the pathogenic qi to weaken, and the large boil will resolve. Using mulberry bark, eliminate any internal pathogens, be calm and inactive, and then it can discharge pus and descend. Finally, use salty bland medicine to cause the grain-like substance to descend

docs.title: 湯液醪醴論
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問曰：為五穀湯液及醪醴，柰何。歧伯對曰：必以稻米，炊之稻薪，稻米者完，稻薪者堅。帝曰：何以然。歧伯曰：此得天地之和，高下之宜，故能至完，伐取得時，故能至堅也。帝曰：上古聖人作湯液醪醴，為而不用，何也。歧伯曰：自古聖人之作湯液醪醴者，以為備耳，夫上古作湯液，故為而弗服也。中古之世，道德稍衰，邪氣時至，服之萬全。帝曰：今之世不必已何也。歧伯曰：當今之世，必齊毒藥攻其中，鑱石鍼艾治其外也。 Emperor asked: Why is the broth of the five grains thick and the wine potent? The Duke replied: It must be made from rice and wheat, cooked with rice straw, and both are complete. Emperor asked: How come they are so complete? The Duke said: This comes from the harmony of Heaven and Earth, and the appropriateness of high and low. Thus, it can achieve completeness, and when the time is ripe, it can achieve strength. Emperor asked: Why did ancient sages make this broth and wine but not use them? The Duke replied: Since ancient times, the sage made this broth and wine as a preventive measure. In the ancient times, however, they did not use it because it was made. In later times when the virtues declined and evil Qi prevailed, using it would save all under heaven. Emperor asked: What about our times now? The Duke replied: Nowadays, we have poisonous drugs that attack within, and jade stones, needles, and moxa treat from outside.

2: 帝曰：形弊血盡而功不立者何。歧伯曰：神不使也。帝曰：何謂神不使。歧伯曰：鍼石道也。精神不進，志意不治，故病不可愈。今精壞神去，榮衛不可復收。何者，嗜欲無窮，而憂患不止，精氣弛壞，榮泣衛除，故神去之而病不愈也。 The emperor asked: What of one whose form is ruined and blood drained, yet achievements do not stand? Duke Huan replied: It is due to the lack of divine will. The emperor asked: What do you mean by lack of divine will? Duke Huan replied: It is the path of needling stones (referring to acupuncture). When the spirit and mind are not cultivated, intentions are not controlled, resulting in illness that cannot be cured. Now, with depletion and loss of spirit, the honored officials cannot be reinstated. This pertains to insatiable desire without end, accompanied by continuous worries, leading to a gradual decline of vital energy, and causing the loss of honor and defense, resulting in illness that cannot be cured

3: 帝曰：夫病之始生也，極微極精，必先入結於皮膚。今良工皆稱曰：病成名曰逆，則鍼石不能治，良藥不能及也。今良工皆得其法，守其數，親戚兄弟遠近音聲日聞於耳，五色日見於目，而病不愈者，亦何暇不早乎。歧伯曰：病為本，工為標，標本不得，邪氣不服，此之謂也。 The emperor said: A disease begins when it is extremely subtle and refined, and must first enter and settle on the skin. Nowadays, even good doctors all say that if a disease becomes famous as reversed, acupuncture and moxibustion cannot cure it, and good medicine cannot reach it. Good doctors all know the method, keep track of the number, and relatives and friends, whether far or near, hear about it through word of mouth, and see the five colors with their eyes every day. If the disease does not heal, what time would there be to not act early? Hui Bo said: Disease is the root, and diagnosis is the standard; if the standard cannot be established from the root, then the pathogenic qi will not dissipate, which is what is meant by this.

4: 帝曰：其有不從毫毛而生，五藏陽以竭也，津液充郭，其魄獨居，孤精於內，氣耗於外，形不可與衣相保，此四極急而動中，是氣拒於內，而形施於外，治之柰何。歧伯曰：平治於權衡，去宛陳莝，微動四極，溫衣，繆刺其處，以復其形。開鬼門，潔淨府，精以時服，五陽已布，踈滌五藏，故精自生，形自盛，骨肉相保，巨氣乃平。帝曰：善。 Emperor said: What does not arise from a single hair follicle can be brought about by the essence of the five organs and the Yang. The fluids fill the cavities, its spirit resides alone, the solitary consciousness dwells within, the vital energy is expended externally, the shape cannot be preserved with clothes, at this point, the four extremes are urgent in motion. This causes the Qi to repel from within, and manifest the form from without, how can it be treated? The Duke of Zhou replied: Regulate the balance between Yin and Yang, eliminate the deviation of Zhou, make subtle movements for the four extremes, warm the clothes, puncture the acupoints, thereby restoring its shape. Open the Ghost Gate, purify the Palace, refine the essence at the appropriate time, when the five Yangs have been established, tread and massage the five organs, thus the spirit will spontaneously emerge, the form will naturally be ample, the flesh and bones will be preserved, and the immense Qi will be pacified. Emperor said: Good.

docs.title: 憂恚無言
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問於少師曰：人之卒然憂恚，而言無音者，何道之塞？何氣出行？使音不彰？願聞其方。少師答曰：咽喉者，水谷之道也。喉嚨者，氣之所以上下者也。會厭者，聲音之戶也。口唇者，聲音之扇也。舌者，聲音之機也。懸壅垂者，聲音之關者。頏顙者，分氣之所泄也。橫骨者，神氣所使主發舌者也。故人之鼻洞涕出不收者，頏顙不開，分氣失也。是故厭小而疾薄，則發氣疾，其開闔利，其出氣易，其厭大而厚，則開闔難，其氣出遲，故重言也。人卒然無音者，寒氣客於厭，則厭不能發，發不能下，至其開闔不致，故無音。 Emperor Yellow asked the Master of Lesser Learning, saying: When a person suddenly feels grieved and sorrowful and has no speech, what causes it to block? What kind of energy is moving? Causes speech to be weak? I wish to hear its method. The Master of Lesser Learning answered, saying: The throat is the pathway for water and grain. The larynx is where the energy goes up and down. The uvula is the door for sound. The lips are the fan for sound. The tongue is the mechanism for sound. The hanging (epiglottis) and hanging (arytenoid cartilage) are the locks for sound. The cheeks are where the energy leaks out. The mandible is what the spirit-energy uses to control the projection of the tongue. Therefore, if a person's nasolacrimal duct does not retract and their uvula does not open, the energy is not balanced. This is why a person who suddenly feels cold and has no speech will not be able to emit energy or emit it easily. If a person suddenly feels hot and has no speech, they will have difficulty emitting and transmitting energy, causing their speech to be slurred.

2: 黃帝曰：刺之奈何？歧伯曰：足之少陰，上係於舌，絡於橫骨，終於會厭。兩寫其血脈，濁氣乃避。會厭之脈，上絡任脈，取之天突，其厭乃發也。 Yellow Emperor said: How should it be treated? Hua Tuo said: The deficiency is in the Kidney, located at the tongue, connected to the trapezius, and ends at the gallbladder meridian. By needling the blood vessels, the turbidity is avoided. The gallbladder meridian point is connected to the Governing Vessel, taken from the Du-1, and it is due to the blockage there that it occurs.

docs.title: 寒熱
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問于歧伯曰：寒熱瘰癧在於頸腋者，皆何氣使生？歧伯曰：此皆鼠瘻寒熱之毒氣也，留於脈而不去者也。 The Yellow Emperor asked Yi Bo, The chills and fevers of the body are all located in the area from the neck to the armpit; what kind of energy causes them? Yi Bo replied, These are the toxic energies of cold and heat from the mouse spirit. They lodge in the channels and do not leave.

2: 黃帝曰：去之奈何？歧伯曰：鼠瘻之本，皆在於藏，其末上出於頸腋之間，其浮於脈中，而未內著於肌肉，而外為膿血者，易去也。 Yellow Emperor asked: How can it be removed? Huang Di said: The root of the mouse's liver is in the gallbladder. Its tip comes out from between the neck and armpit, floats in the blood vessels, but is not attached to the muscle tissue on the inside, and on the outside it is pus-like blood. It can be easily removed.

3: 黃帝曰：去之奈何？歧伯曰：請從其本引其末，可使衰去，而絕其寒熱。審按其道以予之，徐往徐來以去之，其小如麥者，一刺知，三刺而已。 Yellow Emperor said: How to cure it? Huang Di (the Yellow Lord) replied: Take medicine from its root and treat the end, so that one can prevent further deterioration while not completely curing the cold and heat. After examining the pathogenesis and providing the medicine, approach gradually and eliminate it. If it is minor like millet, a needle prick can identify it, three needles and it's done.

4: 黃帝曰：決其生死奈何？歧伯曰：反其目視之，其中有赤脈，上下貫瞳子，見一脈，一歲死；見一脈半，一歲半死；見二脈，二歲死；見二脈半，二歲半死；見三脈，三歲而死。見赤脈不下貫瞳子，可治也。 Yellow Emperor asked: How can one determine life and death? Huanbo replied: If you look at the eyes, there is a red pulse. If it is seen above and below the pupil, this person will die in one year. If only half of it is seen, the person will be half-dead in one year. If two pulses are seen, the person will die in two years. If only half of them are seen, the person will be half-dead in two years. If three pulses are seen, the person will die in three years. If a red pulse is not seen below the pupil, it can be treated.

docs.title: 邪客
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問于伯高曰：夫邪氣之客人也，或令人目不瞑不臥出者，何氣使然？伯高曰：五穀入于胃也，其糟粕津液宗氣，分為三隧。故宗氣積於胸中，出於喉嚨，以貫心脈，而行呼吸焉。營氣者，泌其津液，注之於脈，化以為血，以榮四末，內注五藏六府，以應刻數焉。節氣者，出其悍氣之慓疾，而先行於四末分肉皮膚之間，而不休者也。晝日行於陽，夜行於陰，常從足少陰之分間，行於五藏六府，今厥氣客於五藏六府，則衛氣獨衛其外，行於陽，不得入于陰。行於陽則陽氣盛，陽氣盛則陽橋陷，不得入于陰，陰虛，故目不瞑。 The Yellow Emperor asked Confucius, Regarding the evil qi that is a guest, it may cause people to not sleep day and night. What kind of qi brings this about? Confucius replied, Five grains enter the stomach, their dregs and fluids nourish the vital qi, dividing into three channels. Therefore, the vital qi accumulates in the chest and issues forth from the throat, permeating the heart vessels and guiding respiration. The managed qi causes the fluids to flow through the vessels, transforming them into blood, irrigating the four extremities and nourishing the five organs and six palaces, responding to changes in numbers. The regulated qi emerges from the sharp qi's urgency and precedes in the gaps between the flesh, skin, and pores of the four extremities, unceasingly. During the day it acts in the Yang, at night in the Yin, always traversing the five organs and six palaces through the dividing channel of the little yin of the foot, today the qi of the five organs and six palaces is deficient, so the defensive qi guards its exterior, acting in the Yang and not entering the Yin. Acting in the Yang causes the Yang to be abundant, and the Yang being abundant causes the Yang Bridge to collapse, not entering the Yin, the Yin is empty, thus causing one not to sleep.

2: 黃帝曰：善。治之奈何？伯高曰：補其不足，寫其有餘，調其虛實，以通其道，而去其邪。飲以半夏湯一劑，陰陽已通，其臥立至。黃帝曰：善。此所謂決瀆壅塞，經絡大通，陰陽和得者也。願聞其方。伯高曰：其湯方以流水千里以外者八升，揚之萬遍，取其清五升，煮之，炊以葦薪火，沸置秫米一升，治半夏五合，徐炊，令竭為一升半，去其滓，飲汁一小杯，日三稍益，以知為度，故其病新發者，復杯則臥，汗出則已矣。久者，三飲而已也。 Yellow Emperor said: Good. How should I treat it? Duke of Gao said: Supplement its deficiencies, rectify its excesses, regulate its reality, and harmonize its virtues to guide its course, while eliminating its deviations. Drink a dose of Xiajiao soup, and the yin and yang will be connected, returning to normal sitting and standing postures. Yellow Emperor said: Good. This is what is called resolving stagnation and unblocking obstructions, regulating the meridians, harmonizing yin and yang, and achieving a balanced state. I hope to hear its method. Duke of Gao said: The soup formula consists of 8 ounces of water from a river over a thousand li away, boiled a hundred times, taking five ounces of the clear liquid, boiling it, steaming it with reeds and willows, adding one cup of millet rice, simmering half an Xiajiao, cooking until it becomes one and a half cups, removing excess liquid, drinking the broth in small sips, gradually increasing by three cups per day to determine the appropriate dosage. In the early stages of illness, if you drink again, the patient will return to bed, and if sweating occurs, recovery is achieved. If prolonged, three drinks will be sufficient.

3: 黃帝問於伯高曰：願聞人之肢節以應天地奈何？伯高答曰：天圓地方，人頭圓足方以應之。天有日月，人有兩目；地有九州，人有九竅；天有風雨，人有喜怒；天有雷電，人有聲音；天有四時，人有四肢；天有五音，人有五藏；天有六律，人有六府；天有冬夏，人有寒熱；天有十曰，人有手十指；辰有十二，人有足十指，莖垂以應之，女子不足二節，以抱人形；天有陰陽，人有夫妻；歲有三百六十五日，人有三百六十節；地有高山，人有肩膝；地有深谷，人有腋膕；地有十二經水，人有十二經脈；地有泉脈，人有衛氣；地有草蓂，人有毫毛；天有晝夜，人有臥起；天有列星，人有牙齒；地有小山，人有小節；地有山石，人有高骨；地有林木，人有募筋；地有聚邑，人有膕肉；歲有十二月，人有十二節；地有四時不生草，人有無子。此人與天地相應者也。 Yellow Emperor asked Bo Gao, I wish to hear how the human body corresponds with heaven and earth? Bo Gao replied, Heaven is round and wide, and humans have round heads and feet to correspond with it. Heaven has the sun and moon, humans have two eyes; Earth has nine regions, humans have nine orifices; Heaven has wind and rain, humans have joy and anger; Heaven has thunder and lightning, humans have sounds; Heaven has the four seasons, humans have four limbs; Heaven has the five tones, humans have five organs; Heaven has the six laws, humans have six departments; Heaven has winter and summer, humans have cold and heat; Heaven is called Ten, humans have ten fingers; The pole has twelve, humans have ten toes, their hairs falling down corresponding; Women lacking two limbs embrace human forms; Heaven has yin and yang, humans have husband and wife; A year has three hundred and sixty-five days, humans have three hundred and sixty joints; High mountains in the Earth have humans' shoulders and knees; Deep valleys in the Earth have humans' armpits and elbows; The twelve meridians of water in the Earth have humans' twelve meridian vessels; The earth has Qi channels, humans have defensive Qi; The earth has grasses and weeds, humans have hair follicles; Heaven has day and night, humans have lying down and getting up; Heaven has starry constellations, humans have teeth; Small mountains in the Earth have small joints; Rocks and stones in the Earth have hard bones; Forests and trees in the Earth have tense muscles; Gathered cities in the Earth have fleshy muscles; Twelve months in a year, humans have twelve joints. Humans correspond with heaven and earth.

4: 黃帝問於歧伯曰：余願聞持鍼之數，內鍼之理，縱舍之意，扞皮開腠理，奈何？脈之屈折，出入之處，焉至而出，焉至而止，焉至而徐，焉至而疾，焉至而入，六府之輸於身者，余願盡聞，少序別離之處，離而入陰，別而入陽，此何道而從行，願盡聞其方。歧伯曰：帝之所問，鍼道畢矣。 Yellow Emperor asked Qi Bo, saying: I wish to hear about the techniques of acupuncture, the principles of internal acupuncture, the intentions of abandoning or retaining, and the methods of opening the skin and separating the sinews. What about the bending, stretching, slowing, hastening, entering, and the six palaces' inputs to the body? I wish to fully understand these aspects, the order of succession, the points of departure and entry, leaving to enter yin and departing to enter yang. How do these methods follow a certain path? I wish to fully understand their approach. Qi Bo replied: The Emperor's questions have completed the theory of acupuncture.

5: 黃帝曰：願卒聞之。歧伯曰：手太陰之脈，出於大指之端，內屈，循白肉際，至本節之後太淵，留以澹，外屈，上於本節下，內屈，與陰諸絡會於魚際，數脈並注，其氣滑利，伏行壅骨之下，外屈，出於寸口而行，上至於肘內廉，入于大筋之下，內屈，上行臑陰，入腋下，內屈，走肺。此順行逆數之屈折也。心主之脈，出於中指之端，內屈，循中指內廉以上，留於掌中，伏行兩骨之間，外屈，出兩筋之間，骨肉之際，其氣滑利，上二寸，外屈，出行兩筋之間，上至肘內廉，入于小筋之下，留兩骨之會，上入于胸中，內絡於心脈。 Yellow Emperor said: I wish to hear about it. Guan Ping replied: The Conception vessel (Ren Mai) is a channel that begins at the tip of the little finger, travels along the outer edge of the white part of the palm, and ends at the hollow below the thumb. It then turns inward, ascends along the Ren Mai, passes through the muscle layer, enters the chest, and connects with the Lung channel. This is a description of the Conception vessel's changes in direction

6: 黃帝曰：手少陰之脈，獨無俞，何也？歧伯曰：少陰，心脈也。心者，五藏六府之大主也，精神之所舍也，其藏堅固，邪弗能容也。容之則心傷，心傷則神去，神去則死矣。故諸邪之在於心者，皆在於心之包絡。包絡者，心主之脈也，故獨無俞焉。 Yellow Emperor said: The lesser yang channel, what is this? Huan Bo said: Lesser yang, it refers to the heart channel. The heart is the supreme of the five zang and six fu organs, the residence of the spirit, its location is firm and unyielding, and evil cannot dwell therein. If evil does dwell therein, then the heart will be injured; if the heart is injured, then the spirit will depart, and with the spirit's departure comes death. Thus, all evils lie within the heart's domain, which are under the mastery of the heart channel's connecting vessel. The connecting vessel is the heart channel's master branch, hence there is no point of connection (no Luo connective vessel).

7: 黃帝曰：少陰獨無俞者，不病乎？歧伯曰：其外經病而藏不病，故獨取其經於掌後銳骨之端。其餘脈出入屈折，其行之徐疾，皆如手少陰心主之脈行也。故本俞者，皆因其氣之虛實疾徐以取之，是謂因沖而寫，因衰而補，如是者，邪氣得去，真氣堅固，是謂因天之序。 Yellow Emperor said: If there is no Yin in Shao, will there be no illness? Hua Tuo said: When the exterior has passed through illness and concealed without sickness, one focuses on taking its course at the sharp end of the styloid process of the radius. The rest of the pulse exits and enters, bends and stretches, all as if reflecting the pulse of the heart governor. Therefore, those who originally have no Yin, all do so because their Qi is rapid or slow to obtain it, thus seeking harmony when weakened and supplementing when declining; this is known as following the natural order. When pathogenic Qi departs and true Qi becomes firm, this is known as following the order of Heaven.

8: 黃帝曰：持鍼縱舍奈何？歧伯曰：必先明知十二經脈之本末，皮膚之寒熱，脈之盛衰滑澀。其脈滑而盛者，病日進；虛而細者，久以持；大以澀者，為痛痺。陰陽如一者，病難治。其本末尚熱者，病尚在；其熱以衰者，其病亦去矣。持其尺，察其肉之堅脆，大小滑澀，寒溫燥濕。因視目之五色，以知五藏，而決死生。視其血脈，察其色，以知其寒熱痛痺。 Yellow Emperor said: Holding a lancet, what should one do? Duke of Shou replied: One must first clearly understand the origins and ends of the twelve meridians, as well as the skin's cold and heat, and the fullness and weakness of the pulse. If the pulse is slippery and strong, the illness will progress; if it is empty and thin, one should persist; if it is large and turbid, it will cause pain and numbness. If yin and yang are equal, treating the disease will be difficult. If the origins and ends of the meridians are still hot, the illness has not yet resolved; if the heat dissipates along with the weakness, then the illness is gone as well. Holding the zhang, examine the flesh's firmness and suppleness, large or small, slippery or turbid, cold or warm. Examine the five colors of the eyes to know the five organs and determine life and death. Look at the blood and pulse, examine their colors, to know whether it is cold, hot, painful, or numb.

9: 黃帝曰：持鍼縱舍，餘未得其意也。歧伯曰：持鍼之道，欲端以正，安以靜。先知虛實而行疾徐。左手執骨，右手循之。無與肉果。寫欲端以正，補必閉膚。輔鍼導氣，邪得淫泆，真氣得居。 Yellow Emperor said: Holding the lancet, one can pierce and let go; it is not yet at its purpose. Duke of Zhou said: The way of holding the lancet aims to be precise and accurate, how can it be still? Sage knows whether it is true or false and acts swiftly or slowly. With the left hand, grasp the bone, and with the right hand, follow along. There is no match with flesh and fruit. One desires to make it precise and accurate, but must close the skin. Aiding the lancet to guide the qi, if there are pathological factors, true qi can reside; if there are not, true qi can settle down.

10: 黃帝曰：扞皮開腠理奈何？歧伯曰：因其分肉，左別其膚，微內而徐端之，適神不散，邪氣得去。 Yellow Emperor asked: How does one flay the skin and separate the sinews? Hua Tuo replied: Because it is divided into muscles, the skin is separated from the left side, gently pushing inward while extending slowly. This allows the spirit to adapt without dispersing, and expels pathogenic Qi

11: 黃帝問於歧伯曰：人有八虛，各何以候？歧伯答曰：以候五藏。黃帝曰：候之奈何？歧伯曰：肺心有邪，其氣留於兩肘；肝有邪，其氣流於兩腋；脾有邪，其氣留於兩髀；腎有邪，其氣留於兩膕。凡此八虛者，皆機關之室，真氣之所過，血絡之所遊。邪氣惡血，固不得住留。住留則傷筋絡骨節；機關不得屈伸，故痀攣也。 Yellow Emperor asked Huang Di: What are the eight emptinesses? How does one attend to them? Huang Di answered: Attend to the five organs. Yellow Emperor asked: What is attending like? Huang Di said: If there is pathogenic factor in the lungs and heart, the qi will accumulate at the elbows; if there is pathogenic factor in the liver, the qi will flow to the shoulders; if there is pathogenic factor in the spleen, the qi will accumulate at the hips; if there is pathogenic factor in the kidneys, the qi will accumulate at the ankles. All eight emptinesses are related to the channels and collaterals, along which true qi flows and blood vessels circulate. Pathogenic qi and bad blood must not remain. If they stay, it will damage the muscles and bones; the channels cannot bend or stretch freely, so there is rigidity and pain.

docs.title: 通天
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問於少師曰：余嘗聞人有陰陽，何謂陰人？何謂陽人？少師曰：天地之間，六合之內，不離於五，人亦應之，非徒一陰一陽而已也，而略言耳，口弗能遍明也。黃帝曰：願略聞其意，有賢人聖人，心能備而行之乎？少師曰：蓋有太陰之人，少陰之人，太陽之人，少陽之人，陰陽和平之人。凡五人者，其態不同，其筋骨氣血各不等。 Emperor Yellow asked the Master, I have heard that there are Yin and Yang in people. What does 'Yin person' mean? What does 'Yang person' mean? The Master said, Between heaven and earth, within the six cycles, do not deviate from the five [elements], and people should also follow this. It is not just about one Yin and one Yang; although it can be briefly mentioned, the mouth cannot fully explain it. Emperor Yellow asked, I wish to hear a brief understanding of your meaning. Are there wise sages who have an enlightened heart and can act accordingly? The Master said, There are indeed people of Great Yin, Lesser Yin, Great Yang, and Lesser Yang. All five people have different demeanors, and their tendons, bones, qi, and blood are not equal.

2: 黃帝曰：其不等者，可得聞乎？少師曰：太陰之人，貪而不仁，下齊湛湛，好內而惡出，心和而不發，不務於時，動而後之，此太陰之人也。 Yellow Emperor said: Can you hear about those who are not equal? Master said: People of the Lesser Yin, greedy but not compassionate, lowly and shallow, preferring the inside but disliking the outside, their hearts harmonious but not enlightened, neglecting their duties in time, acting late, this is the kind of person of the Lesser Yin.

3: 少陰之人，小貪而賊心，見人有亡，常若有得，好傷好害，見人有榮，乃反慍怒，心疾而無恩，此少陰之人也。 A person with insufficient yin, being small-minded and having a thief's heart, upon seeing another in danger of death, always feels as if they have gained something, taking pleasure in harming or hurting them. Upon seeing another in honor, they become envious and angry, their hearts racing but lacking compassion. Such a person is one with insufficient yin

4: 太陽之人，居處於於，好言大事，無能而虛說，志發乎四野，舉措不顧是非，為事如常自用，事雖敗，而常無悔，此太陽之人也。 A person of the sun, dwelling in such a place, speaks eloquently about great matters, but is unable to practice what they preach. They are zealous and act without regard for right or wrong, handling their affairs as is proper, and even though their endeavors may fail, they never regret it; this is a person of the sun.

5: 少陽之人，諟諦好自責，有小小官，則高自宜，好為外交，而不內附，此少陽之人也。 A person of Shao Yung, always feels guilty, is modest when having a small official position, often engages in external affairs but does not attach themselves to internal matters, this is a person of Shao Yung.

6: 陰陽和平之人，居處安靜，無為懼懼，無為欣欣，婉然從物，或與不爭，與時變化，尊則謙謙，譚而不治，是謂至治。 A person of yin and yang harmony, resides in tranquility, without being frightened or pleased, without being attached to the material, sometimes not contesting, harmonizing with the times, being revered while humble, leaving traces but not fixing them, this is called ultimate governance.

7: 古之善用鍼艾者，視人五態，乃治之。盛者寫之，虛者補之。 In ancient times, those skilled in using acupuncture and moxibustion would observe the five aspects of a person's appearance, and treat them accordingly. For those who are healthy, they would record their condition; for those who are weak, they would supplement their energy.

8: 黃帝曰：治人之五態奈何？少師曰：太陰之人，多陰而無陽，其陰血濁，其衛氣澀，陰陽不和，緩筋而厚皮，不之疾寫，不能移之。 The Yellow Emperor asked: What about the five states of governing people? The Lesser Sage replied: Those governed by Yin, are excessively Yin without Yang. Their Yin blood is turbid and their defensive Qi is stagnant. With Yin and Yang not in harmony, they have weak muscles and thick skin, are slow to act, and cannot be moved

9: 少陰之人，多陰少陽，小胃而大腸，六府不調，其陽明脈小，而太陽脈大，必審調之，其血易脫，其氣易敗也。 A person with less yin has an excess of yin and deficient yang, a small stomach and large intestine, disordered six palaces, the yang link pulse is weak while the great yang pulse is strong, must regulate it, the blood is easily lost, the qi is easily damaged.

10: 太陽之人，多陽而少陰，必謹調之，無脫其陰，而寫其陽。陽重脫者易狂，陰陽皆脫者，暴死，不知人也。 The person of the sun is predominantly yang and lacks yin, so one must be cautious in their approach. It is not advisable to remove yin from them while focusing on their yang. Those who overemphasize yang can easily become insane, and if both yin and yang are removed, it will result in a violent death, unbeknownst to the person involved.

11: 少陽之人，多陽少陰，經小而絡大，血在中而氣外，實陰而虛陽。獨寫其絡脈，則強氣脫而疾，中氣不足，病不起也。 A person with a deficiency of Shao Yang, has an excess of Tai Yin, the channel is short but the collateral is large, blood is in the center while qi is outside, it is real yin and empty yang. If one only writes about the collateral channel, then the qi will be strong and leave quickly, there will not be enough qi in the middle, and the person will become ill.

12: 陰陽和平之人，其陰陽之氣和，血脈調，謹診其陰陽，視其邪正，安容儀，審有餘不足，盛則寫之，虛則補之，不盛不虛，以經取之，此所以調陰陽，別五態之人者也。 A person who is harmonious in yin and yang, their yin and yang energy will be balanced, and their blood vessels regulated. They carefully diagnose their yin and yang, observe their pathological conditions, handle them with appropriate measures, determine whether there is excess or deficiency, and write them down when they are abundant and supplement when they are empty. If there is neither abundance nor emptiness, take it from the classics. This is how to adjust yin and yang and differentiate between five states of people

13: 黃帝曰：夫五態之人者，相與毋故，卒然新會，未知其行也，何以別之？少師答曰：眾人之屬，不知五態之人者，故五五二十五人，而五態之人不與焉。五態之人，尤不合於眾者也。黃帝曰：別五態之人，奈何？少師曰：太陰之人，其狀黮黮然黑色，念然下意，臨臨然長大，膕然未僂，此太陰之人也。 Yellow Emperor said: In the case of a person with five types, they do not know each other. When there is an unexpected encounter, they do not know each other's movements. How can they be distinguished? The disciple answered: Most people do not know someone with five types, so among twenty-five people, there are only those with five types. People with five types are especially not suitable for the crowd. Yellow Emperor asked: How to distinguish a person with five types? The disciple said: A person with yin is in a state of mysterious blackness, thinking deeply, approaching and standing tall, unchanging before decaying, this is someone with yin.

14: 少陰之人，其狀清然竊然，固以陰賊，立而躁嶮，行而似伏，此少陰之人也。 A person of obscurity, their demeanor is clear and unexpected, they stand with agitation and hurry, move as if hiding, this is a person of obscurity.

15: 太陽之人，其狀軒軒儲儲，反身折膕，此太陽之人也。 The man of the sun has a majestic and radiant aura, bending and folding, this is indeed the man of the sun.

16: 少陽之人，其狀立則好仰，行則好搖，其兩臂兩肘，則常出於背，此少陽之人也。 A person of Shao Yang, their posture is good at elevating [their gaze], their movement is good at swaying, their two arms and two elbows are always extending from behind, this is a person of Shao Yang.

17: 陰陽和平之人，其狀委委然，隨隨然，顒顒然，愉愉然，䁢䁢然，豆豆然，眾人皆曰君子，此陰陽和平之人也。 A person of yin and yang harmony, their demeanor is soft and yielding, gentle and fluid, pleasing and refined, subtle and delicate, and humble. All people call such a person a true gentleman, this is a person of yin and yang harmony.

docs.title: 官能
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問于歧伯曰：余聞九鍼於夫子，眾多矣不可勝數，餘推而論之，以為一紀。余司誦之，子聽其理，非則語余，請正其道，令可久傳後世無患，得其人乃傳，非其人勿言。歧伯稽首再拜曰：請聽聖王之道。 Yellow Emperor asked Qi Bo, saying: I have heard of the Nine Needles from Confucius, and there are far too many to count. After examining and discussing them, I believe it can be considered as a record. I have committed it to memory, and my son has understood its meaning. If my understanding is incorrect, please correct me so that this teaching may be passed down for generations without harm, and only those worthy will pass it on and not speak of it if they are unworthy. Qi Bo bowed and prostrated himself again, saying: Please listen to the way of the holy king.

2: 黃帝曰：用鍼之理，必知形氣之所在，左右上下，陰陽表裏，血氣多少，行之逆順，出入之合，謀伐有過。知解結，知補虛寫實，上下氣門，明通於四海。審其所在，寒熱淋露以輸異處，審於調氣，明於經隧，左右肢絡，盡知其會。寒與熱爭，能合而調之，虛與實鄰，知決而通之，左右不調，把而行之，明於逆順，乃知可治，陰陽不奇，故知起時。審於本末，察其寒熱，得邪所在，萬刺不殆。知官九鍼，刺道畢矣。 Yellow Emperor said: The logic of acupuncture is to know the location of form and qi, left and right, up and down, yin and yang's exterior and interior, the amount of blood and qi, whether it goes in reverse or not, whether it enters or exits smoothly, whether there are plans to attack. Knowing the principles, knowing how to supplement and write the virtual and the real, opening and closing the air gate, understanding clearly in the four seas. Examine its location, examine cold and heat as they flow elsewhere, examine regulating qi, understand the classic passage, left and right tendons, know their intentions completely. Cold and heat contend, but can regulate and harmonize them, knowing the boundaries between emptiness and reality, passing through them completely, understanding reverse and forward, and thus knowing you can treat it. Examine beginnings and endings, examine cold and heat, find where the pathogens are, among thousands of needles there is no exhaustion. Knowing the official nine needles, the acupuncture course is complete.

3: 明於五俞徐疾所在，屈伸出入，皆有條理。言陰與陽，合於五行，五藏六府，亦有所藏，四時八風，盡有陰陽。各得其位，合於明堂，各處色部，五藏六府。察其所痛，左右上下，知其寒溫，何經所在。審皮膚之寒溫滑澀，知其所苦，膈有上下，知其氣所在。先得其道，稀而疏之，稍深以留，故能徐入之。大熱在上，推而下之；從上下者，引而去之；視前痛者，常先取之。大寒在外，留而補之；入于中者，從合寫之。鍼所不為，灸之所宜。上氣不足，推而揚之；下氣不足，積而從之；陰陽皆虛，火自當之。厥而寒甚，骨廉陷下，寒過於膝，下陵三里。陰絡所過，得之留止，寒入于中，推而行之；經陷下者，火則當之；結絡堅緊，火所治之。不知所苦，兩蹻之下，男陰女陽，良工所禁，鍼論畢矣。 In the residence of Xu Jí, there is a logical order to entering and exiting. Talking about yin and yang, they correspond with the Five Phases, the Five Viscera and Six Bowels also have their places, the four seasons and eight winds also have yin and yang. Each gets its proper position in the Bright Hall, each area of color corresponds to the Five Viscera and Six Bowels. By examining where it hurts, left and right, up and down, one knows its cold or warmth, which meridian it is in according to the Acupuncture and Moxibustion Canon. First determine its course, then thin and scatter it slightly, gradually deepening it so that one can enter slowly. Great Heat is above, push it down; from top to bottom, guide it away; when there is pain in front, take it first. Great Cold is outside, retain it and supplement it; when it enters the center, write from the union. Acupuncture should not be used without Moxibustion, and moxibustion should be applied where acupuncture is appropriate. If the Qi is not sufficient above, push and raise it; if the Qi is not sufficient below, accumulate and send it from below. When yin and yang are both deficient, fire will arise of itself. Extreme cold in the channels, bones sink downwards, cold exceeding the knees, knees sink downwards three li. The channel passes through, stop and hold it there, cold enters within, push and move it; at the place where the channel sinks down, fire will act upon it; knotted and tightened ligaments, fire is what treats them. Not knowing where it hurts, both legs bend downwards, male and female, skillful practitioners must restrain themselves in their discussion of Acupuncture.

4: 用鍼之服，必有法則，上視天光，下司八正，以辟奇邪，而觀百姓，審於虛實，無犯其邪。是得天之靈，遇歲之虛，救而不勝，反受其殃，故曰必知天忌，乃言鍼意。 Using acupuncture, there is a method; it relies on the celestial order and governs the Eight Constellations. It dispels strange and evil forces, and considers the common people while judging between truth and falsehood, without violating their nature. By doing so, one can receive the spirit of Heaven and encounter the vacuity of the year, rescuing but not being victorious, and eventually suffering its harm. Therefore, knowing the Heavenly aversion, this is called the intention of acupuncture.

5: 法於往古，驗於來今，觀於窈冥，通於無窮。麤之所不見，良工之所貴。莫知其形，若神髣彿。 Law from the past, verified in today and tomorrow, observed in hidden and profound, pervading inexhaustible. What the brush doesn't show, the skilled artist cherishes. Not knowing its form, like the divine Qi of antiquity.

6: 邪氣之中人也，洒淅動形；正邪之中人也，微先見於色，不知於其身，若有若無，若亡若存，有形無形，莫知其情。是故上工之取氣，乃救其萌芽；下工守其已成，因敗其形。 In the chaos of evil, a person is scattered and disordered in their movements; between good and evil, a person first appears in color, but does not know it within themselves. It is like having or not having, being alive or dead, having form but no form, and no one knows their state. Therefore, when taking the upper hand in cultivation, it is to save the budding potential; when practicing the lower techniques, guarding what has already become successful allows for the destruction of its form.

7: 是故工之用鍼也，知氣之所在，而守其門戶，明於調氣，補寫所在，徐疾之意，所取之處。寫必用員，切而轉之，其氣乃行，疾而徐出，邪氣乃出，伸而迎之，遙大其穴，氣出乃疾。補必用方，外引其皮，令當其門，左引其樞，右推其膚，微旋而徐推之，必端以正，安以靜，堅心無解，欲微以留，氣下而疾出之，推其皮，蓋其外門，真氣乃存。用鍼之要，無忘其神。 Therefore, the use of an acupuncture needle is to know where the qi is located and guard its door and window. One can excel in regulating qi and supplementing where it is needed. The speed may be fast or slow according to what one intends to take. Writing must use assistants, cut and turn them, and the qi will move quickly and come out smoothly. When treating evil qi, extend and meet them at a distance, open their orifices so that the qi can come out quickly. To supplement, one must use proper methods. Externally draw their skin, position themselves at the door of their passageways, left pull their joints, and right push their skin, turning it gently and pushing it slowly until it is upright, calm and firm. The will to be subtle is there to preserve it. Let qi descend quickly and come out forcefully, push their skin, seal their outer door, true qi will remain. The essence of acupuncture is not to forget the spirit.

8: 雷公問於黃帝曰：鍼論曰：得其人乃傳，非其人勿言，何以知其可傳？黃帝曰：各得其人，任之其能，故能明其事。雷公曰：願聞官能奈何？黃帝曰：明目者，可使視色；聰耳者，可使聽音；捷疾辭語者，可使傳論；語徐而安靜，手巧而心審諦者，可使行鍼艾，理血氣而調諸逆順，察陰陽而兼諸方。緩節柔筋而心和調者，可使導引行氣；疾毒言語輕人者，可使唾癰呪病；爪苦手毒，為事善傷者，可使按積抑痺。各得其能，方乃可行，其名乃彰。不得其人，其功不成，其師無名。故曰：得其人乃言，非其人勿傳，此之謂也。手毒者，可使試按龜，置龜於器下，而按其上，五十日而死矣，手甘者，復生如故也。 Lei Gong asked Yellow Emperor, The Longevity Needle Classic says that if you obtain a person's gift, it will be passed on, and not speaking of it is not an issue; how do you know it can be passed on? Yellow Emperor replied, Each obtains their person's gift and lets them develop their skills, so they are able to succeed in their tasks. Lei Gong said, I would like to hear about the officials who excel at this? Yellow Emperor said, Those who see clearly can use seeing colors; those who are clever can hear sounds; those who are skilled at speaking and writing quickly can transmit theories; those who speak slowly and maintain peacefulness, have nimble hands and careful minds can practice acupuncture and moxibustion, regulate blood and qi, and differentiate yin and yang while understanding all aspects. Those who are calm, gentle, soft, and harmonious in heart and temperament can guide the circulation of qi; those who speak harshly and lightly injure people can curse diseases; those with bitter hands and poisonous palms, skilled at causing harm for their work, can press and suppress blockages. Each one develops their skills, and only then can they succeed, and their names will be distinguished. Not obtaining someone's gift, their achievements will not be completed, and their teachers will remain unknown. Hence, obtaining someone's gift is speaking; not passing it on is not an issue, this is what I mean. The master who can test the needles can place the turtle shell on a container, press its top, and after 50 days, the turtle will die, but if the shell is unyielding, it will revive as before.

docs.title: 論疾診尺
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問于歧伯曰：余欲無視色持脈，獨調其尺，以言其病，從外知內，為之奈何？歧伯曰：審其尺之緩急小大滑澀，肉之堅脆，而病形定矣。 The Yellow Emperor asked Guan Pu: I want to examine the pulse without regarding color and observe it with the divining rod, in order to discern the disease and know internal from external, what should I do? Guan Pu replied: Consider the pulse's degree of fullness and urgency, its smallness or largeness, its smoothness or roughness, and the pulse's strength, which will define the form of the disease.

2: 視人之目窠上微癰，如新臥起狀，其頸脈動，時咳，按其手足上，窅而不起者，風水膚脹也。 Looking at a person's eyes, if they have a slight flicker like one who has just woken up, with a throbbing pulse in the throat, sometimes coughing, and pressing on their hands or feet does not make them wake up, it is an indication of weak Qi and Blood.

3: 尺膚滑，其淖澤者，風也。尺肉弱者，解併，安臥脫肉者，寒熱，不治。尺膚滑而澤脂者，風也。尺膚澀者，風痺也。尺膚麤如枯魚之鱗者，水泆飲也。尺膚熱甚，脈盛躁者，病溫也，其脈甚而滑者，病且出也。尺膚寒，其脈小者，泄、少氣。尺膚炬然，先熱後寒者，寒熱也；尺膚先寒，久大之而熱者，亦寒熱也。 The skin is smooth, and the fluid on it comes from the wind. The flesh is weak, a combination of heat and cold, and one who undresses while feeling heat or cold cannot be cured. Smooth skin with oiliness indicates the presence of wind. Dry, shriveled skin is due to dampness in drinking water. Skin that is heated excessively with throbbing pulse indicates illness from the environment. The person has an excessive and slippery pulse when the skin is hot. When it is cold and the pulse is small, this suggests a discharge of heat or deficiency of qi. Skin that glows fiercely, then cools down suggests that it is due to an alternating condition of heat and cold. When the skin first feels cold and then heated later, this also indicates a heat-cold condition.

4: 肘所獨熱者，腰以上熱；手所獨熱者，腰以下熱。肘前獨熱者，膺前熱；肘後獨熱者，肩背熱。臂中獨熱者，腰腹熱；肘後麤以下三四寸熱者，腸中有蟲。掌中熱者，腹中熱；掌中寒者，腹中寒。魚上白肉有青血脈者，胃中有寒。 Whoever has a sole heat in the elbow, has heat above the waist; whoever has a sole heat in the hand, has heat below the waist. Whoever has a sole heat at the front of the elbow, has the front of the chest hot; whoever has a sole heat at the back of the elbow, has the shoulder blade and back hot. Whoever has a sole heat in the middle of the arm, has waist and abdomen heat; whoever has heat at the back of the elbow down to the third or fourth inch, the intestines have worms. Whoever has heat in the palm, the abdomen is hot; whoever has cold in the palm, the abdomen is cold. If there is white meat on the fish with a blue blood vessel, the stomach has cold.

5: 尺炬然熱，人迎大者，當奪血；尺堅大，脈小甚，少氣，免有加，立死。 When the pulse is large and rapid, people will lose blood; when the pulse is hard and big, the pulse is small and weak, with little breath, one cannot avoid dying.

6: 目赤色者病在心，白在肺，青在肝，黃在脾，黑在腎。黃色不可名者，病在胸中。 Colors corresponding to organs in traditional Chinese medicine: Red represents the heart, white represents the lungs, green represents the liver, yellow represents the spleen, and black represents the kidneys. The color that cannot be named corresponds to a disease in the chest.

7: 診目痛，赤脈從上下者，太陽病；從下上者，陽明病；從外走內者，少陽病。 Upon examining the pain, if the pulsating redness moves from above to below, it is a disease of the Great Yang; if it moves from below to above, it is a disease of the Bright Yang; if it spreads outwards and gradually invades inwards, it is a disease of the Lesser Yang.

8: 診寒熱，赤脈上下至瞳子，見一脈一歲死；見一脈半，一歲半死；見二脈，二歲死；見二脈半，二歲半死；見三脈，三歲死。 Diagnose cold or heat, the pulse feels rapid and strong at the wrist, seeing one pulse indicates a person will die in a year; seeing half a pulse indicates a person will almost die in a year; seeing two pulses indicates a person will die in two years; seeing two halves of a pulse indicates a person will almost die in two years; seeing three pulses indicates a person will die in three years.

9: 診齲齒痛，按其陽之來，有過者獨熱，在左左熱，在右右熱，在上上熱，在下下熱。 Examining toothache, according to its Yang Qi circulation, those who have excess heat will have independent fever, left-sided fever, right-sided fever, upper fever, and lower fever.

10: 診血脈者，多赤多熱，多青多痛，多黑為久痺，多赤、多黑、多青皆見者，寒熱。 The practitioner of pulse diagnosis, often sees red and hot, green and painful, black for stagnation, and red, black, and green all indicate cold and heat.

11: 身痛而色微黃，齒垢黃，爪甲上黃，黃疸也。安臥小便黃赤，脈小而澀者不嗜食。 The individual has pale skin and is yellowish all over, with yellow teeth and nails. There are also yellow spots. When lying down and urinating, the urine is yellow or red. If the pulse is small and weak, this person does not like to eat.

12: 人病，其寸口之脈，與人迎之脈小大等，及其浮沉等者，病難已也。 If someone is sick, compare the pulse at their wrist with the pulse of a healthy person: if it is larger or smaller and if it rises and falls differently, then there is difficulty in treating the illness.

13: 女子手少陰脈動甚者妊子。 A girl with weak hands and moving Yin channels indicates pregnancy.

14: 嬰兒病，其頭毛皆逆上者必死。耳間青脈起者掣痛。大便赤瓣飧泄，脈小者，手足寒，難已；飧泄，脈小，手足溫，泄易也。 Infant illness, if the hair on its head grows upside down, it will surely die. Reddish pulses in the ears will cause pain. If the stool is red and flows out easily, the pulse is weak, with cold hands and feet, difficult to recover; if it flows out easily, the pulse is weak, and the hands and feet are warm, easy to recover.

15: 四時之變，寒暑之勝，重陰必陽，重陽必陰；故陰主寒，陽主熱，故寒甚則熱，熱甚則寒，故曰寒生熱，熱生寒，此陰陽之變也。 The four seasons, the dominance of hot and cold, heavy yin leads to light yang, and heavy yang leads to light yin; therefore, yin governs cold and yang governs heat. When cold is excessive, it gives rise to heat; when heat is excessive, it gives rise to cold. Therefore, it is said that cold generates heat, and heat generates cold - this is the change of yin and yang.

16: 故曰：冬傷於寒，春生病熱；春傷於風，夏生飧泄腸僻，夏傷於暑，秋生痎瘧；秋傷於濕，冬生咳嗽。是謂四時之序也。 It is said: In winter, one suffers from cold and in spring, one gets sick with fever; in spring, one is harmed by wind, and in summer, one experiences diarrhea, weak limbs, and dizziness. In summer, one suffers from heat, in autumn, one gets ill from dampness, and in winter, one has a cough. This is the order of the four seasons.

docs.title: 刺節真邪
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問于歧伯曰：余聞刺有五衛，奈何？歧伯曰：固有五衛，一曰振埃，二曰發蒙，三曰去爪，四曰徹衣，五曰解惑。黃帝曰：夫子言五衛，余未知其意。歧伯曰：振埃者，刺外經去陽病也；發蒙者，刺府俞，去府病也；去爪者，刺關節肢絡也；徹衣者，盡刺諸陽之奇俞也；解惑者，盡知調陰陽，補寫有餘不足，相傾移也。 Yellow Emperor asked Qi Bo, saying: I have heard that there are five needles. How about it? Qi Bo replied: Indeed, there are five needles: one is called vibrating needle, two is called sending-warmth needle, three is called removing-claw needle, four is called penetrating-robe needle, and five is called resolving-mystery needle. Yellow Emperor asked, If the master speaks of the five needles, I do not know their meaning. Qi Bo said: The vibrating needle is for external going out Yang disease; the sending-warmth needle is for ministerial office, removing ministerial disease; the removing-claw needle is for acupuncture at joints and tendons; the penetrating-robe needle is to fully acupuncture all the Yang's ministers; the resolving-mystery needle is to fully know regulating Yin and Yang, supplementing what has insufficiency, and making adjustments and moving accordingly.

2: 黃帝曰：刺衛言振埃，夫子乃言刺外經，去陽病，余不知其所謂也。願卒聞之。歧伯曰：振埃者，陽氣大逆，上滿於胸中，憤瞋肩息，大氣逆上，喘喝坐伏，病惡埃煙，飼不得息，請言振埃，尚疾於振埃。黃帝曰：善。取之何如？歧伯曰：取之天容。黃帝曰：其咳上氣窮拙胸痛者，取之奈何？歧伯曰：取之廉泉。黃帝曰：取之有數乎？歧伯曰：取天容者，無過一里，取廉泉者，血變而止。帝曰：善哉。 Yellow Emperor said: Zhongjing's speech on Zhen Xuan, saying that Zhen Xuan can treat Yang disease and eliminate illness, which I do not know what it refers to. I hope to hear about it. Qi Bo replied: Zhen Xuan refers to the great reversal of Yang Qi, which is filled to the brim in the chest, with anger and resentment filling the shoulders, causing a strong Yang Qi to rise up, shortness of breath and panting while sitting or lying down, illness from bad vapor, not being able to breathe comfortably. When asked about Zhen Xuan, it is still more urgent than Zhen Xuan. Yellow Emperor said: Good. How should one take it? Qi Bo replied: Take it from Tian Contong. Yellow Emperor asked: For those who have difficulty coughing and gasping for breath, how should they take it? Qi Bo replied: Take it from Plain Well. Yellow Emperor said: Is there a limit to this? Qi Bo replied: Taking from Tian Contong has no more than one li, and taking from Plain Well will stop the bleeding when blood changes. Emperor praised: Excellent!

3: 黃帝曰：刺衛言發蒙，餘不得其意。夫發蒙者，耳無所聞，目無所見，夫子乃言刺府俞，去府病，何輸使然，願聞其故。歧伯曰：妙乎哉問也。此刺之大約，鍼之極也，神明之類也，口說書卷，猶不能及也，請言發蒙耳，尚疾於發蒙也。黃帝曰：善。願卒聞之。歧伯曰：刺此者，必於日中，刺其聽宮，中其眸子，聲聞於耳，此其輸也。黃帝曰：善。何謂聲聞於耳？歧伯曰：刺邪以手堅按其兩鼻竅，而疾偃其聲，必應於鍼也。黃帝曰：善。此所謂弗見為之，而無目視，見而取之，神明相得者也。 Yellow Emperor said: The physician's explanation has deeply puzzled me, and I cannot grasp his meaning. The one who can comprehend it, there is nothing he has not heard or seen; you yourself have spoken of needles and moxibustion, removing the disease but not its cause; I wish to hear how this works. Hui Shi said: What a profound question! This great technique of needling is at the extreme limit of skill, involving divine insight, beyond what can be expressed in words or books; even so, asking about needling's method still falls short of its speed. Yellow Emperor said: Good. I wish to hear it explained further. Hui Shi said: The one who needles will do so at midday, inserting the needle into the ear palace and piercing the eyeballs, hearing sounds in the ears, this is what is transmitted. Yellow Emperor said: Good. What do you mean by hearing sounds in the ears? Hui Shi said: Needling falsely with a firm hand, pressing both nostrils closed, will quickly extract the sound, which must be applied with the needle. Yellow Emperor said: Good. This is what is called not seeing for it to happen, without eyesight, yet seizing and attaining divine insight.

4: 黃帝曰：刺衛言去爪，夫子乃言刺關節肢絡，願卒聞之。歧伯曰：腰脊者，身之大關節也；肢脛者，人之管以趨翔也；莖垂者，身中之機，陰精之候，津液之道也。故飲食不節，喜怒不時，津液內溢，乃下留於睪，血道不通，日大不休，俛仰不便，趨翔不能。此病榮然有水，不上不下，鈹石所取，形不可匿，常不得蔽，故命曰去爪。帝曰：善。 Emperor Yellow said: The palace attendant Zigong asked about the cause of the disease that had caused his fingers to become deformed. Zigong, there are three factors that contribute to this disorder, he explained. The first is a weak connection between your vertebrae in the lumbar region; the second is an unstable knee joint; and the third is the malfunction of the reproductive organs, which affect the movement of body fluids. Therefore, if you do not pay attention to your diet, or are hasty in expressing anger, the fluid will overflow into your extremities, causing blockage of the blood vessels, enlargement of the liver, difficulty bending over and standing straight, and impairment of movement. This disorder is known as 'disease of the deformed fingers.' Emperor Yellow said: I understand.

5: 黃帝曰：刺衛言徹衣，夫子乃言盡刺諸陽之奇俞，未有常處也。願卒聞之。歧伯曰：是陽氣有餘，而陰氣不足，陰氣不足則內熱，陽氣有餘則外熱，內熱相搏，熱於懷炭，外畏綿帛近，不可近身，又不可近席。腠理閉塞，則汗不出，舌焦唇槁，腊乾益燥，飲食不讓美惡。黃帝曰：善。取之奈何？歧伯曰：取之於其天府大杼三痕，又刺中膂，以去其熱，補足手太陰，以去其汗，熱去汗稀，疾於徹衣。黃帝曰：善。 Yellow Emperor: The physician has pierced my clothes; you are speaking of the masterful handling of the special needles. There is no fixed location for them. I wish to hear more about this. Qi Bo: The Yang Qi is excessive, while the Yin Qi is insufficient. If the Yin Qi is insufficient, there will be internal heat. If the Yang Qi is excessive, there will be external heat. When internal heat battles with external heat, the heat invades the pivot point, and externally one fears approaching cotton or silk materials too closely; it cannot be close to the body nor close to the seat. The marrow reasoning becomes blocked, so sweat does not come out, the tongue is parched and the lips are cracked, the limbs become dry and further heat accumulates. Food and drink do not taste good or bad. Yellow Emperor: Good. How should I take it? Qi Bo: Take it from its Jade Stove (Taiyang) at the Bao Zhong, Three Yin (San Jiao), and pierce the Zhongman. Remove the heat and supplement the foot Taiyang, remove the sweat, and when the heat is reduced and the sweat scant, it will be faster in piercing the clothes. Yellow Emperor: Good.

6: 黃帝曰：刺衛言解惑，夫子乃言盡知調陰陽，補寫有餘不足，相傾移也，惑何以解之？歧伯曰：大風在身，血脈偏虛，虛者不足，實者有餘，輕重不得，傾側宛伏，不知東西，不知南北，乍上乍下，乍反乍復，顛倒無常，甚於迷惑。黃帝曰：善。取之奈何？歧伯曰：寫其有餘，補其不足，陰陽平復，用鍼若此，疾於解惑。黃帝曰：善。請藏之靈蘭之室，不敢妄出也。 Yellow Emperor said: Zangzi, you have explained the confusion. How can it be resolved?
