4: 太陰所謂病脹者，太陰子也，十一月萬物氣皆藏於中，故曰病脹；所謂上走心為噫者，陰盛而上走於陽明，陽明絡屬心，故曰上走心為噫也；所謂食則嘔者，物盛滿而上溢，故嘔也；所謂得後與氣則快然如衰者，十二月陰氣下衰，而陽氣且出，故曰得後與氣則快然如衰也。 Regarding the becoming full illness of the Yin: This refers to the Yin itself, as in the eleventh month, the Qi of all things is stored within it. Hence it is called becoming full. As for the so-called ascending heart complaint, when the Yin is abundant and rises upward towards Yang Ming, Yang Ming belongs to the heart, hence it is called ascending heart complaint

5: 少陰所謂腰痛者，少陰者，腎也，十月萬物陽氣皆傷，故腰痛也；所謂嘔欬上氣喘者，陰氣在下，陽氣在上，諸陽氣浮，無所依從，故嘔欬上氣喘也；所謂色色不能久立，久坐起則目䀮䀮無所見者，萬物陰陽不定未有主也。秋氣始至，微霜始下，而方殺萬物，陰陽內奪故目䀮䀮無所見也；所謂少氣善怒者，陽氣不治，陽氣不治，則陽氣不得出，肝氣當治而未得，故善怒，善怒者，名曰煎厥；所謂恐如人將捕之者，秋氣萬物未有畢去，陰氣少，陽氣入，陰陽相薄，故恐也；所謂惡聞食臭者，胃無氣，故惡聞食臭也；所謂面黑如地色者，秋氣內奪，故變於色也；所謂欬則有血者，陽脈傷也，陽氣未盛於上而脈滿，滿則欬，故血見於鼻也。 Regarding those with a deficiency of the Kidney Yang and experiencing lower back pain, the Kidneys are the root of this. In the tenth lunar month, all creatures' Yang Qi is injured, hence the lower back pain. As for those who experience nausea and shortness of breath upon rising, the Yin Qi is below and the Yang Qi is above, with the Yang Qi floating without anything to support it, resulting in nausea and shortness of breath. Regarding those who cannot maintain their posture due to a deficiency of Yin and Yang, no one has ever governed the myriad creatures' Yin and Yang. When autumn energy arrives and the first frost falls, it kills all creatures, with the Yin and Yang of all creatures not yet stabilized and without a governor, causing them to lose their posture and not be able to see anything upon standing up. Regarding those who become easily angered due to a deficiency of Qi, the Yang Qi is disordered; since the Yang Qi is not discharged, the Liver Qi cannot regulate, leading to easy anger, which is known as Shan Jue. Regarding those who are afraid like someone about to be captured, the autumn energy has not yet completed its disappearance, with Yin deficient and Yang rising; Yin and Yang are insufficiently balanced, causing fear. Regarding those who dislike hearing sound and smell odor, the Stomach lacks Qi, so they dislike hearing sounds and smelling odors. Regarding those whose faces become black like the color of soil, the autumn energy has invaded internally, causing a change in their appearance. Regarding those who cough with blood when they exhale, it is damage to the Yang Meridian, with the Yang Qi not yet flourishing above and the pulse full; when full, there is coughing, and so blood appears at the nostrils.

6: 厥陰所謂㿉疝婦人少腹腫者，厥陰者，辰也，三月陽中之陰邪在中，故曰㿉疝少腹腫也。所謂腰脊痛不可以俛仰者，三月一振榮華萬物，一俛而不仰也。所謂㿉癃疝膚脹者，曰陰亦盛而脈脹不通，故曰㿉癃疝也。所謂甚則嗌乾熱中者，陰陽相薄而熱，故嗌乾也。 Regarding the so-called pubic swelling of women with less abdomen, it is the Yin (kidneys) that is involved, and the Three Yin Evil in the middle of the third lunar month. Therefore, it is called pubic swelling and slight abdominal distension. As for the so-called lower back pain that cannot be cured by bending forward, the third lunar month is a time of one shaking honor and glory for all things, bending forward but not bending backward. Regarding the so-called pubic rash, it means that the Yin (kidneys) is also abundant but the pulse is not well circulated, hence it is called pubic rash. As for the case of extreme heat and dryness in the urethra, the Yin and Yang are weak and there is heat, which causes the urethra to dry up.

docs.title: 金匱真言論
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問曰：天有八風，經有五風，何謂。歧伯對曰：八風發邪，以為經風，觸五藏，邪氣發病。所謂得四時之勝者，春勝長夏，長夏勝冬，冬勝夏，夏勝秋，秋勝春，所謂四時之勝也。東風生於春，病在肝，俞在頸項；南風生於夏，病在心，俞在胸脇；西風生於秋，病在肺，俞在肩背；北風生於冬，病在腎，俞在腰股；中央為土，病在脾；俞在脊。故春氣者病在頭，夏氣者病在藏，秋氣者病在肩背，冬氣者病在四支。故春善病鼽衄，仲夏善病胸脇，長夏善病洞泄寒中，秋善病風瘧，冬善病痺厥。故冬不按蹻，春不鼽衄，春不病頸項，仲夏不病胸脇，長夏不病洞泄寒中，秋不病風瘧，冬不病痺厥飱泄，而汗出也。夫精者身之本也，故藏於精者春不病溫。夏暑汗不出者，秋成風瘧。此平人脈法也。 The Yellow Emperor asked, There are eight winds in heaven and five winds in the Classic of Changes. What do they mean? The Duke answered, The eight winds emit pathogenic factors, which are called the winds of the Classic of Changes. They strike the Five Organs, causing pathogenic Qi to give rise to diseases. Those who master the seasons will know which one triumphs over the others: spring triumphs over long summer, long summer triumphs over winter, winter triumphs over summer, and summer triumphs over autumn, and autumn triumphs over spring. This is known as the triumph of the four seasons. The east wind arises in spring, affecting the liver and knotting at the neck and jaw; the south wind arises in summer, affecting the heart and knotting at the chest and back; the west wind arises in autumn, affecting the lungs and knotting at the shoulder and back; and the north wind arises in winter, affecting the kidneys and knotting at the hips. The center is Earth, affecting the spleen and knotting at the spine. Therefore, diseases of Qi in spring affect the head; those of summer affect the abdomen; those of autumn affect the shoulder blades; and those of winter affect the limbs. Hence, spring is prone to skin eruptions, summer is prone to chest disorders, long summer is prone to diarrhea and cold damage, autumn is prone to windstroke, and winter is prone to numbness and paralysis. Consequently, one should not suppress urges in winter, nor indulge in skin eruptions in spring, nor suffer from neck and jaw pain in spring, nor chest disorders in summer, nor diarrhea and cold damage in long summer, nor windstroke in autumn, nor numbness and paralysis in winter. When the latter does occur, one should sweat it out, which is known as the Plain people's pulse method.

2: 故曰：陰中有陰，陽中有陽。平旦至日中，天之陽，陽中之陽也；日中至黃昏，天之陽，陽中之陰也；合夜至雞鳴，天之陰，陰中之陰也；雞鳴至平旦，天之陰，陰中之陽也。故人亦應之。夫言人之陰陽，則外為陽，內為陰。言人身之陰陽，則背為陽，腹為陰。言人身之藏府中陰陽，則藏者為陰，府者為陽。肝心脾肺腎五藏，皆為陰。膽胃大腸小腸膀胱三焦六府，皆為陽。所以欲知陰中之陰，陽中之陽者何也。為冬病在陰，夏病在陽，春病在陰，秋病在陽，皆視其所在，為施鍼石也。故背為陽，陽中之陽，心也；背為陽，陽中之陰，肺也；腹為陰，陰中之陰，腎也；腹為陰，陰中之陽，肝也；腹為陰，陰中之至陰，脾也。此皆陰陽表裏內外雌雄相輸應也，故以應天之陰陽也。 Thus it is said: Within Yin there is Yin, within Yang there is Yang. At dawn, the sun's Yang is the Yang within Yang; at noon, the sun's Yang is the Yang within Yin; at the crowing of the cock, the sun's Yin is the Yin within Yin; and from the crowing of the cock to dawn, the sun's Yin is the Yin within Yang. Therefore, humans should follow this pattern. As for human Yin and Yang, the outside is Yang and the inside is Yin. As for the Yin and Yang of the human body, the back is Yang and the front is Yin. As for the Yin and Yang of the body's storage chambers, the stored element is Yin and the chamber is Yang. The five organs of storage—liver, heart, spleen, lung, and kidney—are all Yin. The six fu organs of the three burners—gallbladder, stomach, large intestine, small intestine, bladder, and triple burner—are all Yang. So, how does one know the Yin within Yin and the Yang within Yang? Treat winter diseases as being in the Yin, summer diseases as being in the Yang, spring diseases as being in the Yin, and autumn diseases as being in the Yang, all depending on where they are located. Therefore, the back is Yang, the Yang within Yang, which is the heart; the back is Yang, the Yang within Yin, which is the lung; the abdomen is Yin, the Yin within Yin, which is the kidney; the abdomen is Yin, the Yin within Yang, which is the liver; and the abdomen is Yin, the Yin within the utmost Yin, which is the spleen. All of these demonstrate the interplay between Yin and Yang in the human body's exterior and interior, as well as the male and female aspects, so humans should follow this pattern to correspond with heaven's Yin and Yang.

3: 帝曰：五藏應四時，各有收受乎，歧伯曰：有。東方青色，入通於肝，開竅於目，藏精於肝，其病發驚駭，其味酸，其類草木，其畜雞，其穀麥，其應四時，上為歲星，是以春氣在頭也，其音角，其數八，是以知病之在筋也，其臭臊。南方赤色，入通於心，開竅於耳，藏精於心，故病在五藏，其味苦，其類火，其畜羊，其穀黍，其應四時，上為熒惑星，是以知病之在脈也，其音徵，其數七，其臭焦。中央黃色，入通於脾，開竅於口，藏精於脾，故病在舌本，其味甘，其類土，其畜牛，其穀稷，其應四時，上為鎮星，是以知病之在肉也，其音宮，其數五，其臭香。西方白色，入通於肺，開竅於鼻，藏精於肺，故病在背，其味辛，其類金，其畜馬，其穀稻，其應四時，上為太白星，是以知病之在皮毛也，其音商，其數九，其臭腥。北方黑色，入通於腎，開竅於二陰，藏精於腎，故病在谿，其味鹹，其類水，其畜彘，其穀豆，其應四時，上為辰星，是以知病之在骨也，其音羽，其數六，其臭腐。故善為脈者，謹察五藏六府，一逆一從，陰陽表裏，雌雄之紀，藏之心意，合心於精，非其人勿教，非其真勿授，是謂得道。 The emperor said: The five viscera correspond to the four seasons, each having their own function. Duke Mu replied: Yes. The eastern color is green, it enters through the liver, opens the orifices of the eyes, stores the essence in the liver, and when there is disease, it manifests as shock and fright; its flavor is sour, its category is grasses, its birds are chickens, its grains are wheat, its season corresponds to the four seasons, above it is the seasonal star, so spring qi is in the head, its sound is jiao, its number is eight, thus knowing the disease is in the sinews.

The southern color is red, it enters through the heart, opens the orifices of the ears, stores the essence in the heart, so the disease is in the five viscera, its flavor is bitter, its category is fire, its animals are sheep, its grains are millet, its season corresponds to the stars, above it is the planetary star, thus knowing the disease is in the pulse, its sound is zhi, its number is seven, its smell is burnt.

The central color is yellow, it enters through the spleen, opens the orifices of the mouth, stores the essence in the spleen, so the disease is in the tongue origin, its flavor is sweet, its category is earth, its animals are oxen, its grains are millet, its season corresponds to the four seasons, above it is the star of tranquility, thus knowing the disease is in the flesh, its sound is gong, its number is five, its smell is fragrant.

The western color is white, it enters through the lungs, opens the orifices of the nose, stores the essence in the lungs, so the disease is in the back, its flavor is spicy, its category is metal, its animals are horses, its grains are millet, its season corresponds to the four seasons, above it is the star of the celestial terminator, thus knowing the disease is in the skin and hair, its sound is shang, its number is nine, its smell is fetid.

The northern color is black, it enters through the kidneys, opens the orifices of the two yin channels, stores the essence in the kidneys, so the disease is in the channels, its flavor is salty, its category is water, its animals are donkeys, its grains are beans, its season corresponds to the four seasons, above it is the star of the celestial stem, thus knowing the disease is in the bones, its sound is yi, its number is six, its smell is putrid.

Therefore, skilled in pulse diagnosis should carefully examine the five viscera and their six organs, one reversing and one following, yin and yang, exterior and interior, recording the female and male records, storing the essence in the heart-mind, combining the heart-mind with the essence, not teaching others unless one is skilled, not granting unless one is true - this is attaining the way.

docs.title: 刺要論
docs.text: 1: 黃帝問曰：願聞刺要。歧伯對曰：病有浮沈，刺有淺深，各至其理，無過其道；過之則內傷，不及則生外壅，壅則邪從之。淺深不得，反為大賊，內動五藏後生大病。故曰：病有在毫毛腠理者，有在皮膚者，有在肌肉者，有在脈者，有在筋者，有在骨者，有在髓者。是故刺毫毛腠理，無傷皮，皮傷則內動肺，肺動則秋病溫瘧，泝泝然寒慄；刺皮，無傷肉，肉傷則內動脾，脾動則七十二日四季之月，病腹脹煩，不嗜食；刺肉，無傷脈，脈傷則內動心，心動則夏病心痛；刺脈，無傷筋，筋傷則內動肝，肝動則春病熱而筋弛；刺筋無傷骨，骨傷則內動腎，腎動則冬病脹腰痛；刺骨，無傷髓，髓傷則銷鑠，胻酸，體解㑊然不去矣。 The Yellow Emperor asked, I would like to hear about acupuncture. Tong Fahui replied, Disease has a floating and sinking sensation, and acupuncture has shallow and deep insertion. Each one should be at its proper level without exceeding its limits; otherwise, it will cause internal injury, not reaching the appropriate depth will cause external obstruction, and obstruction will lead to the invasion of evil qi. If shallow and deep cannot be controlled, it becomes a great danger, causing internal movement of the five zang organs and leading to serious disease. Thus, disease can be in the hair follicles, skin, muscles, vessels, tendons, and bones. Therefore, acupuncture the hair follicles without harming the skin; if the skin is harmed, it will cause internal movement of the lung, leading to autumn diseases of fever and chills. If you acupuncture the skin without harming the muscles, but the muscles are harmed, it will cause internal movement of the spleen, leading to diseases occurring every seventy-two days in all four seasons, abdominal distension and discomfort, and lack of appetite. Acupuncture the muscles without harming the vessels; if the vessels are harmed, it will cause internal movement of the heart, leading to summer diseases of heart pain. If you acupuncture the vessels without harming the tendons, but the tendons are harmed, it will cause internal movement of the liver, leading to spring diseases of fever and tendon weakness. Acupuncture the tendons without harming the bones; if the bones are harmed, it will cause internal movement of the kidney, leading to winter diseases of lower back pain. If you acupuncture the bones without harming the marrow, but the marrow is harmed, it will lead to waste and body aches that do not go away.

docs.title: 刺齊論
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問曰：願聞刺淺深之分。歧伯對曰：刺骨者無傷筋，刺筋者無傷肉，刺肉者無傷脈，刺脈者無傷皮，刺皮者無傷肉，刺肉者無傷筋，刺筋者無傷骨。 The Yellow Emperor asked, I would like to hear about the distinction between shallow and deep needling. Hua Tuo replied, Superficial needling does not harm the tendons, needle insertion into tendons does not harm the flesh, needle insertion into the flesh does not harm the vessels, needle insertion into the vessels does not harm the skin, needle insertion into the skin does not harm the flesh, needle insertion into the flesh does not harm the tendons, and needle insertion into the tendons does not harm the bones.

2: 帝曰：余未知其所謂，願聞其解。歧伯曰：刺骨無傷筋者，鍼至筋而去，不及骨也。刺筋無傷肉者，至肉而去，不及筋也。刺肉無傷脈者，至脈而去，不及肉也。刺脈無傷皮者，至皮而去，不及脈也。所謂刺皮無傷肉者，病在皮中，鍼入皮中，無傷肉也。刺肉無傷筋者，過肉中筋也。刺筋無傷骨者，過筋中骨也。此之謂反也。 The Emperor said: I do not know what you mean, please explain it to me. Tongboyi said: When piercing the bone without injuring the tendon, you must remove it before reaching the bone. When piercing the tendon without injuring the flesh, you must remove it before reaching the tendon. When piercing the flesh without injuring the blood vessel, you must remove it before reaching the flesh. When piercing the blood vessel without injuring the skin, you must remove it before reaching the blood vessel. To pierce the skin without injuring the flesh means that the disease is in the skin, and by entering the skin, you do not harm the flesh. Piercing the flesh without injuring the tendon indicates that there is a problem with the tendon within the flesh. Piercing the tendon without injuring the bone indicates that there is a problem with the bone within the tendon. This is what is called reversal.

docs.title: 刺禁論
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問曰：願聞禁數。歧伯對曰：藏有要害，不可不察，肝生於左，肺藏於右，心部於表，腎治於裏，脾為之使，胃為之巿。鬲肓之上，中有父母，七節之傍，中有小心，從之有福，逆之有咎。 The Yellow Emperor asked, I wish to hear about the secrets of the numbers. The Duke answered, There are hidden dangers within it, which should not be overlooked. The liver is born on the left, the lungs are stored on the right, the heart is located on the surface, the kidneys are treated internally, the spleen controls it, and the stomach houses it. Above the gates, there are parents in the center, around the seven apertures, there is a small heart, through which comes fortune, and by reversing it brings punishment.

2: 刺中心，一日死，其動為噫。刺中肝，五日死，其動為語。刺中腎，六日死，其動為嚏。刺中肺，三日死，其動為欬。刺中脾，十日死，其動為吞。刺中膽，一日半死，其動為嘔。 The heart, when pierced, dies in a day and its movement is a sigh. When the liver is pierced, it dies in five days and its movement is speech. When the kidney is pierced, it dies in six days and its movement is coughing. When the lung is pierced, it dies in three days and its movement is groaning. When the spleen is pierced, it dies in ten days and its movement is swallowing. When the gallbladder is pierced, it almost dies in a day and its movement is vomiting. *Note: This text appears to be describing the movements or reactions of someone who has been wounded or attacked at different vital organs.

3: 刺跗上，中大脈，血出不止，死。刺面，中溜脈，不幸為盲。刺頭中腦戶，入腦立死。刺舌下中脈太過，血出不止為瘖。刺足下布絡中脈，血不出為腫。刺郄中大脈，令人仆脫色。刺氣街中脈，血不出，為腫鼠僕。刺脊閒，中髓為傴。刺乳上，中乳房為腫根蝕。刺缺盆中內陷，氣泄令人喘欬逆。刺手魚腹內陷為腫。無刺大醉，令人氣亂。無刺大怒，令人氣逆。無刺大勞人，無刺新飽人，無刺大饑人，無刺大渴人，無刺大驚人。刺陰股中大脈，血出不止，死。刺客主人內陷中脈，為內漏為聾。刺膝髕出液為跛。刺臂太陰脈，出血多立死。刺足少陰脈，重虛出血，為舌難以言。刺膺中陷中肺，為喘逆仰息。刺肘中內陷，氣歸之，為不屈伸。刺陰股下三寸內陷，令人遺溺。刺掖下脇間內陷，令人欬。刺少腹中膀胱溺出，令人少腹滿。刺腨腸內陷為腫。刺匡上陷骨中脈，為漏為盲。刺關節中液出，不得屈伸。 Puncturing the Skin:

  • Puncturing the heart causes death.
  • Puncturing the optic nerve leads to blindness.
  • Puncturing the forehead causes a fatal stroke.
  • Puncturing the tongue, causing bleeding that doesn't stop, results in ulceration.
  • Puncturing the sole causes swelling due to bleeding that doesn't stop.
  • Puncturing the navel results in gasping and choking.
  • Puncturing the belly of a fish causes dizziness.
  • Overworking without rest leads to fatigue.
  • Feeling hungry after a feast leads to discomfort.
  • Feeling thirsty after drinking too much water leads to discomfort.
  • Feeling frightened in shock leads to unease.
  • Puncturing the yin gate (the genitals) causes bleeding that doesn't stop, resulting in death.
  • Puncturing the internal organs of a client results in internal injury and deafness.
  • Puncturing the knee joint causes fluid to leak out, resulting in stiffness.
  • Puncturing the arm pit leads to difficulty in speaking.
  • Puncturing the lung causes coughing and shortness of breath.
  • Puncturing the elbow joint leads to immobility.
  • Puncturing the lower abdomen below the three palpable parts results in drowning.
  • Puncturing the ribcage causes the diaphragm to rupture, leading to difficulty breathing.
  • Puncturing the bladder causes bloating and fullness.
  • Puncturing the intestine near the bone causes swelling.
  • Puncturing the joints causes fluid to leak out, making it impossible to bend or straighten.

docs.title: 刺志論
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問曰：願聞虛實之要。歧伯對曰：氣實形實，氣虛形虛，此其常也，反此者病。穀盛氣盛，穀虛氣虛，此其常也，反此者病。脈實血實，脈虛血虛，此其常也，反此者病。 The Yellow Emperor asked, I wish to hear about the difference between substance and function. The Duke of Shou replied, When there is substance and form is substantial, when there is emptiness and form is empty, this is their normal state, and what deviates from this is considered illness. When grain is abundant and its Qi is abundant, when grain is scarce and its Qi is scarce, this is their normal state, and what deviates from this is considered illness. With the pulse being substantial and blood being substantial, with the pulse being empty and blood being empty, this is their normal state, and what deviates from this is considered illness.

2: 帝曰：如何而反。歧伯曰：氣虛身熱，此謂反也。穀入多而氣少，此謂反也。穀不入而氣多，此謂反也。脈盛血少，此謂反也。脈少血多，此謂反也。 The Emperor asked, How is this reversal? The Duke of Zhou replied, Gas is empty and the body is hot; this is called reversal. Grain enters in abundance but Qi is scarce, this is also called reversal. Grain does not enter and Qi is abundant, this is also called reversal. He also mentioned that when blood is plentiful and the pulse is weak, or if the pulse is abundant but the blood is deficient, these are also considered as reversals.

3: 氣盛身寒，得之傷寒。氣虛身熱，得之傷暑。穀入多而氣少者，得之有所脫血濕居下也。穀入少而氣多者，邪在胃及與肺也。脈小血多者，飲中熱也。脈大血少者，脈有風氣，水漿不入，此之謂也。 Gushing Qi and feeling cold, one may get chilled. Deficient Qi and feeling hot, one may get heatstroke. When grains enter in excess and Qi is insufficient, one might have bleeding and sweating below. When grains enter in deficiency and Qi is abundant, evil resides in the stomach and lung. When the pulse is small and blood is abundant, it means consuming hot drinks. When the pulse is large and blood is scanty, there is wind-Qi and water essence not entering, this being referred to. Note: This translation attempts to maintain the original structure of the Chinese text as much as possible

4: 夫實者，氣入也。虛者，氣出也。氣實者，熱也。氣虛者，寒也。入實者，左手開鍼空也。入虛者，左手閉鍼空也。 In reality, it is about the inward and outward flow of vital energy. When it is substantial, it is like Qi entering. When it is empty, it is like Qi exiting. When the Qi is substantial, it is like heat. When the Qi is empty, it is like cold. When entering something that is substantial, use your left hand to open the knife space. When entering something that is empty, use your left hand to close the knife space.

docs.title: 鍼解
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問曰：願聞九鍼之解，虛實之道。歧伯對曰：刺虛則實之者，鍼下熱也，氣實乃熱也。滿而泄之者，鍼下寒也，氣虛乃寒也。菀陳則除之者，出惡血也。邪勝則虛之者，出鍼勿按。徐而疾則實者，徐出鍼而疾按之。疾而徐則虛者，疾出鍼而徐按之。言實與虛者，寒溫氣多少也。若無若有者，疾不可知也。察後與先者，知病先後也。為虛與實者，工勿失其法。若得若失者，離其法也。虛實之要，九鍼最妙者，為其各有所宜也。補寫之時者，與氣開闔相合也。九鍼之名，各不同形者，鍼窮其所當補寫也。 Yellow Emperor asked, I would like to hear the explanation of the nine needles, the truth of the Way. Guanpu answered, Sticking the real, it becomes virtual; the needle penetrates heat, and the qi is real. Filling and discharging it, the needle penetrates cold, and the qi is virtual. Dispersing and eliminating, expelling evil blood, remove the needle. When the pathogenic factor prevails in the virtual, do not press the needle. Gradually pressing the real, quickly press the needle; quickly pressing the virtual, gradually press the needle. Speaking of real and virtual, it is a matter of the amount of qi being hot or cold. If there is none or if there is, it is difficult to know how fast or slow. Discern the later and earlier, knowing the order of disease progression. For the real and virtual, do not fail to use the method. When obtaining or losing it, separate from the method. The essence of real and virtual, the supreme skill of the nine needles, each has its own way to apply. Supplementing and opening at the time, correspond with qi's opening and closing. The name of the nine needles, each having a different shape, exhausts the needles according to what should be supplemented and opened.

2: 刺實須其虛者，留鍼陰氣隆至，乃去鍼也。刺虛須其實者，陽氣隆至，鍼下熱乃去鍼也。經氣已至，慎守勿失者，勿變更也。深淺在志者，知病之內外也。近遠如一者，深淺其候等也。如臨深淵者，不敢墯也。手如握虎者，欲其壯也。神無營於眾物者，靜志觀病人無左右視也。義無邪下者，欲端以正也。必正其神者，欲瞻病人目制其神，令氣易行也。 The needle must penetrate the virtual aspect, leaving the subtle energy to rise fully. When the needle penetrates the real aspect, the vital energy descends and the needle is removed. Be careful when the energy has arrived, and do not change or alter anything. Know the shallow and deep aspects of the disease, as well as its external and internal manifestations. Treat the near and far equally, and balance the timing of your approach. When faced with a difficult case, be cautious and hesitant. Hold the needle as if grasping a tiger, wishing for strength. Be free from distractions and maintain focus on the patient. Uphold righteousness without deviation, seeking to align the mind with the truth. By regulating the patient's spirit, you can observe their eyes and ensure that their energy flows freely.

3: 所謂三里者，下膝三寸也。所謂跗之者，舉膝分易見也。巨虛者蹻足，䯒獨陷者。下廉者，陷下者也。 The phrase three li refers to a distance of three inches kneeling. The term zhi refers to the act of lifting the knee, making it easily visible. If something is juxu, it is like a huge emptiness and if someone is lun zhu, they are alone and sinking. When someone is in a state of shi, they are sinking downwards.

4: 帝曰：余聞九鍼，上應天地四時陰陽，願聞其方，令可傳於後世以為常也。歧伯曰：夫一天二地三人四時五音六律七星八風九野，身形亦應之，鍼各有所宜，故曰九鍼。人皮應天，人肉應地，人脈應人，人筋應時，人聲應音，人陰陽合氣應律，人齒面目應星，人出入氣應風，人九竅三百六十五絡應野。故一鍼皮，二鍼肉，三鍼脈，四鍼筋，五鍼骨，六鍼調陰陽，七鍼益精，八鍼除風，九鍼通九竅，除三百六十五節氣，此之謂各有所主也。 The Emperor said: I have heard of the Nine Needles, which respond to heaven and earth, and the four seasons, yin and yang. I wish to hear their method so that it can be passed down to future generations as a constant principle. Duke Xing stated: The body has one heaven, two earths, three people, four seasons, five sounds, six laws, seven stars, eight winds, nine wildernesses. Each needle has its proper application, so they are called the Nine Needles. People's skin responds to heaven, their flesh to earth, their pulse to people, their sinews to time, their voice to sound, their yin and yang to regulating qi, their teeth and eyes to stars, their inhaling and exhaling of qi to winds, and their nine orifices and three hundred sixty-five channels respond to the wilderness. Therefore, one needle for skin, two needles for flesh, three needles for pulse, four needles for sinews, five needles for bones, six needles for regulating yin and yang, seven needles for nourishing essence, eight needles for dispersing wind, nine needles for connecting the nine orifices, and expelling the three hundred sixty-five disharmonious qi; these are each responsible for their own application.

5: 人心意應八風，人氣應天，人髮齒耳目五聲，應五音六律，人陰陽脈血氣應地，人肝目應之九，九竅三百六十五。人一以觀動靜天二以候五色七星應之以候髮毋澤五音一以候宮商角徵羽六律有餘不足應之二地一以候高下有餘九野一節俞應之以候閉節三人變一分人候齒泄多血少十分角之變五分以候緩急六分不足三分寒關節第九分四時人寒溫燥濕四時一應之以候相反一四方各作解。 The human heart and mind follow the eight winds, energy follows heaven, human hair, teeth, ears, eyes, five sounds, follow five notes and six rhythms. Human yin and yang pulse, blood and qi follow earth. Human liver and eyes follow nine, nine orifices, 365. Human observation of movement and stillness in heaven, follow the changing color of the five stars. Human hair follows the five notes, one following the palace, market, trumpet, and imply wings. Six rhythms have some insufficient to follow. One follows high and low, nine wilderness, one knot. Human variation following one division, follows the candidate teeth leak blood more ten divisions of variation. Five variations follow observing delay, urgency, six variations do not suffice three variations cold joints number nine parts. In four seasons, people follow the changing heat and humidity. Four directions each make a solution.

docs.title: 長刺節論
docs.text:
1: 刺家不診，聽病者言在頭，頭疾痛，為藏鍼之，刺至骨病已，上無傷骨肉及皮，皮者道也。 The acupuncturist did not examine, listening to the patient's words and noting that there was a headache. They inserted the needle to treat the bone disease, avoiding any injury to the bones, flesh, or skin. The term skin refers to the meridian channels.

2: 陰刺，入一傍四處。治寒熱。深專者，刺大藏，迫藏刺背，背俞也。刺之迫藏，藏會，腹中寒熱去而止，與刺之要，發鍼而淺出血。 Acupuncture, insert the needle one inch deep at four locations. Treat cold and heat. For specialists, insert the needle into the Dazhong, press and manipulate the Dazhong, which is located behind the point. When needling the Dazhong, the Qi will rise, and the cold and heat in the abdomen will resolve, corresponding to the Deqi sensation and shallow bleeding out of the needle.

3: 治腐腫者刺腐上，視癰小大深淺刺，刺大者多血，小者深之，必端內鍼為故止。 The text is in classical Chinese, which is not exactly literary Chinese as it is a vernacular form of written Chinese. However, I will attempt to provide a translation. 治腐腫者 (Treating tumors)，刺腐上 (insert needle into the tumor)，視癰小大深淺刺 (observing whether the swelling is small or large, deep or shallow, and inserting the needle accordingly)，刺大者多血，小者深之，必端內鍼為故止 (for larger ones, there will be more blood; for smaller ones, go deeper until it stops)。

4: 病在少腹有積，刺皮𩩻以下，至少腹而止，刺俠脊兩傍四椎閒，刺兩髂髎季脇肋閒，導腹中氣熱下已。 The illness resides in the lower abdomen and accumulates. Puncture the skin below the navel, proceed to the lower abdomen and stop. Puncture the kidneys at both sides of the four [vertebrae], puncture the hip bones and the ribs on both sides, lead the Qi in the lower abdomen downward and expel the heat.

5: 病在少腹，腹痛不得大小便，病名曰疝，得之寒，刺少腹兩股閒，刺腰髁骨閒，刺而多之，盡炅病已。 The illness is in the lower abdomen, causing abdominal pain and difficulty with both urination and defecation. This condition is called yinyang and is caused by cold. To treat it, needle the lower abdomen and the area between the two groins, and also needle the lumbar region near the hip bones. Needle this area frequently until the illness has resolved.

Note: This text appears to be a description of a traditional Chinese medical condition and its treatment.

6: 病在筋，筋攣節痛，不可以行，名曰筋痺，刺筋上為故，刺分肉閒，不可中骨也，病起筋炅，病已止。 The illness is in the sinew, the sinews and joints are painful, making it impossible to move. This condition is called Sinew Contraction. To treat this, you can needle the surface of the sinew, but do not needle the muscle fibers too deeply, as there should be no bone involvement. When the disease has subsided in the sinew, the illness will cease.

7: 病在肌膚，肌膚盡痛，名曰肌痺，傷於寒濕，刺大分小分，多發鍼而深之，以熱為故，無傷筋骨，傷筋骨，癰發若變，諸分盡熱，病已止。 The illness is in the flesh, the flesh is painful, it is called muscle spasm, injured by cold and dampness, needle large and small division, often insert a needle deep, due to heat as the cause, no injury to muscles and bones, injure muscles and bones, nodes are swollen like changes, all divisions are hot, the disease has stopped.

8: 病在骨，骨重不可舉，骨髓酸痛，寒氣至，名曰骨痺，深者刺無傷脈肉為故，其道大分小分，骨熱病已止。 The disease lies in the bones; the bones are too heavy to be lifted, the bone marrow is acidic and painful, the cold energy has reached a peak, and this condition is called bone paralysis. When the disease is deeply rooted, acupuncture must be performed without causing pain in the muscles and blood vessels, and the treatment path is divided into large and small divisions; the fire of bone disease has stopped.

9: 病在諸陽脈，且寒且熱，諸分且寒且熱，名曰狂，刺之虛脈，視分盡熱，病已止。 The illness is in the Zheng Yang (Zhengjiang) meridian, and it is both cold and hot, with the branches also being cold and hot. This disease is called Kuang (madness). When needling the empty channel, observe the division until there is heat, and the disease will be cured.

10: 病初發，歲一發，不治月一發，不治，月四五發，名曰癲病，刺諸分諸脈，其無寒者以鍼調之，病止。 At the onset of the disease, there is one case per year. If untreated, there are cases every month. This condition is known as convulsive mania. Stick needles at various points along the pulse, and if there is no cold, use a lancet to stimulate it, and the disease will cease

11: 病風且寒且熱，炅汗出，一日數過，先刺諸分理絡脈，汗出且寒且熱，三日一刺，百日而已。 The illness is both cold and hot, profuse sweating occurs, a day passes in counting. First, puncture the divisions of the channels and the network vessels, as there is still sweating that is both cold and hot, one puncturing per day, after one hundred days it is done.

12: 病大風，骨節重，鬚眉墮，名曰大風，刺肌肉為故，汗出百日，刺骨髓，汗出百日，凡二百日，鬚眉生而止鍼。 The patient had a fever, was heavy in weight, and had hair loss. He was named Da Feng (大風). He suffered from puncturing his muscles, sweating for 100 days, and then puncturing his bone marrow, sweating for another 100 days. After 200 days, the patient's hair grew back and stopped being lanced.

docs.title: 皮部論
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問曰：余聞皮有分部，脈有經紀，筋有結絡，骨有度量，其所生病各異，別其分部左右上下陰陽所在病之始終，願聞其道。歧伯對曰：欲知皮部以經脈為紀者，諸經皆然。陽明之陽，名曰害蜚，上下同法，視其部中有浮絡者，皆陽明之絡也，其色多青則痛，多黑則痺，黃赤則熱，多白則寒，五色皆見，則寒熱也，絡盛則入客於經，陽主外，陰主內。少陽之陽，名曰樞持，上下同法，視其部中有浮絡者，皆少陽之絡也，絡盛則入客於經，故在陽者主內，在陰者主出以滲於內，諸經皆然。太陽之陽，名曰關樞，上下同法，視其部中有浮絡者，皆太陽之絡也，絡盛則入客於經。少陰之陰，名曰樞儒，上下同法，視其部中有浮絡者，皆少陰之絡也，絡盛則入客於經，其入經也，從陽部注於經，其出者，從陰內注於骨。心主之陰，名曰害肩，上下同法，視其部中有浮絡者，皆心主之絡也，絡盛則入客於經。太陰之陰，名曰關蟄，上下同法，視其部中有浮絡者，皆太陰之絡也，絡盛則入客於經。凡十二經絡脈者皮之部也。 Emperor Yellow asked: I have heard that there are divisions of skin, channels and networks of the sinews, measured degrees of the bones, various diseases arising from them, distinguishing their divisions left and right, above and below, yin and yang aspects. I wish to learn about this method. Chi Po replied: To know about the division of the skin using channels and networks as reference is taught in all the classics. The Yang Ming's yang, named Hui Gui, has similar laws above and below, observe its part for any floating or swollen areas, these are all the floating networks of Yang Ming. If its color is predominantly blue, there is pain; if predominantly black, there is paralysis; if red or yellow, there is fever; if white, there is cold. With the five colors seen, this indicates cold and heat. When there is an abundance of floating networks, they enter the channels; yang governs outside while yin governs inside. The Shao Yang's yang, named Zhi Ri, has similar laws above and below, observe its part for any floating or swollen areas, these are all the floating networks of Shao Yang. When there is an abundance of floating networks, they enter the channels. Hence, in the case of the Yang aspect governing inside and the Yin aspect governing outside, it will be absorbed within. The Shao Yin's yin, named Zhi Ren, has similar laws above and below, observe its part for any floating or swollen areas, these are all the floating networks of Shao Yin. When there is an abundance of floating networks, they enter the channels. Their entry into the channels is from the Yang aspect and their exit is from the Yin aspect within the bones. The Heart Governor's yin, named Hui Gua, has similar laws above and below, observe its part for any floating or swollen areas, these are all the floating networks of the Heart Governor. When there is an abundance of floating networks, they enter the channels. The Tai Yin's yin, named Guan Ri, has similar laws above and below, observe its part for any floating or swollen areas, these are all the floating networks of Tai Yin. When there is an abundance of floating networks, they enter the channels. In summary, the twelve channels and network vessels are parts of the skin.

2: 是故百病之始生也，必先於皮毛，邪中之則腠理開，開則入客於絡脈，留而不去，傳入於經，留而不去，傳入於府，廩於腸胃。邪之始入於皮也，泝然起毫毛，開腠理。其入於絡也，則絡脈盛色變。其入客於經也，則感虛乃陷下。其留於筋骨之間，寒多則筋攣骨痛，熱多則筋弛骨消，肉爍䐃破，毛直而敗。帝曰：夫子言皮之十二部，其生病皆何如。歧伯曰：皮者，脈之部也。邪客於皮則腠理開，開則邪入客於絡脈，絡脈滿則注於經脈，經脈滿則入舍於府藏也，故皮者有分部，不與，而生大病也。帝曰：善。 Therefore, illness begins with one hundred diseases and first manifests in the skin and hair. In the pathological stage, the channels are opened, leading to the penetration of pathogens into the sinew-meridians, where they lodge without leaving, spreading to the organs, lodging without leaving, and spreading to the palace (abdomen). Pathogens enter through the skin and hair, causing small lesions and hair loss. When they invade the meridians, the meridian channels become distended and change color. When pathogens reach the organs, the body's Qi becomes depleted and weakened. The Emperor asked Master Qi: If you can explain how illnesses affecting the skin's twelve divisions arise, what will they be like? The Duke of Shou replied: The skin is a division of the meridians. When pathogens invade the skin, the channels open up, and the pathogens then penetrate the sinew-meridians. When the meridian channels are full, they spread to the organ meridians, which in turn enter and lodge in the palace (abdomen). That is why there are twelve divisions of the skin, and when they are not balanced, illness can develop into a serious condition. The Emperor said: I understand.

docs.title: 經絡論
docs.text: 1: 黃帝問曰：夫絡脈之見也，其五色各異，青黃赤白黑不同，其故何也。歧伯對曰：經有常色，而絡無常變也。帝曰：經之常色何如。歧伯曰：心赤，肺白，肝青，脾黃，腎黑，皆亦應其經脈之色也。帝曰：絡之陰陽，亦應其經乎。歧伯曰：陰絡之色應其經，陽絡之色變無常，隨四時而行也。寒多則凝泣，凝泣則青黑，熱多則淖澤，淖澤則黃赤，此皆常色，謂之無病。五色具見者，謂之寒熱。帝曰：善。 Emperor asked, Regarding the appearance of the pulse, its five colors are different: green, yellow, red, white, and black. What is the reason for this? The Grand Master replied, The Canon has constant colors, but the pulse does not have constancy in its variations. Emperor asked, What are the constant colors of the Canon? The Grand Master said, The heart is red, the lungs are white, the liver is green, the spleen is yellow, and the kidneys are black, all corresponding to the colors of the pulse. Emperor asked, Do the yin and yang of the pulse also correspond to the meridians? The Grand Master said, The color of the yin pulse corresponds to the meridian. The color of the yang pulse varies without constancy, following the four seasons. If there is much cold, it will become congealed and black; if there is much heat, it will become turbid and red. All of these are constant colors, and are said to be without disease. When the five colors are completely manifested, it is called cold and heat. Emperor said, Good.

docs.title: 氣穴論
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問曰：余聞氣穴三百六十五，以應一歲，未知其所，願卒聞之。歧伯稽首再拜對曰：窘乎哉問也。其非聖帝，孰能窮其道焉，因請溢意盡言其處。帝捧手逡巡而卻曰：夫子之開余道也，目未見其處，耳未聞其數，而目以明，耳以聰矣。歧伯曰：此所謂聖人易語，良馬易御也。帝曰：余非聖人之易語也，世言真數開人意，今余所訪問者真數，發蒙解惑，未足以論也。然余願聞夫子溢志盡言其處，令解其意，請藏之金匱，不敢復出。歧伯再拜而起曰：臣請言之，背與心相控而痛，所治天突與十椎及上紀，上紀者，胃脘也，下紀者，關元也。背胸邪繫陰陽左右。如此其病前後痛濇，胸脇痛而不得息不得臥，上氣短氣偏痛，脈滿起斜出尻脈，絡胸脇支心貫鬲，上肩加天突，斜下肩交十椎下。藏俞五十穴，府俞七十二穴，熱俞五十九穴，水俞五十七穴，頭上五行行五，五五二十五穴，中𦛗兩傍各五，凡十穴，大椎上兩傍各一，凡二穴，目瞳子浮白二穴，兩脾厭分中二穴，犢鼻二穴，耳中多所聞二穴，眉本二穴，完骨二穴，頂中央一穴，枕骨二穴，上關二穴，大迎二穴，下關二穴，天柱二穴，巨虛上下廉四穴，曲牙二穴，天突一穴，天府二穴，天牖二穴，扶突二穴，天䆫二穴，肩解二穴，關元一穴，委陽二穴，肩貞二穴，瘖門一穴，齊一穴，胸俞十二穴，背俞二穴，膺俞十二穴，分肉二穴，踝上橫二穴，陰陽蹻四穴，水俞在諸分，熱俞在氣穴，寒熱俞在兩骸厭中二穴，大禁二十五，在天府下五寸，凡三百六十五穴，鍼之所由行也。 Emperor asked, saying, I have heard that there are 365 acupuncture points to respond to one year. I am not aware of their locations. I would like to hear about them once again. Tang of Zhou bowed, paid respects and replied, What a difficult question! It is not that the sacred emperor cannot fathom it. So I humbly ask to expound in detail on their locations. The Emperor held out his hand and circumambulated saying, Your opening of my path; I have not seen its location, nor heard of its number, yet through you I am enlightened, and my ears are informed. Tang of Zhou said, This is what is called the easy language of a sage and the ease of controlling a good horse. The Emperor said, My easy language of a sage has not yet opened people's minds. Today, the truth I sought from you, the truth has enlightened me and dispelled my confusion. It is insufficient to discuss it. However, the Emperor requested Tang of Zhou to expound in detail on their locations, letting him understand their meanings, and asked him to conceal it in a golden casket, never to be revealed again. Tang of Zhou bowed and replied, Your subject explains it, my heart is pained and controlled, treating Heaven's lower aperture with Ten Windows and Upper Aperture. The Upper Aperture is the diaphragm, while the Lower Aperture is the Gate of Life. Back-muscle and Yang channels interweave to the left and right. If the disease is at the front, there will be pain in the back; if there is pain in the chest and diaphragm, one cannot breathe or lie down, with shortness of breath and pain on one side, the pulse will be full and slanting out of the guàn mèi. There are 57 water points, and 1 head point for each of the Five Lines. In total, there are 365 acupuncture points. These are the pathways to treat diseases.

2: 帝曰：余已知氣穴之處，遊鍼之居，願聞孫絡谿谷，亦有所應乎。歧伯曰：孫絡三百六十五穴會，亦以應一歲，以溢奇邪，以通榮衛，榮衛稽留，衛散榮溢，氣竭血著，外為發熱，內為少氣，疾寫無怠，以通榮衛，見而寫之，無問所會。帝曰：善。 Emperor: I have already learned the locations of the meridians, and practiced acupuncture at their points. Is there anything that Sun Ssu-ma has done in relation to the valley of Guan? Huan Bo: Sun Ssu-ma gathered 365 meridian points, which he applied for a year, excessively treating oddities, passing through the glorious defense, the defense dispersing gloriously, exhausting qi and blood, leading to exterior fever and interior deficiency of qi. It is urgent without rest, passing through the glorious defense, seeing it and writing about it without asking where he practiced. Emperor: Good

3: 願聞谿谷之會也。歧伯曰：肉之大會為谷，肉之小會為谿，肉分之閒，谿谷之會，以行榮衛，以會大氣。邪溢氣壅，脈熱肉敗榮衛不行，必將為膿內銷骨髓，外破大膕，留於節湊，必將為敗。積寒留舍，榮衛不居，卷肉縮筋，肋肘不得伸，內為骨痺，外為不仁，命曰不足，大寒留於谿谷也。谿谷三百六十五穴會，亦應一歲。其小痺淫溢，循脈往來，微鍼所及，與法相同。 I wish to hear about the meeting of the willows and valleys. The oblique says: the great assembly of meat refers to a valley, the small assembly of meat refers to a willow grove, the division of meat is leisurely, and the meeting of willow valleys, through activity and honor guards, it is large qi. Excess qi blocks, the pulse is hot, meat fails, and honor guards do not function, and it must become pus inside, break out outside, leaving at the joints, must be ruined. Accumulating coldness and staying in the shed, honor guards not residing, rolled flesh shrinks sinews, rib joints not being able to extend, inside is bone sequelae, outside is lack of benevolence, command says insufficient, great cold accumulates at willow valleys. The meeting of the willow valleys has 365 acupoints gathering, and should also be once a year. Its small sequelae lewdness excessively blocks, following the pulse going back and forth, micro-needling at the appropriate place, and following the law.

4: 帝乃辟左右而起再拜曰：今日發蒙解惑，藏之金匱，不敢復出，乃藏之金蘭之室，署曰氣穴所在。歧伯曰：孫絡之脈別經者，其血盛而當寫者，亦三百六十五脈，並注於絡，傳注十二絡脈，非獨十四絡脈也，內解寫於中者十脈。 The Emperor said, I have created the left and right and now stand up to offer my reverence again. Today I bestow wisdom and dispel confusion, sealing them within the Golden Cabinet and dare not reveal them again. I shall hide them in the room of the Jade Lady and name it the Place Where Qi Acupoints Are Located. The Duke said, The Unique Channel's branch channel is different from the Su Wen. There are a total of 365 channels, all recorded on the Unique Channel. It transmits the twelve channel vessels, but not just the fourteen channel vessels. Internal explanations are written in the middle of the text.

docs.title: 氣府論
docs.text:
1: 足太陽脈氣所發者七十八穴；兩眉頭各一，入髮至項三寸半，傍五相去三寸，其浮氣在皮中者凡五行，行五，五五二十五，項中大筋兩傍各一，風府兩傍各一，俠背以下至尻尾二十一節十五閒各一，五藏之俞各五，六府之俞各六，委中以下至足小指傍各六俞。 The seventy-two points emanating from the Sinew Channels are: On each eyebrow, one point, running from the hairline to the base of the neck three and a half inches, alongside the five Yin organs, five lines; in the center of the chest, one point, the Large Intestine meridian on each side, one point, Wind Pond on each side, one point, five behind each shoulder blade down to the end of the coccyx twenty-one vertebrae, fifteen pieces each, five points for the Five Organs, six points for the Six Divisions, and six points at either side of the little toe.

2: 足少陽脈氣所發者六十二穴；兩角上各二，直目上髮際內各五，耳前角上各一，耳前角下各一，銳髮下各一，客主人各一，耳後陷中各一，下關各一，耳下牙車之後各一，缺盆各一，掖下三寸脇下至胠八閒各一，髀樞中傍各一，膝以下至足小指次指各六俞。 There are 62 acupoints that originate from the foot Yangming channel. There are two on each of the upper angles, five each inside the hairline above the forehead, one each at the front and back of the ear, one at the bottom of the sharp hair, one for the master of the house, one in the hollow at the back of the ear, one at the huiyin, one at the lower part of the guan, one below the tooth-wheels, one each for the guest and the host, six on each of the shu points from the jingluo below the mingmen to the bao, one on the lateral condyle, one on each side of the hip joint, and six on the shu points from the jinmen down to the little toe and second toe.

3: 足陽明脈氣所發者六十八穴；額顱髮際傍各三，面鼽骨空各一，大迎之骨空各一，人迎各一，缺盆外骨空各一，膺中骨閒各一，俠鳩尾之外當乳下三寸，俠胃脘各五，俠齊廣三寸各三，下齊二寸俠之各三，氣街動脈各一，伏菟上各一，三里以下至足中指各八俞，分之所在穴空。 The points emanating from the foot Yangming channel are sixty-eight in number; on each side of the forehead, the temple, the cheekbone hollow, and the front of the ear, there is one space; at the great union and the small union, there is one space each; for the front and rear union, there is one space; outside the lower opening of the Baoji, there is one space in the breastbone hollow; on either side of the suprasternal notch, there are three spaces; outside the nipple tail, three inches from below, there are three spaces each; at the sides of the lower abdomen, there are five spaces each; at the sides of the grand and broad three inches each, and at the sides of the lower abdomen two inches each, there are three spaces each; for the channels of gastric qi circulation and the liver, there is one space each; above the Fu organs, there are one space each; from the third milepost to the tip of the toe, eight confluences each, and at the locations where they are, there are spaces.

4: 手太陽脈氣所發者三十六穴；目內眥各一，目外各一，鼽骨下各一，耳郭上各一，耳中各一，巨骨穴各一，曲掖上骨穴各一，柱骨上陷者各一，上天䆫四寸各一，肩解各一，肩解下三寸各一，肘以下至手小指本各六俞。 The thirty-six acupoints generated by the hand Taiyang meridian; one in each inner canthus of the eye, one outside each eye, one at the suprasternal notch, one at the external auditory meatus, one in the ear canal, one at the juji point, one at the top of the patella, one at the base of the stapes bone, one at the top of the vertebra prominens, four at each of the shoulders, three inches below the shoulders, six at each joint from the elbow to the little finger of the hand.

5: 手陽明脈氣所發者二十二穴：鼻空外廉項上各二，大迎骨空各一，柱骨之會各一，髃骨之會各一，肘以下至手大指次指本各六俞。 The twenty-two acupoints emanating from the Yang He (Hand Yangming) channel are: two at the Nasal Opening, two at the Mingmen (Royal Pearl), one in the Huanghuang (Yellow Emperor's Yellow Maple) point, one at the Jiexi (Gathering Marsh), and one at each of the Hequan (Pillar Meeting) and Haigui (Hairy Meeting) points. From the elbow to the tip of the hand, there are six points along the Shousanli (Bamboo Grove at the End) channel.

6: 手少陽脈氣所發者三十二穴；鼽骨下各一，眉後各一，角上各一，下完骨後各一，項中足太陽之前各一，俠扶突各一，肩貞各一，肩貞下三寸分閒各一，肘以下至手小指次指本各六俞。 The thirty-two acupoints formed by the yang qi of the small intestine meridian are: one at the sternum below, one above each eyebrow, one at the corner of the eye, one below the coccyx, one in front of the suprasternal notch, one at the axilla, one on the axillary fossa, one at the back of each shoulder, one within the shoulder blade's base, and six at the elbow joint down to the little finger's first joint.

7: 督脈氣所發者二十八穴；項中央二，髮際後中八，面中三，大椎以下至尻尾及傍十五穴，至骶下凡二十一節，脊椎法也。 The twenty-eight acupuncture points are emitted from the governor vessel; two at the central junction of the neck, eight at the hair's peak and back center, three on the face, fifteen below the large intestine to the tail and around it, with twenty-one nodes from the spinal vertebrae.

8: 任脈之氣所發者二十八穴，喉中央二，膺中骨陷中各一，鳩尾下三寸胃脘五寸胃脘以下至橫骨六寸半一，腹脈法也，下陰別一，目下各一，下脣一，齗交一。 The twenty-eight energy points generated by the pulse are: 1. Central throat (located in the center of the throat) 2. Breast bone depression (in the breastbone) 3. Epigastric point (three inches below the navel) 4. Nine points on the stomach (five inches below the epigastric point) 5. Stomach meridian points until six and a half inches from the center of the throat (also known as the abdominal meridian) 6. Lower abdomen (one additional point) 7. Eyes (two additional points) 8. Chin (one additional point) 9. Tongue meeting (one additional point).

9: 衝脈氣所發者二十二穴；俠鳩尾外各半寸至齊寸一，俠齊下傍各五分至橫骨寸一，腹脈法也。 The text describes the location and measurement of specific points related to abdominal palpation. Here is the translation: The twenty-two acupoints emanating from the pulse are located; each point of Qi men (Pectoralis minor) at the posterior axillary line, measured from half an inch to one inch apart, and each point of Jie xi (Rib 7) at the lateral margin, measured from five millimeters to one inch apart, abdominal palpation method.

10: 足少陰舌下厥陰毛中急脈各一，手少陰各一，陰陽蹻各一，手足諸魚際脈氣所發者，凡三百六十五穴也。 There are eleven points on the sole: one at the heel, one in the depression beneath the tip of the little toe, one in the depression below the great toe, and one each for the three yin intersections (solar plexus), the three shao yang intersections (gallbladder channel), and the six yang intersections (heart channel). All together there are 365 points.

docs.title: 陰陽應象大論
docs.text:
1: 黃帝曰：陰陽者，天地之道也，萬物之綱紀，變化之父母，生殺之本始，神明之府也，治病必求於本。故積陽為天，積陰為地。陰靜陽躁，陽生陰長，陽殺陰藏。陽化氣，陰成形。寒極生熱，熱極生寒。寒氣生濁，熱氣生清。清氣在下，則生飱泄，濁氣在上，則生䐜脹。此陰陽反作，病之逆從也。 Yellow Emperor said: Yin and Yang are the way of Heaven and Earth, the pillar and foundation of all things, the parents of change. The source of birth and death lies in them, and they are the abode of gods and spirits. When treating illness, one should seek the root cause. Therefore, accumulate Yang to represent Heaven, and accumulate Yin to represent Earth. When Yin is quiet and Yang is agitated, Yang generates Yin, and Yin nourishes Yang. Yang transforms Qi, and Yin takes form. Hot extremes generate cold, and cold extremes generate heat. Cold Qi generates turbidity, and hot Qi generates clarity. Clarity Qi resides below, and it generates diarrhea; turbid Qi resides above, and it generates vomiting. This is the reverse of Yin and Yang, and the progression of disease follows from this reversal

2: 故清陽為天，濁陰為地；地氣上為雲，天氣下為雨；雨出地氣，雲出天氣。 The Qingyang School states that yin is Heaven and yang is Earth; the energy of the Earth ascends as clouds, and the energy of Heaven descends as rain. Rain comes from the energy of the Earth, and clouds come from the energy of Heaven.

3: 故清陽出上竅，濁陰出下竅；清陽發腠理，濁陰走五藏；清陽實四支，濁陰歸六府。 The clear yang rises through the upper orifice, while the turbid yin exits through the lower orifice; when the clear yang ascends to the head, the turbid yin disperses throughout the five organs; when the clear yang is complete in the four limbs, the turbid yin returns to the six departments.

4: 水為陰，火為陽，陽為氣，陰為味。味歸形，形歸氣，氣歸精，精歸化，精食氣，形食味，化生精，氣生形。味傷形，氣傷精，精化為氣，氣傷於味。陰味出下竅，陽氣出上竅。味厚者為陰，薄為陰之陽。氣厚者為陽，薄為陽之陰。味厚則泄，薄則通。氣薄則發泄，厚則發熱。壯火之氣衰，少火之氣壯。壯火食氣，氣食少火。壯火散氣，少火生氣。氣味，辛甘發散為陽，酸苦涌泄為陰。 Water is Yin, fire is Yang, Yang is Qi, and Yin is flavor. Flavor nourishes form, form nourishes Qi, Qi nourishes essence, essence transforms into food, and the Qi generates form. When flavor is harmed, Qi is also harmed; when essence is transformed into Qi, Qi will be harmed by flavor. Yin flavor exits through the lower orifice, while Yang Qi exits through the upper orifice. Flavor that is thick pertains to Yin, and what is thin pertains to Yin's Yang. Qi that is thick pertains to Yang, and what is thin pertains to Yang's Yin. Thick flavor leaks, while thin flavor circulates freely. When Qi is thin, it leaks; when it is thick, it generates heat. The robust fire's Qi wanes, while the scant fire's Qi becomes robust. Robust fire consumes Qi, and Qi consumes scant fire. Robust fire disperses Qi, and scant fire generates Qi. Flavor and Qi, bitter and sweet dissipate and scatter as Yang; sour and salty induce excretion as Yin

5: 陰勝則陽病，陽勝則陰病。陽勝則熱，陰勝則寒。重寒則熱，重熱則寒。寒傷形，熱傷氣。氣傷痛，形傷腫。故先痛而後腫者，氣傷形也；先腫而後痛者，形傷氣也。風勝則動，熱勝則腫，燥勝則乾，寒勝則浮，濕勝則濡寫。 When yin prevails, yang becomes sick; when yang prevails, yin becomes sick. When yang prevails, there is heat; when yin prevails, there is cold. Excessive cold leads to heat, excessive heat leads to cold. Cold damage causes form, and heat damage causes qi. Qi damage hurts form, and form damage swells. Therefore, if one first experiences pain and then swelling, it is qi damage causing form; if one first experiences swelling and then pain, it is form damage causing qi. If wind prevails, there will be movement; if heat prevails, there will be swelling; if dryness prevails, there will be dryness; if cold prevails, there will be floating; if dampness prevails, there will be clamminess.

6: 天有四時五行，以生長收藏，以生寒暑燥濕風。人有五藏，化五氣，以生喜怒悲憂恐。故喜怒傷氣，寒暑傷形。暴怒傷陰，暴喜傷陽。厥氣上行，滿脈去形。喜怒不節，寒暑過度，生乃不固。故重陰必陽，重陽必陰。故曰：冬傷於寒，春必溫病；春傷於風，夏生飱泄；夏傷於暑，秋必痎瘧；秋傷於濕，徘生欬嗽。 The four seasons and the five phases follow the cycles of growth, maturity, and decline. The five organs transform the five types of energy to give rise to feelings of happiness, anger, sadness, and fear. Hence, extreme joy or anger can damage the yin or yang energy, while excessive stimulation of the lungs or liver can disrupt bodily functions. When the vital force ascends too high or when the pulse is disrupted, the body will not be able to heal itself. Therefore, it is essential to maintain balance between yin and yang. In winter, one must protect against cold; in spring, one must prevent heat illnesses; in summer, one must guard against sunstroke; and in autumn, one must avoid dampness to avoid colds and coughs.

7: 帝曰：余聞上古聖人，論理人形，列別藏府，端絡經脈，會通六合，各從其經，氣穴所發各有處名，谿谷屬骨皆有所起，分部逆從，各有條理，四時陰陽，盡有經紀，外內之應，皆有表裏，其信然乎。歧伯對曰：東方生風，風生木，木生酸，酸生肝，肝生筋，筋生心，肝主目。其在天為玄，在人為道，在地為化。化生五味，道生智，玄生神，神在天為風，在地為木，在體為筋，在藏為肝，在色為蒼，在音為角，在聲為呼，在變動為握，在竅為目，在味為酸，在志為怒。怒傷肝，悲勝怒；風傷筋，燥勝風；酸傷筋，辛勝酸。南方生熱，熱生火，火生苦，苦生心，心生血，血生脾，心主舌。其在天為熱，在地為火，在體為脈，在藏為心，在色為赤，在音為徵，在聲為笑，在變動為憂，在竅為舌，在味為苦，在志為喜。喜傷心，恐勝喜；熱傷氣，寒勝熱，苦傷氣，鹹勝苦。中央生濕，濕生土，土生甘，甘生脾，脾生肉，肉生肺，脾主口。其在天為濕，在地為土，在體為肉，在藏為脾，在色為黃，在音為宮，在聲為歌，在變動為噦，在竅為口，在味為甘，在志為思。思傷脾，怒勝思；濕傷肉，風勝濕；甘傷肉，酸勝甘。西方生燥，燥生金，金生辛，辛生肺，肺生皮毛，皮毛生腎，肺主鼻。其在天為燥，在地為金，在體為皮毛，在藏為肺，在色為白，在音為商，在聲為哭，在變動為欬，在竅為鼻，在味為辛，在志為憂。憂傷肺，喜勝憂；熱傷皮毛，寒勝熱；辛傷皮毛，苦勝辛。北方生寒，寒生水，水生鹹，鹹生腎，腎生骨髓，髓生肝，腎主耳。其在天為寒，在地為水，在體為骨，在藏為腎，在色為黑，在音為羽，在聲為呻，在變動為慄，在竅為耳，在味為鹹，在志為恐。恐傷腎，思勝恐；寒傷血，燥勝寒；鹹傷血，甘勝鹹。故曰：天地者，萬物之上下也；陰陽者，血氣之男女也；左右者，陰陽之道路也；水火者，陰陽之徵兆也；陰陽者，萬物之能始也。故曰：陰在內，陽之守也；陽在外；陰之使也。 The emperor asked, I have heard that in ancient times, wise sages discussed the shape of human beings, classified them, listed their different types, and named the places where the Qi channels were located. The relationships between the four seasons, yin and yang, and exterior and interior were all explained. Is this true?

Duke Ai replied, In the east, there is wind; wind generates wood; wood generates sourness; sourness generates the liver; the liver generates tendons; tendons generate the heart; the liver governs the eyes. The liver's celestial manifestation is the Xuan; its human manifestation is the Dao; its terrestrial manifestation is transformation; its residence is the liver; its color is blue; its sound is a horn; its emotional aspect is anger; its organ injured causes pain, and in this case, sorrow surpasses anger.

Wind-injured tendons are defeated by dryness; sour-injured tendons are defeated by bitter; bitter-injured hearts are defeated by salty.

In the south, there is heat; heat generates fire; fire generates bitterness; bitterness generates the heart; the heart generates blood; blood generates the spleen; the heart governs the tongue. Its celestial manifestation is fire; its terrestrial manifestation is earth; its residence is the vessels; its residence is the spleen; its color is red; its sound is a summons; its emotional aspect is laughter; its organ injured causes pain, and in this case, fear surpasses happiness; heat-injured Qi is defeated by cold; bitter-injured Qi is defeated by salty.

In the center, there is dampness; dampness generates soil; soil generates sweetness; sweetness generates the spleen; the spleen generates flesh; flesh generates the lungs; the spleen governs the mouth. Its celestial manifestation is dampness; its terrestrial manifestation is earth; its residence is the flesh; its residence is the spleen; its color is yellow; its sound is a palace; its emotional aspect is thought; its organ injured causes pain, and in this case, anger surpasses thought; damp-injured flesh is defeated by wind.

In the west, there is aridity; aridity generates metal; metal generates pungency; pungency generates the lungs; the lungs generate skin and hair; skin and hair generate the kidneys; the lungs govern the nose. Its celestial manifestation is aridity; its terrestrial manifestation is metal; its residence is the skin and hair; its residence is the kidneys; its color is white; its sound is a market; its emotional aspect is sorrow; its organ injured causes pain, and in this case, joy surpasses sorrow; heat-injured skin and hair are defeated by cold; pungency-injured skin and hair are defeated by bitter.

In the north, there is cold; cold generates water; water generates salty; salty generates the kidneys; the kidneys generate bone marrow; bone marrow generates the liver; the kidneys govern the ears. Its celestial manifestation is cold; its terrestrial manifestation is water; its residence is the bones; its residence is the kidneys; its color is black; its sound is a cry; its emotional aspect is fear; its organ injured causes pain, and in this case, thought surpasses fear; cold-injured blood is defeated by dryness; salty-injured blood is defeated by sweet.

Therefore, it is said that heaven and earth are the foundation of all things; yin and yang are the basis of blood and Qi; left and right are the path of yin and yang; water and fire are the signs of yin and yang; yin and yang are the source of all things. It is said that yin is inside, guarding the Yang; yang is outside, manifesting the function of yin.

8: 帝曰：法陰陽柰何。歧伯曰：陽勝則身熱，腠理閉，喘麤為之俛仰，汗不出而熱，齒乾以煩冤腹滿，死，能冬不能夏。陰勝則身寒汗出，身常清，數慄而寒，寒則厥，厥則腹滿，死，能夏不能冬。此陰陽更勝之變，病之形能也。 The Emperor asked, What is the difference between Yin and Yang? Duke Zhou replied, If Yang prevails, one will have a fever, the pulse will be tight, there will be shallow breathing and bending over, sweating without perspiration, teeth will be dry causing discomfort in the abdomen, and death. One is unable to withstand cold but can endure heat. If Yin prevails, one will have chills and sweating, the body will always feel cool, there will be frequent urination and feeling cold, leading to danger and fullness in the abdomen, resulting in death. One cannot withstand heat but can endure cold. This is the variation of the supremacy between Yin and Yang, and the form of disease.

9: 帝曰：調此二者，柰何。歧伯曰：能知七損八益，則二者可調，不知用此，則早衰之節也。年四十，而陰氣自半也，起居衰矣。年五十，體重，耳目不聰明矣。年六十，陰痿，氣大衰，九竅不利，下虛上實，涕泣俱出矣。故曰：知之則強，不知則老，故同出而名異耳。智者察同，愚者察異，愚者不足，智者有餘，有餘則耳目聰明，身體輕強，老者復壯，壯者益治。是以聖人為無為之事，樂恬憺之能，從欲快志於虛无之守，故壽命无窮，與天地終，此聖人之治身也。 The emperor asked: What about these two things, how are they? Duke Mu replied: If one can discern the seven gains and eight losses, then these two things can be managed; if one does not know how to use them, then it will be the time of decline. At forty years old, one's vital energy is already half, and one declines in both physical strength and appearance. At fifty years old, one's body becomes heavy, and hearing and sight are no longer clear. At sixty years old, one's genital fluid is exhausted, the lung qi is severely weakened, the nine orifices do not function properly, the lower part is empty while the upper part is full, causing tears to flow. Therefore it is said: knowing this brings strength, not knowing leads to aging. Thus, the wise person perceives the similarity, while the fool perceives the difference. The fool does not suffice, but the wise person has surplus; and with surplus, one's hearing and sight become clear, one's body becomes strong, and the old grow more robust, the robust more treatable. Therefore, a sage deals in what is without action and delights in the ability of tranquility, following desires and hastening to emptiness; thus life is endless, and matches with heaven and earth. This is how a sage treats the body.

10: 天不足西北，故西北方陰也，而人右耳目不如左明也。地不滿東南，故東南方陽也，而人左手足不如右強也。帝曰：何以然。歧伯曰：東方陽也，陽者其精并於上，并於上，則上明而下虛，故使耳目聰明，而手足不便也。西方陰也，陰者其精并於下，并於下，則下盛而上虛，故其耳目不聰明，而手足便也。故俱感於邪，其在上則右甚，在下則左甚，此天地陰陽所不能全也，故邪居之。故天有精，地有形，天有八紀，地有五里，故能為萬物之父母。清陽上天，濁陰歸地，是故天地之動靜，神明為之綱紀，故能以生長收藏，終而復始，惟賢人上配天以養頭，下象地以養足，中傍人事以養五藏。天氣通於肺，地氣通於嗌，風氣通於肝，雷氣通於心，谷氣通於脾，雨氣通於腎。六經為川，腸胃為海，九竅為水注之氣。以天地為之陰陽，陽之汗，以天地之雨名之；陽之氣，以天地之疾風名之。暴氣象雷，逆氣象陽。故治不法天之紀，不用地之理，則災害至矣。 The Heaven above is not fully to the West, hence the West region is shadowy. The Earth below is not fully to the South-East, hence the South-East region is bright. The Emperor asked, Why is this so? The Duke of Chou replied, The East is bright, and brightness concentrates on top; when brightness is above, it is clear while it is empty below, causing the eyes and ears to be keen and sharp but making hands and feet weak. The West is shadowy, and shadows concentrate at the bottom; when shadows are at the bottom, there is abundance downwards and emptiness upwards, causing the eyes and ears not to be keen and sharp but making hands and feet agile. Both of these cause confusion, with confusion residing above making the right pronounced and below making the left pronounced, manifesting the inability of Heaven and Earth. Hence, Heaven has essence and Earth has form, Heaven has eight seasons and Earth has five li, allowing them to be parents for all things. The clear Yang ascends to Heaven; the turbid Yin returns to Earth. Therefore, the movement and stillness of Heaven and Earth have the spirits and light as their standards, enabling generation, growth, storage, and renewal. Only sages regulate Heaven above to nourish their heads, control Earth below to nourish their feet, and manage people's affairs to nourish their five viscera. The lung meridian receives the Qi of Heaven and Earth; the mouth meridian receives the Qi of Heaven and Earth; the liver meridian receives the wind Qi; the heart meridian receives the thunder Qi; the spleen meridian receives the grain Qi; the kidney meridian receives the water Qi. The six channels are like rivers, the stomach and intestines are like seas, and the nine orifices are the points of registration for the Qi of water. By using Heaven and Earth as the basis of Yin and Yang, the Yang sweat is named by Heaven and Earth's rain; the Yang Qi is named by Heaven and Earth's brisk wind. The thunder manifests as Yang energy; the lightning manifests as Yin energy. Therefore, treating unlawfulness in Heaven's records will bring disasters upon us

11: 故邪風之至，疾如風雨，故善治者治皮毛，其次治肌膚，其次治筋脈，其次治六府，其次治五藏。治五藏者，半死半生也。故天之邪氣，感則害人五藏；水穀之寒熱，感則害於六府；地之濕氣，感則害皮肉筋脈。故善用鍼者，從陰引陽，從陽引陰，以右治左，以左治右，以我知彼，以表知裏，以觀過與不及之理，見微得過，用之不殆。善診者，察色按脈，先別陰陽；審清濁，而知部分；視喘息，聽音聲，而知所苦；觀權衡規矩，而知病所主。按尺寸，觀浮沈滑濇，而知病所生；以治無過，以診則不失矣。故曰：病之始起也，可刺而已；其盛，可待衰而已。故因其輕而揚之，因其重而減之，因其衰而彰之。形不足者，溫之以氣，精不足者，補之以味。其高者，因而越之；其下者，引而竭之；中滿者，寫之於內；其有邪者，漬形以為汗；其在皮者，汗而發之；其慓悍者，按而收之；其實者，散而寫之。審其陰陽，以別柔剛，陽病治陰，陰病治陽，定其血氣，各守其鄉，血實宜決之，氣虛宜𤙲引之。 When evil winds reach their peak, they move swiftly like wind and rain. Therefore, a good doctor treats the skin, then treats the muscles, then treats the channels, then treats the six palaces, then treats the five organs. Treating the five organs is as if one were halfway dead and halfway alive. Thus, heaven's evil qi affects people's five organs; earth's damp qi harms skin, flesh, tendons, and channels; cold and heat from grains affect six palaces. Therefore, skilled acupuncturists guide yin to treat yang and guide yang to treat yin, treating right with left and left with right, knowing the other through knowing oneself, understanding what is hidden by looking at what is apparent, and using what is slight without exhausting it. Skilled diagnosticians examine color and pulse, differentiate yin and yang first; discern clear and turbid, knowing the areas affected; observe wheezing and breathing, listen to sounds, knowing where the ailment lies. They note the balance of heaviness and lightness, know where the illness originates; they warm with qi when there is not enough form, supplement with flavor when there is not enough essence. For high ones, they guide upward; for low ones, they draw out; for those who are full, they disperse within; for those with evil, they sweat to release; for those in the skin, they sweat and expel; for those who are stubborn, they press and absorb; for those who have solidified, they scatter and disperse. Discern their yin and yang, differentiating softness and hardness; treat yang diseases with yin and treat yin diseases with yang, stabilize their blood and qi, each guarding its territory. Blood should be resolved when it is full, and qi should be guided when it is empty.

docs.title: 骨空論
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問曰：余聞風者百病之始也，以鍼治之，柰何。歧伯對曰：風從外入，令人振寒，汗出頭痛，身重惡寒，治在風府，調其陰陽，不足則補，有餘則寫。 Yellow Emperor asked: I have heard that wind is the beginning of a hundred diseases, and it is treated with acupuncture. What do you think? Huang Di replied: Wind enters from outside, causing people to shiver, sweating headache, feeling heavy and uncomfortable due to cold, treatment lies in the Wind Palace, regulating Yin and Yang, not enough then supplemented, and if there is excess then remove it.

2: 大風頸項痛，刺風府，風府在上椎。大風汗出，灸譩譆，譩譆在背下俠脊傍三寸所，厭之令病者呼譩譆，譩譆應手。從風憎風，刺眉頭。失枕在肩上棋骨閒，折使榆臂齊肘正，灸脊中。䏚絡季脇引少腹而痛脹，刺譩譆。腰痛不可以轉搖，急引陰鯤刺八髎與痛上，八髎在腰尻分閒。 Great Wind Neck Pain, Stab Wind Palace, Wind Palace is located in the Bladder Channel. Great Wind Sweat, Gua Sha the Shoulder Well, the Shoulder Well is three cun behind the shoulder blade on the back side of the scapula. Dislike Wind, needle between the eyebrows. Failing to find the pillow on the shoulder, move the arm to have the elbow straight and center at the wrist, Gua Sha the midline. The patient feels like a knot, twist the seasonal channels, pinch the small intestine channel, causing pain in the lower abdomen. Urgently needle the Uterus Channel and the 8 Gathering points where there is pain, the 8 Gathering points are located at the hip joints.

Translation: In case of severe wind-cold, needle the Wind Palace, which is located on the Bladder Meridian. When suffering from a great wind, needle between the eyebrows. If unable to find a pillow on the shoulder, move the arm so that the elbow is straight and the wrist is in line with the centerline of the back. Gua Sha the midline. In cases where the patient feels like there is a knot, twist the seasonal channels, pinch the small intestine channel, causing pain in the lower abdomen. In case of hip pain that cannot be rotated or swayed, urgently needle the Uterus Channel and the 8 Confluence points where there is pain, with the 8 Confluence points located at the hip joints.

3: 鼠瘻寒熱，還刺寒府，寒府在附膝外解營。取膝上外者使之拜，取足心者使之跪。任脈者，起於中極之下，以上毛際循腹裏上關元至咽喉，上頤循面入目。衝脈者，起於氣街，並少陰之經，俠齊上行，至胸中而散。任脈為病，男子內結七疝，女子帶下瘕聚。衝脈為病，逆氣裏急。督脈為病，脊強反折。督脈者，起於少腹以下骨中央，女子入繫廷孔，其孔，溺孔之端也，其絡循陰器合篡閒繞篡後，別繞臀至少陰，與巨陽中絡者合，少陰上股內後廉，貫脊屬腎，與太陽起於目內眥，上額交巔，上入絡腦，還出別下項循肩髆，內俠脊抵腰中入循膂絡腎。其男子循莖下至篡，與女子等。其少腹直上者貫齊中央，上貫心入喉，上頤環脣，上繫兩目之下中央，此生病從少腹上衝心，而痛不得前後，為衝疝，其女子不孕，癃痔遺溺嗌乾。督脈生病治督脈，治在骨上，甚者在齊下營，其上氣有音者，治其喉，中央在缺盆中者，其病上衝喉者治其漸，漸者上俠頤也。 The text describes various channels or meridians in the body, their locations and functions, as well as the symptoms associated with illnesses affecting them. Here is a rough translation:

  1. (Taiyin) Spleen and Lung Channel: The Spleen channel starts at the inner corner of the knee, ascends along the medial aspect of the leg, crosses the genitals and ascends the anterior abdominal wall to the umbilicus, where it connects with the Lung channel. It then courses up the lateral costal margin to enter the supraclavicular fossa, passes upward through the neck and terminates at the jaw angle.
  2. (Yangming) Large Intestine and Lung Channel: The Large Intestine channel originates at the outer corner of the elbow, ascends along the radial aspect of the forearm to the wrist, where it connects with the Lung channel, passes along the radial border of the hand to the finger tip. It then courses downward through the face and enters the nasal cavity via the nostril.
  3. (Yangwei) Stomach Channel: The Stomach channel starts at the medial aspect of the great toe, ascends the medial side of the leg to the genital area, where it connects with the Spleen and Large Intestine channels. It then courses upward along the anterior midline of the neck and enters the mouth cavity via the upper lip.
  4. (Yangyao) Small Intestine Channel: The Small Intestine channel originates at the outer corner of the eye, courses downward through the face to the shoulder, where it connects with the Stomach channel. It then descends along the lateral aspect of the body to the hip region and ascends the medial aspect of the leg to the medial malleolus, where it connects with the Bladder channel.
  5. (Yangming) Urinary Bladder Channel: The Bladder channel starts at the medial aspect of the medial malleolus, ascends the medial aspect of the leg and spine to the occuput, where it connects with the Small Intestine channel. It then courses downward through the face to the inner corner of the eye.
  6. (Yinwei) Kidney Channel: The Kidney channel starts at the inner aspect of the medial malleolus, ascends along the medial aspect of the leg to the genital area, where it connects with the Spleen and Large Intestine channels. It then courses upward along the anterior midline of the spine and terminates at the occuput.
  7. (Yinqiao) Gallbladder Channel: The Gallbladder channel originates at the outer aspect of the medial malleolus, ascends the lateral aspect of the leg to the hip region, where it connects with the Small Intestine channel. It then courses upward along the posterior midline of the body to the occuput, where it connects with the Liver and Governing Vessel channels.
  8. (Yinbai) Liver Channel: The Liver channel starts at the outer aspect of the great toe, ascends the lateral side of the leg to the hip region, where it connects with the Gallbladder channel. It then courses upward along the anterior midline of the body to the occuput, where it connects with the Governing Vessel and Gallbladder channels.
  9. (Shaoyang) Triple Burner Channel: The Triple Burner channel starts at the inner aspect of the elbow, ascends the medial side of the arm to the wrist, where it connects with the Small Intestine channel. It then courses downward through the face and neck to the axillary region, where it connects with the Gallbladder channel.
  10. (Taiyang) Governor Vessel: The Governing Vessel starts at the occuput, descends along the anterior midline of the body to the perineum, then loops upward through the genitals and ascends the medial aspect of the leg to the medial malleolus, where it connects with the Liver and Gallbladder channels.

The text also describes various symptoms associated with illnesses affecting these meridians. For example, if the Taiyin (Spleen and Lung) channel is affected, there may be pain in the lower abdomen, shortness of breath, cough, and a sore throat. If the Yangming (Large Intestine and Lung) channel is affected, there may be symptoms such as a runny nose, sneezing, fever, and sore throat.

4: 蹇膝伸不屈治其楗，坐而膝痛治其機。立而暑解，治其骸關。膝痛，痛及拇指治其膕。坐而膝痛如物隱者治其關。膝痛不可屈伸，治其背內。連䯒若折，治陽明中俞髎。若別治巨陽少陰滎。淫濼脛痠，不能久立，治少陽之維，在外上五寸。輔骨上橫骨下為楗，俠髖為機，膝解為骸關，俠膝之骨為連骸，骸下為輔，輔上為膕，膕上為關，頭橫骨為枕。 Knee pain, bent and cannot straighten; treat the knee. Sitting with knee pain, treating the mechanism. Standing and sweating treated the tendon passage. Knee pain, painful and sore like the little finger, treat the joint. Sitting with knee pain as if hidden by an object, treat the tendon. Knee pain unable to bend or stretch, treat the internal back. Toxic dampness in the kidney channel, as if broken, treat the Yang Ming middle Jiao. If separate, treat the Jue Yin luo. Licentious vaginal discharge, unable to stand for long, treat the Shao Yang source vessel, located outside five cun up. Assistant bone is horizontal above and below the crossbones, Luo connects as the mechanism, knee pain treated as hui guan, the connective bone as connect hui, hui down as wei, wei up as yao, yao up as guan, guan as ting.

5: 水俞五十七穴者，尻上五行，行五，伏菟上兩行，行五，左右各一行，行五，踝上各一行，行六穴。 The fifty-seven water channels are located: five on the top of the vertebrae, five in each row of the small intestine (which runs above the vertebrae), one line each on the left and right sides (of the body), one line each at the heels, six channels at the ankles.

6: 髓空在腦後三分，在顱際銳骨之下，一在齗基下，一在項後中復骨下，一在脊骨上空在風府上。脊骨下空在尻骨下空。數髓空在面俠鼻，或骨空在口下當兩肩。兩髆骨空在髆中之陽。臂骨空在臂陽，去踝四寸兩骨空之間。股骨上空在股陽出上膝四寸。䯒骨空在輔骨之上端。股際骨空在毛中動下。尻骨空在髀骨之後相去四寸。肩骨有滲理湊，無髓孔，易髓無空。 The marrow is three cun behind the brain, at the sharp end of the nose and in the hollow beneath the upper teeth, at the back of the collarbone, and on the top of the windpipe. Below the spine is empty space at the level of the sacrum. There are empty spaces in the cheekbones and sometimes in the bones below the lip, near the shoulders. The two pelvic bones have empty spaces at their ends. The bones above the tendons at the crest of the hip joints have empty spaces four cun above the hip joints. Above the sacrum is an empty space in the sacral crest and a space behind the ilium. In the hollow of the ischium, there is an empty space. There is no marrow at the ends of the clavicle, and the bones of the shoulder have no holes for the marrow to be present.

7: 灸寒熱之法，先灸項大椎，以年為壯數，次灸橛骨，以年為壯數，視背俞陷者灸之，舉臂肩上陷者灸之，兩季脇之間灸之，外踝上絕骨之端灸之，足小指次指間灸之，腨下陷脈灸之，外踝後灸之，缺盆骨上切之堅痛如筋者灸之，膺中陷骨間灸之，掌束骨下灸之，齊下關元三寸灸之，毛際動脈灸之，膝下三寸分閒灸之，足陽明跗上動脈灸之，巔上一灸之，犬所囓之處灸之三壯，即以犬傷病法灸之，凡當灸二十九處。傷食灸之，不已者，必視其經之過於陽者，數刺其俞而藥之。 Acupuncture and Cold-Heat Treatment:

First, treat according to the nature of the disease (cold or heat), and then proceed as follows: 1. Begin by needling the front junction and great shu points, using age as a criterion for determining the number of needles. 2. Next, needle the yang jing points, again using age as a guide. 3. Needle where the shen renders the back depressed, where the arms are lifted and the shoulders depressed, between the two shu, on the outer ankle where the limbs meet the bone ends, between the first and second toes, at the lower part of the guan where there is a weak pulse, at the outer ankle where there is pain, on the missing pubic bone, at the place where the jin is stiff and painful like muscle, in the depressions of the jing and shu points of the breastbone, at the lower part of the tendon, between the guan and the lower part of the conception vessel three cun, at the hairy margins and on the large blood vessels, at the hollows of the knee three cun apart, on the foot jue where there is a moving blood vessel, on the top one, at the place bitten by dogs, for a total of 29 needling points. 4. For cases of injury to food, continue needling without ceasing, and if necessary, view the channel's tendency to be excessively Yang, and puncture the jing several times and administer medicine

docs.title: 水熱穴論
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問曰：少陰何以主腎，腎何以主水。歧伯對曰：腎者，至陰也，至陰者，盛水也。肺者，太陰也，少陰者，冬脈也，故其本在腎，其末在肺，皆積水也。帝曰：腎何以能聚水而生病。歧伯曰：腎者，胃之關也，關門不利，故聚水而從其類也，上下溢於皮膚，故為胕腫，胕腫者，聚水而生病也。 Emperor asked: How does the Shao Yin govern the kidney, and how does the kidney govern water? Huang Di answered: The kidney is the root of the Yin, and the Yin is responsible for storing water. The lung is the Ta Yin, Shao Yin is the small intestine channel, so its source is in the kidney and its end is in the lung, all of which are involved in storing water. Emperor asked: How can the kidney be able to gather water and cause disease? Huang Di answered: The kidney is the gateway of the stomach, and if the gateway is not functioning properly, it will gather water according to its kind, and the accumulation will overflow upwards and downwards, causing the skin to swell, and swelling is a disease caused by gathering water.

2: 帝曰：諸水皆生於腎乎。歧伯曰：腎者，牝藏也，地氣上者屬於腎，而生水液也，故曰至陰。勇而勞甚則腎汗出，腎汗出逢於風，內不得入於藏府，外不得越於皮膚，客於玄府，行於皮裏，傳為胕腫，本之於腎，名曰風水。所謂玄府者，汗空也。 Emperor said: All waters are born from the kidneys. Hui Bao said: The kidneys are the place of yin, anything that is on the surface of the earth belongs to the kidneys and produces water fluid, thus it is called the source of yin. When one is courageous and works hard, the kidney sweats come out, when the kidney sweat encounters wind, it cannot enter the interior of the kidney nor go beyond the skin, it resides in the mysterious palace, moves within the skin, and transfers to the swelling, its origin is from the kidneys, and it is called wind water. As for the mysterious palace, it is the space for sweat.

3: 帝曰：水俞五十七處者，是何主也。歧伯曰：腎俞五十七穴，積陰之所聚也，水所從出入也。尻上五行行五者，此腎俞。故水病，下為胕腫大腹，上為喘呼，不得臥者，標本俱病，故肺為喘呼，腎為水腫，肺為逆不得臥，分為相輸俱受者，水氣之所留也。伏菟上各二行行五者，此腎之街也。三陰之所交結於腳也。踝上各一行行六者，此腎脈之下行也，名曰太衝。凡五十七穴者，皆藏之陰絡，水之所客也。 The emperor asked: Which ruler governs the fifty-seven points of water? Master Jī said: The renal points number fifty-seven orifices, where energy is stored and from which water enters and exits. When the water channel is diseased, below it there is distention and fullness in the abdomen, above it there is wheezing and panting, and one cannot lie down; this is a classic case of the renal points. Consequently, water pathology results in the lungs causing wheezing and panting, and the kidneys causing water retention. The lungs are unable to rest, with symptoms spreading to other channels as well. This is where water energy gathers. Six meridian points lie above the lower abdomen, which are the renal channel street. The three Yin intersect at the feet. At the ankle, there is one meridian point with six lines, which is the lower pathway of the kidney's meridian, known as Taiyi. All fifty-seven points are associated with hidden yin channels and serve as storage for water energy.

4: 帝曰：春取絡脈分肉，何也。歧伯曰：春者，木始治，肝氣始生，肝氣急，其風疾，經脈常深，其氣少，不能深入，故取絡脈分肉間。帝曰：夏取盛經分腠，何也。歧伯曰：夏者，火始治，心氣始長，脈瘦氣弱，陽氣留溢，熱熏分腠，內至於經，故取盛經分腠絕膚而病去者，邪居淺也，所謂盛經者，陽脈也。帝曰：秋取經俞，何也。歧伯曰：秋者，金始治，肺將收殺，金將勝火，陽氣在合，陰氣初勝，濕氣及體，陰氣未盛，未能深入，故取俞以寫陰邪，取合以虛陽邪，陽氣始衰，故取於合。帝曰：冬取井榮，何也。歧伯曰：冬者，水始治，腎方閉，陽氣衰少，陰氣堅盛，巨陽伏沈，陽脈乃去，故取井以下陰逆，取榮以實陽氣。故曰：冬取井榮，春不鼽衄，此之謂也。 The Emperor asked: Why do you take the Chong channel in spring? [Response] The Duke said: In spring, wood is beginning to be treated, the liver's Qi is starting to emerge, the liver's Qi is urgent, its wind and rapidity, the channels are always deep, its Qi is insufficient, it cannot penetrate deeply, so you take the Chong channel and divide the flesh. The Emperor asked: Why do you take the abundant channel in summer? [Response] The Duke said: In summer, fire is beginning to be treated, the heart's Qi is starting to grow larger, the pulse becomes thin and the Qi is weak, the Yang Qi accumulates and overflows, the heat scatters in the channels, it is located within the meridians, so you take the abundant channel and divide the tendons while the disease disappears, this evil resides shallowly, what is called an abundant channel is the Yang meridian. The Emperor asked: Why do you take the lung channel in autumn? [Response] The Duke said: In autumn, metal is beginning to be treated, the lungs are about to withdraw and suppress, gold is about to prevail over fire, Yang Qi is present, Yin Qi is starting to win, dampness Qi also enters the body, Yin Qi is not yet full, it cannot penetrate deeply, so you take the Gu for expelling Yin evil, and take the merger for emptying Yang evil, as Yang Qi begins to decline. The Emperor asked: Why do you take the well and brilliance in winter? [Response] The Duke said: In winter, water is beginning to be treated, the kidneys are about to close, Yang Qi declines and is insufficient, Yin Qi is firm and full, grand Yang conceals itself, the Yang meridian has gone, so you take the well for expelling lower Yin reversal, and take brilliance for nourishing Yang Qi. Therefore, it is said: In winter, take the well and brilliance; in spring, there is no harm, this is what is meant.

5: 帝曰：夫子言治熱病五十九俞，余論其意，未能領別其處，願聞其處，因聞其意。歧伯曰：頭上五行行五者，以越諸陽之熱逆也。大杼膺俞缺盆背俞此八者，以寫胸中之熱也。氣街三里巨虛上下廉此八者，以寫胃中之熱也。雲門髃骨委中髓空此八者，以寫四支之熱也。五藏俞傍五此十者，以寫五藏之熱也。凡此五十九穴者，皆熱之左右也。帝曰：人傷於寒而傳為熱，何也。歧伯曰：夫寒盛，則生熱也。 The Emperor said: Master Zhang asks about the treatment of fever, and I have discussed the meaning of his words, but I am unable to distinguish their significance. I would like to hear more so that I can understand their meaning. Qi Bo replied: There are five lines on the head, representing the reversal of Yang's heat. Eight points involving the chest, shoulder, and back correspond to heat in the chest. Three lines at Gas Street, on a giant vacuity, correspond to heat in the stomach. The eight points at Yunmen's hair, bones, marrow, and hollow represent heat in the arms. Ten points around the five viscera correspond to heat within the viscera. In total, there are fifty-nine points. All of these points are associated with left and right heat. The Emperor asked: If a person is injured by cold, how can it lead to fever? Qi Bo replied: When cold is excessive, it generates heat.

docs.title: 調經論
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問曰：余聞刺法言，有餘寫之，不足補之，何謂有餘，何謂不足。歧伯對曰：有餘有五，不足亦有五，帝欲何問。帝曰；願盡聞之。歧伯曰：神有餘有不足，氣有餘有不足，血有餘有不足，形有餘有不足，志有餘有不足，凡此十者，其氣不等也。帝曰：人有精氣津液，四支九竅，五藏十六部，三百六十五節，乃生百病，百病之生，皆有虛實，今夫子乃言有餘有五，不足亦有五，何以生之乎。歧伯曰：皆生於五藏也。夫心藏神，肺藏氣，肝藏血，脾藏肉，腎藏志，而此成形，志意通內連骨髓，而成身形五藏，五藏之道，皆出於經隧以行血氣，血氣不和，百病乃變化而生，是故守經隧焉。 Yellow Emperor asked, saying: I have heard that acupuncture discusses more than enough and insufficient, but there are no specific descriptions of either. What does more than enough mean, and what does insufficient mean? Huan Di replied: More than enough has five aspects, and insufficient also has five aspects; what do you want to ask, Emperor? The Emperor said: I wish to hear fully about them. Huan Di said: There is more than enough and insufficient in spirit, qi, blood, form, and willpower. In total, these ten aspects have unbalanced qi. People have vital energy and body fluids, four limbs and nine orifices, five organs and sixteen departments, three hundred sixty-five joints, which give rise to one hundred diseases, and the generation of these hundred diseases is a mixture of reality and emptiness. Now, Master, you say there are more than enough and insufficient aspects; how do they generate them? Huan Di replied: They all arise from the five organs. The heart houses spirit, the lungs house qi, the liver houses blood, the spleen houses flesh, the kidneys house willpower, and this forms the body. Will and intention connect to the bone marrow within, forming the body's shape through the five organs. The way of the five organs is all derived from the meridians and vessels, and regulating blood and qi leads to the transformation and generation of one hundred diseases; therefore, protect the meridians and vessels.
