The way of the sage is the regulation of heaven and earth's transformations, the rituals of governance, the principles of yin and yang, heat and cold, which even the greatest master cannot fully understand; I beg to preserve it in the Spiritual Hall and call it the Six Regularities. No one dares to reveal this. Be cautious in transmitting it.

docs.title: 刺法論
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問曰：升降不前，氣交有變，即成暴鬱，余已知之。如何預救生靈，可得卻乎？歧伯稽首再拜對曰：昭乎哉問！臣聞夫子言，既明天元，須窮法刺，可以折鬱扶運，補弱全真，盛蠲餘，令除斯苦。帝曰：願卒聞之。歧伯曰：升之不前，即有甚凶也。木欲升而天柱窒抑之，木欲發鬱亦須待時，當刺足厥陰之井。火欲升而天蓬窒抑之，火欲發鬱亦須待時，君火相火同刺包絡之滎。土欲升而天衝窒抑之，土欲發鬱亦須待時，當刺足太陰之俞。金欲升而天英窒抑之，金欲發鬱亦須時，當刺手太陰之經。水欲升而天內窒抑之，水欲發鬱亦須待時，當刺足少陰之合。 Yellow Emperor asked: When there is no rise or fall, the circulation of Qi has changed and becomes wild chaos. I already know this. How can one prevent and treat life spirit? What can be obtained from it? Duke of Zhou knelt down and offered worship again, answering, Excellent question! I have heard that Master said, when Heaven's vitality is clear, one must exhaustively explore the needles, able to break through chaos, support yang qi, strengthen the gate, and eliminate the remainder, eliminating this suffering. The Emperor said: Please quickly explain it to me. Duke of Zhou answered: When there is no rise, it is indeed ominous. Wood intends to rise but heavenly pillar suppresses it; wood also intending to release chaos needs time, at the jinmen intersection. Fire intends to rise but heavenly net suppresses it; fire also intending to release chaos needs time, strike fire and fire same strike bag of skin. Earth intends to rise but heavenly rampart suppresses it; earth also intending to release chaos needs time, at the jinmen intersection. Gold intends to rise but heavenly emblem suppresses it; gold also intending to release chaos needs time, strike hand jinmen intersection. Water intends to rise but heavenly interior suppresses it; water also intending to release chaos needs time, at the jinmen intersection.

2: 帝曰：升之不前，可以預備，願聞其降，可以先防。歧伯曰：既明其升，必達其降也。升降之道，皆可先治也。木欲降而地皛窒抑之，降而不入，抑之鬱發，散而可得位，降而鬱發，暴如天閒之待時也，降而不下，鬱可速矣，降可折其所勝也，當刺手太陰之所出，刺手陽明之所入。火欲降而地玄窒抑之，降而不入，抑之鬱發，散而可矣，當折其所勝，可散其鬱，當刺足少陰之所出，刺足太陽之所入。土欲降而地蒼窒抑之，降而不下，抑之鬱發，散而可入，當折其勝，可散其鬱，當刺足厥陰之所出，刺足少陽之所入。金欲降而地彤窒抑之，降而不下，散抑之鬱發，散而可入，當折其勝，可散其鬱，當刺心包胳所出，刺手少陽所入也。水欲降而地阜窒抑之，降而不下，抑之鬱發，散而可入，當折其土，可散其鬱，當刺足太陰之所出，刺足陽明之所入。 Emperor: If the rising does not come forward, it can be prepared for; I wish to hear of its descent, so that there can be early defense. Obstinate says: Once the ascending is made clear, it must reach the descending. The method of ascending and descending can be regulated beforehand. Wood wishes to descend but the earth tightly binds and restrains it; when it descends without entering, it binds and releases it, scatters it so that it may obtain a position, when it descends and binds and releases it, it is as if waiting for its time; when it descends but does not enter, it can be quickly done. It can defeat what it has overcome, and should pierce the hand at where Yang Ming enters, and at where Taiyin issues forth. Fire wishes to descend but the earth tightly binds and restrains it; when it descends without entering, it binds and releases it, and it can scatter when it is scattered, it should defeat what it has overcome, and it can disperse its binding, piercing at where Shao Yin issues forth and where Taiyang enters. Earth wishes to descend but the earth tightly binds and restrains it; when it descends without entering, it binds and releases it, and scatters when it can enter, it should defeat its victory, and it can disperse its binding, piercing at where Shao Yang issues forth and where Taiyang enters. Gold wishes to descend but the earth tightly binds and restrains it; when it descends without entering, it scatters its binding and releases it, and when it is scattered, it can enter, it should defeat what it has overcome, and it can disperse its binding, piercing at where the Heart Protector and Biceps issue forth and at where Shao Yang enters. Water wishes to descend but the earth tightly binds and restrains it; when it descends without entering, it binds and releases it, and scatters when it can enter, it should defeat its soil, and it can disperse its binding, piercing at where Taiyin issues forth and where Yang Ming enters.

3: 帝曰：五運之至，有前後與升降往來，有所承抑之，可得聞乎？刺法歧伯曰：當取其化源也。是故太過取之，不及資之。太過取之，次抑其鬱，取其運之化源，令折鬱氣。不及扶資，以扶運氣，以避虛邪也。資取之法令出《密語》。 The Emperor asked: When the Five Phases are at their peak, there is a movement of ascending and descending, front and back, and there is something that restrains them. Can you hear about it? The Master of Needle and Thread replied: You must take hold of its source. Thus, if you overdo it, you do not benefit the resource. Overdoing it, you suppress the yin, taking hold of the phase's source, and cause the yin qi to contract. Not benefiting the support of resources, you use this to support the phase qi and ward off empty evil. The methods for taking hold of resources are found in the Secret Speech.

4: 黃帝問曰：升降之刺，以知要，願聞司天未得遷正，使司化之失其常政，即萬化之或其皆妄。然與民為病，可得先除，欲濟群生，願聞其說。歧伯稽首再拜曰：悉乎哉問！言其至理，聖念慈憫，欲濟群生，臣乃盡陳斯道，可申洞微。太陽復布，即厥陰不遷正，不遷正氣塞於上，當寫足厥陰之所流。厥陰復布，少陰不遷正，不遷正即氣塞於上，當刺心包胳脈之所流。少陰復布，太陰不遷正，不遷正即氣留於上，當刺足太陰之所流。太陰復布，少陽不遷正，不遷正則氣塞未通，當刺手少陽之所流。少陽復布，則陽明不遷正，不遷正則氣未通上，當刺手太陰之所流。陽明復布，太陽不遷正，不遷正則復塞其氣，當刺足少陰之所流。 Yellow Emperor asked, The needling of the ascending and descending vessels can discern the location of the disease. I wish to hear from the Grand Master Shu: what is the method for correcting the anomalies in the Celestial Office and guiding the transformations? It appears that if one mistakenly treats the multitude as patients, then the illness can be easily removed. Desiring to aid all living beings, I wish to hear your explanation. Grand Master Shu bowed and paid his respects again and said, I understand your question very well. Your words are most profound, demonstrating the sagely compassion and benevolence you have for all living beings. I can only humbly explain this method, which may apply to subtle points.

When the Yang energy is ascending and the Yin energy is not descending properly, the Qi will accumulate in the upper part of the body, causing difficulties with the foot-Yin channels where the Qi flows.

When the Yin energy is ascending and the Yang energy is not descending properly, the Qi will accumulate in the heart, lung, and arm-Yang channels where the Qi flows.

When the Yin energy is ascending and the Yang energy is not descending properly, the Qi will accumulate in the kidneys and cause problems with the foot-Yang channels where the Qi flows.

When the Yang energy is ascending and the Yin energy is not descending properly, the Qi will accumulate in the hands and arm-Yang channels where the Qi flows.

When the Yin energy is ascending and the Yang energy is not descending properly, the Qi will accumulate in the heart, lung, and hand-Yang channels where the Qi flows.

When the Yang energy is ascending and the Yin energy is not descending properly, the Qi will accumulate in the foot-Yang channels where the Qi flows.

5: 帝曰：遷正不前，以通其要，願聞不退，欲折其餘，無令過失，可得明乎？歧伯曰：氣過有餘，復作布正，是名不過位也。使地氣不得後化，新司天未可遷正，故復布化令如故也。巳亥之歲天數有餘，故厥陰不退位也，風行於上，木化布天，當刺足厥陰之所入。子午之歲，天數有餘，故少陰不退位也，熱行於上，火餘化布天，當刺手厥陰之所入。丑未之歲，天數有餘，故太陰不退位也，溼行於上，雨化布天，當刺足太陰之所入。寅申之歲，天數有餘，故少陽不退位也，熱行於上，火化布天，當刺手少陽之所入。卯酉之歲，天數有餘，故陽明不退位也，金行於上，燥化布天，當刺手太陰之所入。辰戌之歲，天數有餘，故太陽不退位也，寒行於上凜水化布天，當刺足少陰之所入。故天地氣逆，化成民病，以法刺之，預可平痾。 The Emperor said: Retreating and not returning, I want to understand its essence. Please don't retreat, I want to conquer the rest, without causing any mistakes, is it clear? Duke Bö said: When Qi exceeds, it will rebalance, which is called not overstepping boundaries. Make sure that the earthly energy does not degenerate, and the new appointment of the sky cannot be rebalanced, so I will restore the regulation as before. In a year with excess days of the Xuанzi, the Yin retreats position because it is damp above, water changes into wood, and it should be needled at the foot of the Yin's entrance. In a year with excess days of the Renzhi, the Yangui retreats position because it is hot above, fire consumes wood, and it should be needled at the hand of the Yangui's entrance. In a year with excess days of the Jiazi, the Taiyin retreats position because it is damp above, rain changes into metal, and it should be needled at the foot of the Taiyin's entrance. In a year with excess days of the Gengxi, the Shaoyang retreats position because it is hot above, fire consumes wood, and it should be needled at the hand of the Shaoyang's entrance. In a year with excess days of the Jichou, the Taiyang does not retreat position because it is cold above, ice changes into water, and it should be needled at the foot of the Shao yin's entrance. Therefore, when heavenly energy is reversed and turns into human disease, using law to needle will prevent the onset of diseases.

6: 黃帝問曰：剛柔二干，失守其位，使天運之氣皆虛乎？與民為病，可得平乎？歧伯曰：深乎哉問！明其奧旨，天地迭移，三年化疫，是謂根之可見，必有逃門。 Yellow Emperor asked: The hard and the soft, if they lose their positions, will all become empty in terms of celestial influences. Can one govern the people with illness? Gongsun Long said: This is a profound question! Understanding its subtle intention, heaven and earth undergo changes every three years, causing epidemics; this can be seen as the roots, but there must be an escape route.

7: 假令甲子，剛柔失守，剛未正，柔孤而有虧，時序不令，即音律非從，如此三年，變大疫也。詳其微甚，察其淺深，欲至而可刺，刺之，當先補腎俞，次三日，可刺足太陰之所注。又有下位己卯不至，而甲子孤立者，次三年作土癘，其法補瀉，一如甲子同法也。其刺以畢，又不須夜行及遠行，令七日潔，清淨齋戒。所有自來腎有久病者，可以寅時面向南，淨神不亂，思閉氣不息七徧，以引頸嚥氣順之，如嚥氣甚硬物，如此七徧後，餌舌下津令無數。 Assuming Jiazi, hard and soft lose balance, hard is not yet complete, while the soft is alone with deficiency, time sequence is not in order, and sound and rhythm are not according to tradition. If this lasts for three years, it will result in a great plague. Analyzing its subtlety and depth, it can be acupunctured at the point that can be pierced; then it should first supplement Qi Gong. After three days, it can acupuncture at the foot-Taiyin where it is located. There are also those who, in a submissive position of Jupiter in Mao, do not reach Jiazi alone, and in the next three years they will have a disease of the soil; its treatment is to supplement Guan. Its acupuncture is completed, and there is no need for night travel or distant travel. On the seventh day, it should be purified, clean and pure abstinence. All those who have come with old disease in their lower Qi can be treated by facing south at the time of Chongwu, cleaning their spirits to avoid chaos, holding their breath for seven breaths, guiding their necks to swallow Qi naturally, as if swallowing hard objects; after seven breaths, the saliva will make the water below abundant.

8: 假令丙寅，剛柔失守，上剛干失守，下柔不可獨主之，中水運非太過，不可執法而定之，布天有餘，而失守上正，天地不合，即律呂音異，如此即天運失序，後三年變疫。詳其微甚，差有大小，徐至即後三年，至甚即首三年，當先補心俞，次五日，可刺腎之所入。又有下位地甲子，辛巳柔不附剛，亦名失守，即地運皆虛，後三年變水癘，即刺法皆如此矣。其刺如畢，慎其大喜欲情於中，如不忌，即其氣復散也，令靜七日，心欲實，令少思。 Assuming it is Bingchen, hard and soft fail to maintain, above hard dry fails to maintain, below soft cannot be independent, middle water does not exceed, cannot execute law and define it, there are extras in the sky, but fail to maintain the correct above, heaven and earth not matching, then the laws Luo sound is different, if so, then the celestial circulation fails order, later three years changed disease. It details very slight, difference has big and small, step by step arrive at later three years, become very then first three years, should first supplement heart Gui, next five days, can stab pancreas in the entrance. Again there is below position Jiazi, Renxu hard does not combine with soft, also named fail to maintain, then land circulation is all empty, later three years change water bubble, then stab method are all like this. Its stab like finish, beware of its great joy desire in the middle, if not avoid, its qi will scatter again, make quiet seven days, heart want real, let little think.

9: 假令庚辰，剛柔失守，上位失守，下位無合，乙庚金運，故非相招，布天未退，中運勝來，上下相錯，謂之失守，姑洗林鍾，商音不應也，如此則天運化易，三年變大疫。詳其天數，差有微甚，微即微，三年至，甚即甚，三年至，當先肝俞，次三日，可刺肺之所行。刺畢，可靜神七日，慎勿大怒，怒必真氣卻散之。又或在下地甲子乙未失守者，即乙柔干，即上庚獨治之，亦名失守者，即□□孤主之，三年變癘，名曰金癘，其至待時也，詳其地數之等差，亦推其微甚，可知遲速爾。諸位乙庚失守，刺法同，肝欲平，即勿怒。 Assuming it's Geng-Chen, the yin and yang are out of balance. The superior position is out of balance, and the inferior position has no harmony. The interaction between Jia and Geng brings good fortune in gold, but since this is not mutual attraction, the heavenly cycle cannot be completed. The superior and inferior positions are out of sync, and thus can be called out of balance. A woman named Lin Zhong from Guan and a merchant from Shang have no harmony in their voices either. Then, the heavenly fortune will transform and change into a great epidemic in three years' time. In terms of the numbers involved, there is a slight discrepancy, both small and large, by the third year, and at this point, it is said that the liver will be afflicted first. After three days have passed, one can perform an acupuncture treatment on the lung meridian. When the needles are removed, one should rest and refrain from anger; being angry will cause the true qi to disperse. Alternatively, in the case of those born during the period of Bing-Shen and Ding-Wu, or when a woman named Lin Zhong is present, it can be treated by needling the yin and yang meridians using Jia's yang and Geng's yin, which are also considered out of balance. This condition is known as golden weakness, and its onset should be expected after a certain period of time. By examining the differences between the numbers involved, one can determine whether it will come quickly or slowly. In the case of those born during Jia's yin and Geng's yang phases, the advice is the same: do not get angry.

10: 假令壬午，剛柔失守，上壬未遷正，下丁獨然，即雖陽年，虧及不同，上下失守，相招其有期，差之微甚，各有其數也，律呂二角，失而不和，同音有日，微甚如見，三年大疫，當刺脾之俞，次三日，可刺肝之所出也。刺畢，靜神七日，勿大醉歌樂，其氣復散，又勿飽食，勿食生物，欲令脾實，氣無滯飽，無久坐，食無太酸，無食一切生物，宜甘宜淡。又或地下甲子，丁酉失守其位，未得中司，即氣不當位，下不與壬奉合者，亦名失守，非名合德，故柔不附剛，即地運不合，三年變癘，其刺法一如木疫之法。 Assuming it is Ren Wuyin, the following literary Chinese text can be translated to English: If during the Yin Period of Ren, the balance between firmness and flexibility is lost, in the Xin year, this is particularly unfortunate. Above (the body) is governed by the metal element (of the Jupiter day master), below by fire (Earth day master). The loss of harmony leads to different periods where firmness and flexibility are out of balance. The principles can be likened to the concept of lu lu er jiao, whereby in order to restore balance, there must be a day of rest and one of activity, each with its own significance. Two years later (from the beginning of imbalance), the Bladder and Gallbladder meridians should be treated, followed by seven days of calm, avoiding excesses such as alcohol and rich food to allow the energy to return to normal. Foods should also be avoided that are too sour, sweet or overly stimulating.

Another scenario is if the Wood element (Jupiter day master) is out of balance in the year of the Rooster. If the Wood element is unable to combine with other elements due to imbalance, this is also known as being out of balance. In this situation, flexibility does not attach itself to firmness and energy will not flow properly. The body can experience discomfort for three years and the treatment should be similar to that used in treating mu (wood) disease.

11: 假令戊申，剛柔失守，戊癸雖火運，陽年不太過也，上失其剛，柔地獨主，其氣不正，故有邪干，迭移其位，差有淡深，欲至將合，音律先同，如此天運失時，三年之中，火疫至矣，當刺肺之俞。刺畢，靜神七日，勿大悲傷也，悲傷即肺動，而真氣復散也，人欲實肺者，要在息氣也。又或地下甲子，癸亥失守者，即柔失守位也，即上失其剛也，即亦名戊癸不相合德者也，即運與地虛，後三年變癘，即名火癘。 Suppose it is a Wuxu year, with Yin and Yang losing balance, although the Fire element runs through the Wu and Gui years, Yang's influence is not too strong. The firm aspect fails above, while the soft aspect stands alone, its energy is not correct, hence there are misfortune and disasters, changing positions and varying in depth, almost coming together, music and rhythm coincide, so when heavenly luck fails, within three years, fire will come upon us. During this time, one must pierce the lungs at the junction of the lung meridian. Afterward, remain quiet for seven days, do not be excessively sad, for sorrow disturbs the lungs and scatters true energy, those who wish to truly heal their lungs must focus on regulating breath. Alternatively, if one loses the Gui earth element in Jiazi or Gengchen years, they have lost both balance and firmness, and share the unsuitability of Wuxu years. In the following three years, there will be a dryness ailment, known as fire dryness.

12: 是故立地五年，以明失守，以溼法刺，於是疫之與癘，即是上下剛柔之名也，窮歸一體也，即刺疫法，只有五法，即總其諸位失守，故只歸五行而統之也。 Therefore, establishing the land for five years, it became clear that strategy was lost through openness and tactics were pierced through moisture. Thus, disease and pestilence emerged together, signifying the names of hardness and softness, ultimately unifying into one body, thus the art of disease and pestilence lies in five methods, encompassing all the failures of strategies, which is why they are classified into the Five Phases (elements).

13: 黃帝曰：余聞五疫之至，皆相染易，無問大小，病狀相似，不施救療，如何可得不相移易者？歧伯曰：不相染者，正氣存內，邪不可干，避其毒氣，天牝從來，復得其往，氣出於腦，即不邪干。氣出於腦，即室先想心如日。欲將入於疫室，先想青氣自肝而出，左行於東，化作林木。次想白氣自肺而出，右行於西，化作戈甲。次想赤氣自心而出，南行於上，化作燄明。次想黑氣自腎而出，北行於下，化作水。次想黃氣自脾而出，存於中央，化作土。五氣護身之畢，以想頭上如北斗之煌煌，然後可入於疫室。 Emperor Yellow said: I have heard that in the case of the five epidemics, when they are at their height, people easily catch and transmit them without regard for age or status. The symptoms are similar, and without proper treatment, how can one avoid transmission? Duke of Bizarre replied: Those who do not contract it have pure Qi inside, while evil cannot affect them. They avoid its toxic Qi. The Yin has been following this practice from ancient times and still continues to be followed today. When the Qi comes out of the brain, it is not evil. The Qi coming out of the brain corresponds to the mind like the sun. To enter the epidemic room, first imagine the green Qi coming out from the liver on the left and moving eastward, transforming into trees and plants. Then imagine the white Qi coming out from the lungs on the right and moving westward, transforming into armor and weapons. Then imagine the red Qi coming out of the heart and moving northwards, transforming into light. Then imagine the black Qi coming out from the kidneys and moving southwards, transforming into water. Finally, imagine the yellow Qi coming out from the spleen and staying in the center, transforming into earth. When the five Qis have protected the body, one should visualize a shining image of the North Pole on top of their head before entering the epidemic room.

14: 又一法，於春分之日，日未出而吐之。又一法，於雨水日後，三浴以藥泄汗。又一法，小金丹方：辰砂二兩，水磨雄黃一兩，葉子雌黃一兩，紫金半兩，同入合中，外固了，地一尺築地實，不用爐，不須藥制，用火二十斤煆之也，七日終，候冷七日取，次日出合子，埋藥地中七日，取出順日研之三日，煉白沙蜜為丸，如梧桐子大，每日望東吸日華氣一口，冰水下一丸，和氣嚥之，服十粒，無疫干也。 Another method, on the vernal equinox day, vomit before sunrise. Another method, on the rain water day after, bathe three times with medicine to sweat. Another method, small gold pill formula: two li of beichen sand, two li of shuimun xionghuang, one li of yecenzhimu, half a li of zigold, put them together in a cauldron, and make it waterproof. Build a kiln one chi high, no need for medicine, no need to refine, use fire of twenty catties to bake for seven days, wait for cooling for seven days, take out the cauldron, bury the medicine in the ground for seven days, take it out on the following day, grind it into powder for three days, refine white sand sugar into pills, like walnut size, every day facing east and taking in solar qi with one breath, taking a pill with iced water to replenish qi, taking ten pills, no more plague.

15: 黃帝問曰：人虛即神游失守位，使鬼神外干，是致夭亡，何以全真？願聞刺法。歧伯稽首再拜曰：昭乎哉問！謂神移失守，雖在其體，然不致死，或有邪干，故令夭壽。只如厥陰失守，天以虛，人氣肝虛，感天重虛，即魂游於上，邪干厥大氣，身溫猶可刺之，刺其足少陽之所過，次刺肝之俞。人病心虛，又遇君相二火司天失守，感而三虛，遇火不及，黑尸鬼犯之，令人暴亡，可刺手少陽之所過，復刺心俞。人脾病，又遇太陰司天失守，感而三虛，又遇土不及，青尸鬼邪犯之於人，令人暴亡，可刺足陽明之所過，復刺脾之俞。人肺病，遇陽明司天失守，感而三虛，又遇金不及，有赤尸鬼干人，令人暴亡，可刺手陽明之所過，復刺肺俞。人腎病，又遇太陽司天失守，感而三虛，又遇水運不及之年，有黃尸鬼干犯人正氣，吸人神魂，致暴亡，可刺足太陽之所過，刺足少陽之俞。 Emperor Yellow asked: When a person is empty and their spirit wanders without restraint, causing the spirits of ghosts to intervene, leading to untimely death, how can one attain completeness? I wish to hear about acupuncture. The Duke of Tang bowed and paid homage again, saying, Your Majesty's question is indeed profound! By speaking of a spirit that wanders without restraint, although it exists within the body, it does not result in death and may involve evil influences, thus causing untimely death. Just as when Yin is out of balance, Heaven punishes with emptiness, and a person's liver and gallbladder are empty, feeling Heaven's emptiness, their soul wanders above, allowing evil influences to control the great Qi, while the body still has warmth, acupuncture can be applied at the point where the foot channel of the lesser Yang passes through, followed by needling the Liver. When a person suffers from heart disease and encounters the influence of the Fire emperor who fails to maintain balance, they feel three levels of emptiness and encounter fire that does not reach, causing black corpses and ghosts to attack, leading to violent death. Acupuncture can be applied at the point where the hand channel of the lesser Yang passes through, followed by needling the heart. A person's spleen disease, when the Taiyin function fails to maintain balance, feels three levels of emptiness and encounters earth that does not reach, causing green corpses and ghosts to attack the person violently, leading to violent death. Acupuncture can be applied at the point where the foot channel of Yang Ming passes through, followed by needling the spleen. When a person suffers from lung disease and encounters the influence of Yang Ming who fails to maintain balance, they feel three levels of emptiness, and encounter metal that does not reach, causing red corpses and ghosts to attack the person violently, leading to violent death. Acupuncture can be applied at the point where the hand channel of Yang Ming passes through, followed by needling the lung. A person's kidney disease, when the Taiyang function fails to maintain balance and encounters water that does not reach during its phase, causes yellow corpses and ghosts to attack a person's pure Qi, draining their soul, leading to violent death. Acupuncture can be applied at the point where the foot channel of Taiyang passes through, and needling the foot channel of lesser Yang

16: 黃帝問曰：十二藏之相使，神失位，使神彩之不圓，恐邪干犯，治之可刺，願聞其要。歧伯稽首再拜曰：悉乎哉，問至理，道真宗，此非聖帝，焉究斯源，是謂氣神合道，契符上天。心者，君主之官，神明出焉，可刺手少陰之源。肺者，相傳之官，治節出焉，可刺手太陰之源。肝者，將軍之官，謀慮出焉，可刺足厥陰之源。膽者，中正之官，決斷出焉，可刺足少陽之源。膻中者，臣使之官，喜樂出焉，可刺心包胳所流。脾為諫議之官，知周出焉，可刺脾之源。胃為倉廩之官，五味出焉，可刺胃之源。大腸者，傳道之官，變化出焉，可刺大腸之源。小腸者，受盛之官，化物出焉，可刺小腸之源。腎者，作強之官，伎巧出焉，刺其腎之源。三焦者，決瀆之官，水道出焉，刺三焦之源。膀胱者，州都之官，精液藏焉，氣化則能出矣，刺膀胱之源。凡此十二官者，不得相失也。是故刺法有全神養真之旨，亦法有修真之道，非治疾也，故要修養和神也。道貴常存，補神固根，精氣不散，神守不分，然即神守而雖不去，亦全真，人神不守，非達至真，至真之要，在乎天玄，神守天息，復入本元，命曰歸宗。 Emperor Yellow asked: If the twelve channels are out of balance, causing the Qi and spirit to be disordered, there is a fear that evil forces will invade, and acupuncture can be used to treat it. I would like to know the essence of this method. Great Master kowtowed again and said: Indeed, your question is profound and your teaching is true. This is not about a holy emperor; how could it be so originated? It is called the harmony of Qi and spirit, corresponding with heaven's symbols. The heart is the official of the ruler, where the spirit emerges from, and acupuncture can be used on the source of the small intestine meridian. The lung is the official of transmission, where Qi regulation emerges, and acupuncture can be used on the source of the kidney meridian. The liver is the official of the general, where strategies emerge, and acupuncture can be used on the source of the liver meridian. The spleen is the official of deliberation, where discernment emerges, and acupuncture can be used on the source of the stomach meridian. The large intestine is the official of centrality, where decisions emerge, and acupuncture can be used on the source of the gallbladder meridian. The triple burner is the official of transformation, where skill emerges, and acupuncture can be used on the source of the triple burner meridian. The bladder is the official of storage, where essence accumulates, which will be able to flow out, and acupuncture can be used on the source of the bladder meridian. The twelve channels mentioned above must not lose their balance. Therefore, the principles of acupuncture have both nourishing the true Qi and cultivating the truth, not for treating illnesses; instead, it focuses on nurturing and harmonizing the spirit. Precious is this constant presence, supplementing the root of the spirit, keeping the Qi from dispersing, and keeping the spirit undivided; even if the spirit is kept intact but does not leave, it is still complete in truth, and the spirit that does not leave will return to its original source, called returning to the ancestral temple.

docs.title: 本病論
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問曰：天元九窒，余已知之，願聞氣交，何名失守？歧伯曰：謂其上下升降，遷正退位，各有經論，上下各有不前，故名失守也。是故氣交失易位，氣交迺變，變易非常，即四時失序，萬化不安，變民病也。 Yellow Emperor asked, The Heavenly Pivot consists of nine orifices, which I already know. May I hear about the balance of yin and yang? Misaligned guard? The Grand Duke replied, Regarding the rise and fall of yin and yang, as well as their shifts in position, each has its own theory, with both experiencing times when they do not advance. Hence, it is called 'misaligned guard.' Since the balance of yin and yang becomes difficult to maintain, the change in yin and yang leads to abnormalities, resulting in disruptions during the four seasons, instability among all things, and changes in human health.

2: 帝曰：升降不前，願聞其故，氣交有變，何以明知？ The Emperor said: If it cannot ascend or descend, I wish to hear its reason; if there is a change in the Qi, how can one clearly know?

3: 歧伯曰：昭乎問哉！明乎道矣。氣交有變，是謂天地機，但欲降而不得降者，地窒刑之。又有五運太過，而先天而至者，即交不前，但欲升而不得其升，中運抑之，但欲降而不得其降，中運抑之。於是有升之不前，降之不下者，升而至天者，有升降俱不前，作如此之分別，即氣交之變，變之有異，常各各不同，災有微甚者也。 Hu Bo said: How brilliant! How clear is the Way! The exchange of Qi has its changes, which are called the machinery of heaven and earth. If one wishes to descend but cannot descend, it is punished by the earth; if the five phases are too excessive, those who go first will be unable to advance, while wishing to ascend, they are restrained by the middle phase, and wishing to descend, they are unable to descend, also restrained by the middle phase. Thus, there is the absence of ascent and descent, ascending to heaven, with both ascending and descending not advancing, they make such a distinction, and the changes of Qi have their differences, always varying and constantly different, disasters, whether great or small, follow this pattern

4: 帝曰：願聞氣交遇會勝抑之由，變成民病，輕重何如？歧伯曰：勝相會，抑伏使然。是故辰戌之歲，木氣升之，主逢天柱，勝而不前。又遇庚戌，金運先天，中運勝之，忽然不前。木運升天，金迺抑之，升而不前，即清生風少，肅殺於春，露霜復降，草木乃萎。民病溫疫早發，咽嗌迺乾，四肢滿，肢節皆痛。久而化鬱，即大風摧拉，折隕鳴紊。民病卒中徧痹，手足不仁。 Emperor said: I wish to hear about the reasons for the occurrence of diseases that are caused by the meeting of qi and encounter, and how light or heavy they are. Duke of Zhou replied: The meeting of qi is victorious and suppresses the yin. Therefore, in the year of the Chenxu, the wood qi rises, controlling the pillars of heaven, triumphing but not advancing. It encounters the Jinzu, the metal phase precedes heaven, and the victorious phase is sudden but does not advance. The metal phase suppresses the wood phase, rising but not advancing, leading to a scarcity of clear life-giving energy, killing many in spring, and causing dew and frost to fall again. The plants wither away. People's diseases become warm fevers that occur early, throat and lips are dry, limbs are full, and joints all hurt. Over time, it turns into depression, leading to a great wind destroying crops, breaking branches and ringing sounds. People's diseases in the final stage are paralyzed, with no sensitivity in hands and feet.

5: 是故己亥之歲，君火升天，主窒天蓬，勝之不前。又厥陰木遷正，則少陰未得升天，水運以至其中者。君火欲升，而中水運抑之，升之不前，即清寒復作，冷生旦暮。民病伏陽，而內生煩熱，心神驚悸，寒熱閒作。日久成鬱，即暴熱迺至，赤風腫翳，化疫，溫癘暖作，赤氣瘴而化火疫，皆煩而躁渴，渴甚治之以泄之可止。 Therefore, in the year of Jia-hai, the fire of the emperor ascends to heaven, and the lord of the gate of heavenly peace reigns supreme, not being able to advance. Again, if the excessive yin changes its position to wood, then the lesser yin has not yet reached the point of ascending to heaven, and water energy penetrates it. The emperor's fire tries to rise, but is restrained by the water energy within, so that it cannot advance; this leads to a repetition of the clear cold, with daytime and nighttime chilliness. The people catch feverish colds, while internal heat produces discomfort, troubled minds and spirits. As time goes by, sudden high fevers arise, marked by redness of face, swelling, and plague, followed by a warm illness with hot feelings and sweating. The vital energy turns into fire sickness, manifesting as feverish disorders, restlessness, thirst, and inability to be cured.

6: 是故子午之歲，太陰升天，主窒天沖，勝之不前。又或遇壬子，木運先天而至者，中木遇抑之也。升天不前，即風埃四起，時舉埃昏，雨溼不化。民病風厥涎潮，徧痹不隨，脹滿。久而伏鬱，即黃埃化疫也，民病夭亡，臉肢府黃疸滿閉，溼令弗布，雨化迺微。 Therefore, in the Year of the Siwu, the Yang Fire ascends and governs the Opening of Heaven, triumphing without stopping. Also, one may encounter Xu Hai (Rabbit), when Wood Grain is ahead, indicating that Wood encounters constraint. Ascending without stopping means that Wind and Dust will suddenly arise, sometimes raising Dust and darkness, and rain not drying up. The people fall ill with Wind Stroke and Sweating Sickness, which do not progress in parallel, causing distention and fullness. If it continues, it results in the Yellow Dust plague, and the people's illness leads to death, with their faces and limbs yellow and swollen, closed like a bowl, while the rain does not evaporate, and dries up little by little.

7: 是故丑未之年，少陽升天，主窒天蓬，勝之不前。又或遇太陰未遷正者，即少陰未升天也，水運以至者。升天不前，即寒雰反布，凜冽如冬，水復涸，冰再結，暄暖乍作，冷復布之，寒暄不時。民病伏陽在內，煩熱生中，心神驚駭，寒熱閒爭。以久成鬱，即暴熱迺生，赤風氣瞳翳，化成鬱癘，迺作伏熱內煩，痹而生厥，甚則血溢。 Hence, in the year of the hour of Ch'ou before the birth of the Lesser Yin, the Sun ascends to Heaven, but will not advance. This is followed by a drought in the region governed by the Greater Yin, who has not moved into her proper position. When this occurs, it means that the water phase is approaching. If the sun does not advance, then cold mists pervade, like winter frost; the water again recedes, ice reforms, and for a time warmth appears, only to be followed by more cold. People become sick with internal heat of Yang, suffering fever and disturbance of spirit, which alternates between chill and warmth. If this continues for some time, it leads to a violent fever, redness and heat of the eyes, and changes into internal fever, causing pain and producing convulsions; in severe cases, there is bleeding.

8: 是故寅申之年，陽明升天，主窒天英，勝之不前。又或遇戊戊寅，火運先天而至。金欲升天，火運抑之，升之不前，即時雨不降，西風數舉，鹹鹵燥生。民病上熱喘嗽血溢。久而化鬱，即白埃翳霧，清生殺氣，民病脅滿悲傷，寒鼽嚏嗌乾，手拆皮膚燥。 Therefore, during the year of the Tiger and Rabbit, Yin Ming ascended to heaven, presiding over the triumph of the Yellow Emperor, who was victorious without having to advance. There were also instances where one encountered two Wood Tigers. The Fire star arrived in the heavens early. Gold desired to ascend to heaven but was restrained by the Fire star, and therefore did not ascend, resulting in no rain falling at the appropriate time, west winds repeatedly rising, and the salted fish industry thriving. People fell ill with high fevers, panting, and bleeding. This then turned into a gloomy state, where white dust, haze, and purifying qi prevailed, causing people's illnesses to become increasingly alarming and filled with sorrow, while colds became severe and throats parched, leading to skin peeling and drying out

9: 是故卯酉之年，太陽升天，土窒天內，勝之不前。又遇陽明未遷正者，即太陽未升天也，土運以至。水欲升天，土運抑之，升之不前，即溼而熱蒸，寒生雨閒。民病注不，食不及化。久而成鬱，冷來客熱，冰雹卒至。民病厥逆而噦，熱生於內，氣痹於外，足脛痠疼，反生心悸懊熱，暴煩而復厥。 Therefore, in the year of Jīnyín (Punishment and Completion), when the sun ascends to heaven, the earth is sealed within, and it is victorious but cannot advance further. It encounters Yángmíng (Brilliance without Falsehood) before moving to its proper place, which is when the sun has not yet risen to heaven and earth, with the earth running its course. Water tries to rise to heaven, but the earth suppresses it so it cannot advance further; it then becomes damp and hot, cold and rainy. People suffer from fevers that don't subside, and their food is not properly transformed. Over time, this leads to melancholy, with cold bringing out heat and hailstorms becoming severe. People suffer from severe fevers, and the heat generates internal discomfort while blocking external movement; they have pain in their ankles, and their hearts are restless and troubled by guilt, causing a sudden fever that is difficult to cure.

10: 黃帝曰：升之不前，余已盡知其旨。願聞降不下，可得明乎？歧伯曰：悉乎哉問！是之謂天地微旨，可以盡陳斯道，所謂升已降也。至天三年，次歲必降，降而入地，始為左閒也。如此升降往來，命之六紀者矣。是故丑未之歲，厥陰降地，主窒地皛，勝而不前。又或遇少陰未退位，即厥陰未降下，金運以至中。金運承之，降之不下，抑之變鬱，木欲降下，金承之，降而不下，蒼埃遠見，白氣承之，風舉埃昏，清躁行殺，霜露復下，肅殺布令。久而不降，抑之化鬱，即作風躁相伏，暄而反清，草木萌動，殺霜乃，蟄未見，懼清傷藏。 Yellow Emperor said: The ascent is not immediate, and I have already fully understood its intention. Is it possible to hear about the descent that does not come down? Duke of Zhou said: Indeed, you are asking about it! This refers to the subtle intention of heaven and earth, which can be fully explained in this way, and it is called ascending and descending. After three years in heaven, it must descend each year. When it enters the land, it becomes the first yin, and when it does not advance, it is called the left idle period. The cycle of rising and falling goes back and forth, making six records. Therefore, in the years of chen and si, the great yin descends to the earth, controlling the apertures of the earth and winning without advancing. It may also encounter a small yang that has not yet retreated, and if the great yin does not descend, the golden rune will be right in the middle. The golden rune bears it, and the descent is not immediate, suppressing it and causing huidun to turn into chaos. Wood may try to descend, gold bears it and prevents it from descending, and the blue dust is far away, white qi bearing it, the wind raises the dust and makes it hazy, clear and lively, frost and dew fall again, and hide the slaying mandate. If it does not descend for a long time, it suppresses it into chaos, and then becomes wind and chaos, piercing and hiding, suddenly becoming clear, grass and trees stir, killing the frost, and seeing no insects, fearing the clear danger and hiding.

11: 是故寅申之歲，少陰降地，主窒地玄，勝之不入。又或遇丙申丙寅，水運太過，先天而至。君火欲降，水運承之，降而不下，即彤雲纔見，黑氣反生，暄暖如舒，寒常布雪，凜冽復作，天雲慘悽。久而不降，伏之化鬱，寒勝復熱，赤風化疫，民病面赤心煩，頭痛目眩也，赤氣彰而溫病欲作也。 Therefore, in the year of Tian Shen, there is an insufficient Yin energy, ruling the constrained Yin Xuan, and it triumphs without reaching its goal. It may also encounter Jing Shen and Bing Shen, with water transport being too abundant, leading to premature arrival. When fire wants to descend, water supports it, but it does not fall until just after the dark clouds appear, black energy rebounds, the warmth suddenly expands like a breeze, cold always spreads snow, and the chill creates more of it. If it doesn't descend for a long time, it will secrete Ao, with cold victory leading to heat, red wind turning into disease, the people becoming ill, with their faces flushed and hearts disturbed; headaches and dizziness also occur, as the red energy is prominent and feverish diseases are about to break out.

12: 是故卯酉之歲，太陰降地，主窒地蒼，勝之不入。又或少陽未退位者，即太陰未得降也，或木運以至。木運承之，降而不下，即黃雲見而青霞彰，鬱蒸作而大風，霧翳埃勝，折損迺作。久而不降也，伏之化鬱，天埃黃氣，地布溼蒸，民病四肢不舉，昏眩肢節痛，腹滿填臆。 Therefore, in the year of the Yin Earth Rooster (60 years later than the sexagenary cycle), the Yin prevailed and controlled the Lung, resulting in a dry and weakened state. However, this was not effective. Alternatively, if the Yang was still insufficient or not yet fully developed, it could not defeat the Yin either; this is the phase of Wood's dominance. When the Wood phase takes over, it descends without manifesting clearly, and one may see hazy blue clouds and distinct white mists. Drizzling rain and fog prevail, with branches and leaves being bent or broken. If this phase persists but does not descend, it will suppress the Yin, allowing yellow dust to spread in the sky and damp steam to cover the earth. The people will be afflicted with diseases affecting their limbs, causing dizziness, pain in joints, weakness in the waist, and abdominal distention.

13: 是故辰戊之歲，少陽降地，主窒地玄，勝之不入。又或遇水運太過，先天而至也。水運承之，水降不下，即彤雲纔見，黑氣反生，暄暖欲生，冷氣卒至，甚即冰雹也。久而不降，伏之化鬱，冷氣復熱，赤風化疫，民病面赤心煩，頭痛目眩也，赤氣彰而熱病欲作也。 Therefore, in the year of Jia-shen (Chen-Wu), the Shao-yang (Minister) descended to the Earth and controlled the Yin of Xuan. This was victorious but did not enter. Alternatively, it may encounter water energy that is too excessive, leading to death before arrival. The water energy carries it, and water does not descend; as soon as the dark clouds appear, black gas rebounds, heating tends to arise, cold air becomes extreme, and it will immediately become hailstones. If it does not descend for a long time, it will hide as Tian (ice), cold air will be heated again, red wind will transform into epidemic diseases; people's hearts will be hot and restless, with headaches and dizziness, and the ardent Yang Qi is about to give rise to febrile diseases.

14: 是故己亥之歲，陽明降地，主窒地彤，勝而不入。又或遇太陰未退位，即少陽未得降，即火運以至之。火運承之不下，即天清而肅，赤氣迺彰，暄熱反作。民皆旨倦，夜臥不安，咽乾引飲，懊熱內煩，大清朝暮，暄還復作，久而不降，伏之化鬱，天清薄寒，遠生白氣。民病掉眩，手足直而不仁，兩脅作痛，滿目忙忙。 Therefore, in the year of Jí Hài, the Yang Míng descended (to earth), ruling and subduing the orifices, but did not enter. Alternatively, when encountering the retreating Qī Yǐn, and the Shǎo Yáng had yet to descend, it was because of the Fire Stem reaching its height. The Fire Stem being in control, the sky became clear and calm, with fiery qi bursting forth, producing intense heat. The people were exhausted, unable to sleep at night, their throats dry and parched, tormented by internal heat, becoming delirious during the day and night, with the heat still producing discomfort after a while, it was hidden and turned into melancholy, the sky became cold and distant, and white qi began to emerge. The people fell ill, suffering from dizziness, their limbs stiff and unresponsive, pain in both arms, blurry vision, and a state of constant restlessness.

15: 是故子午之年，太陽降地，主窒地阜勝之，降而不入。又或遇土運太過，先天而至。土運承之，降而不入，即天彰黑氣，暝暗悽慘，纔施黃埃而布溼，寒化令氣，蒸溼復令。久而不降，伏之化鬱，民病大厥，四肢重怠，陰痿少力，天布沈陰，蒸溼閒作。 During the year of Ziwei, the sun fell upon the earth, and the Duke of Ding conquered the state of Zhou, but did not enter it. Alternatively, if the Grand Exalt met with an excess of Earth, he arrived early. The Earth received this, and he did not enter, at which time the sky was dark and gloomy; the sun shone on the yellow dust and spread it, causing the cold to become humid again, with the moisture condensing. If it did not rain for a long time, it became hidden in the fog, and the people suffered great diseases, their limbs being heavy and sluggish, and their virility reduced and strength weakened; the sky covered in dark yin, and the sun's heat produced idle work.

16: 帝曰：升降不前，晰如其宗，願聞遷正，可得明乎？歧伯曰：正司中位，是謂遷正位，司天不得其遷正者，即前司天以過交司之。即遇司天太過有餘日也，即仍舊治天數，新司天未得遷正也。厥陰不遷正，即風暄不時，花卉萎瘁，民病淋溲，目系轉，轉筋喜怒，小便赤。風欲令而寒由不去，溫暄不正，春正失時。少陰不遷正，即冷氣不退，春冷後寒，暄暖不時。民病寒熱，四肢煩痛，腰脊強直。木氣雖有餘，位不過於君火也。太陰不遷正，即雲雨失令，萬物枯焦，當生不發。民病手足肢節腫滿，大腹水腫，填臆不食，飧泄脅滿，四肢不舉。雨化欲令，熱猶治之，溫煦於氣，亢而不澤。少陽不遷正，即炎灼弗令，苗莠不榮，酷暑於秋，肅殺晚至，霜露不時。民病㾬瘧骨熱，心悸驚駭，甚時血溢。陽明不遷正，則暑化於前，肅於後，草木反榮。民病寒熱鼽嚏，皮毛折，爪甲枯燋，甚則喘嗽息高，悲傷不樂。熱化乃布，燥化未令，即清勁未行，肺金復病。太陽不遷正，即冬清反寒，易令於春，殺霜在前，寒冰於後，陽光復治，凜冽不作，雰雲待時。民病溫癘至，喉閉溢乾，煩燥而渴，喘息而有音也。寒化待燥，猶治天，氣過失序，與民作災。 The emperor asked: Why doesn't the qi of ascending and descending change, and why does it seem like this? I wish to hear about the correcting [of the qi], can it be understood clearly?

Duke of Zhou replied: The position of correcting [the qi] is referred to as adjusting the correct. In regulating heaven, if one cannot adjust the correct, then it is because one has passed over regulating heaven and exceeded the proper balance. This results in a lack of regulation in governing heaven, and not being able to adjust the correct for heaven.

If yin does not adjust the correct, there will be untimely winds, flowers and plants wither, people get sick from dampness, and the stars move irregularly, causing stiff joints that feel joy or anger.

Winds may cause cold but it doesn't go away, and the sun is not regulated so the season is out of time.

If yang shaoye does not adjust the correct, there will be untimely winds, clouds and rain are not timely, and all things wither. People get sick with swollen joints, edema, bloated bellies, unable to eat, and diarrhea that threatens their lives, while feverish winds do not go away.

If shaoyin does not adjust the correct, there will be untimely rain and clouds so everything dries up and doesn't grow. People get sick with swollen joints, edema, bloated bellies, unable to eat, and diarrhea that threatens their lives, while feverish winds do not go away.

If jueyin does not adjust the correct, there will be untimely rain and clouds so everything dries up and doesn't grow. People get sick with chills and fever, their hearts are disturbed and afraid, and it is a critical time for bleeding.

If yangming does not adjust the correct, heat will come too early, while cold comes later. Grasses and trees become damaged, people get sick with chills and fevers, hair and skin dry up, nails become brittle, and in severe cases, there is wheezing and high-pitched breathing while unable to find joy.

Heat becomes a disaster, while dryness does not go away, so the lungs' qi does not circulate, and jīn (metal) becomes sick again.

If taiyang does not adjust the correct, there will be untimely cold in winter, easy to cause frostbite, and cold ice lingers longer after winter, causing yáng (sunlight) to fail to regulate. People get sick with warmth rashes, chills, throats that close up and become dry, they feel irritated and thirsty while wheezing and having high-pitched breathing.

Cold becomes a disaster, as if regulating heaven, but the qi goes over the proper balance, causing harm to people.

17: 帝曰：遷正早晚，以命其旨，願聞退位，可得明哉？歧伯曰：所謂不退者，即天數未終，即天數有餘，名曰復布政，故名曰再治天也，即天令如故而不退位也。厥陰不退位，即大風早舉，時雨不降，溼令不化，民病溫疫，疵廢風生，民病皆肢節痛，頭目痛，伏熱內煩，咽喉乾引飲。少陰不退位，即溫生春冬，蟄蟲早至，草木發生，民病膈熱咽乾，血溢驚駭，小便赤澀，丹瘤疹瘡瘍留毒。太陰不退位，而取寒暑不時，埃昏布作，溫令不去，民病四支少力，食飲不下，泄注淋滿，足脛寒，陰痿閉塞，失溺小便數。少陽不退位，即熱生於春，暑迺後化，冬溫不凍，流水不冰，蟄蟲出見，民病少氣，寒熱更作，便血上熱，小腹堅滿，小便赤沃，甚則血溢。陽明不退位，即春生清冷，草木晚榮，寒熱閒作，民病嘔吐暴注，食飲不下，大便乾燥，四肢不舉，目瞑掉眩。 The emperor said: When should I ascend the throne? It is a matter of life and death. May I know if it is appropriate to abdicate now, and can it be clearly understood? The Duke of Shou replied: The one who does not abdicate means that the days are not yet complete, and there is still time remaining. This is called 'restoring the canopy' and 'reordering Heaven.' It means to continue the decree as before without abdicating. If the left yang does not abdicate, it means early north winds will arise, rain will not fall, the flooding will not subside, and the people will suffer from summer and autumn fevers. The diseases will all be joint pain, headaches, feverish internal discomfort, sore throats, and dry throats that impede drinking. If the right yin does not abdicate, it means that warm weather will arise in spring and autumn, insects will arrive early, plants will sprout, and people will suffer from abdominal heat and sore throat, bloody secretions will be agitated, urine will be red and turbid, and toxic sores and lesions will remain. If the yin does not abdicate, it means that cold and heat will change unpredictably, dizziness and confusion will arise, the cold will not disperse, and people will suffer from weak limbs, their food and drink will not go down, they will have incontinence and be drenched, their soles and heels will be cold, and their essence will be wasted, causing difficulty in urinating. If the lesser yang does not abdicate, it means that heat will arise in spring, summer will follow quickly, winter warmth will not freeze, and water will not freeze, insects will appear, people will suffer from weakness of the spirit, alternating cold and heat, feverish blood will rise, the lower abdomen will be hard and distended, and urine will be red and wet. If the primordial yang does not abdicate, it means that in spring there will be clear and cold weather, plants will wither late, cold and heat will alternate, and people will suffer from vomiting and severe diarrhea, their food and drink will not go down, their limbs will not move, and their eyes will blink and wander.

18: 帝曰：天歲早晚，余以知之，願聞地數，可得閒乎？歧伯曰：地下遷正升及退位不前之法，即地土產化，萬物失時之化也。 The emperor said: Heaven's rise and set, I know of them. Will you please tell me the number of changes in the earth? Is there leisure in it? Tui Bo said: The law of the earth is its shifting position upwards and downwards, and the changing of positions that do not advance. This corresponds to the transformation of the earth's products into the myriad things, and the failure of their proper times.

19: 帝曰：余聞天地二甲子，十干十二支。上下經緯天地，數有迭移，失守其位，可得昭乎？歧伯曰：失之迭位者，謂雖得歲正，未得正位之司，即四時不節，即生大疫。注《玄珠密語》云：陽年三十年，除六年天刑，計有太過二十四年，除此六年，皆作太過之用，令不然之旨。今言迭支迭位，皆可作其不及也。 The emperor said: I have heard that there are two 'Algazali' in the heaven and earth, namely the ten stems and twelve branches. They govern the cycle of the universe. When the celestial bodies move up and down along their ecliptic, sometimes they lose their positions, can this be seen clearly? Duke Zhou replied: Those who fail to maintain their positions are those who may have mastered the solar terms, but have not grasped the timing of the celestial bodies. This results in the four seasons being out of order and brings about a great plague. The note from the Xuanzangmiyu states: The years governed by yang last thirty years, with six exception years, making it a total of twenty-four overly long years. Subtracting these six exception years, they all serve to demonstrate the intention of avoiding the undesirable result. Now if we talk about iterations of the ten stems and twelve branches, this can also be applied in the same way.

20: 假令甲子陽年，土運太窒，如癸亥天數有餘者，年雖交得甲子，厥陰猶尚治天，地已遷正，陽明在泉，去歲少陽以作右閒，即厥陰之地陽明，故不相和奉者也。癸巳相會，土運太過，虛反受木勝，故非太過也，何以言土運太過，況黃鐘不應太窒，木既勝而金還復，金既復而少陰如至，既木勝如火而金復微，如此則甲己失守，後三年化成土疫，晚至於卯，早至丙寅，土疫至也，大小善惡，推其天地，詳乎太一。又只如甲子年，如甲至子而合，應交司而治天，即下己未遷正，而戊寅少陽未退位者，亦甲己下有合也，即土運非太過，而木乃乘虛而勝土也，金次又行復勝之，即反邪化也。陰陽天地殊異爾，故其大小善惡，一如天地之法旨也。 Assuming that the year is a Yang year, and there is excess in the Earth branch, even if it is Geng-yin, the year still changes to Jia-zi. The Yin [Earth] will continue to govern Heaven, but the Earth has already been corrected, and the Sun is at the Spring Point, with the deficient Yang of last year used to make a right vacancy. Thus, it is not surprising that the Yin [Earth] and the Sun [Yang] do not harmonize. When Jia-yin meets Geng-xu, there is too much Earth, and Wood overcomes Vacuity. This is not because there is too much Earth; how can one say that there is too much Earth when the Yellow Bell does not respond to excess? Wood then triumphs over Earth, followed by Metal rebounding and prevailing in its turn. Next, Metal prevails slightly, as if Wood were Fire, and Metal diminishes further. Thus, Jia-yi loses its protection, and the following three years turn into an Earth sickness. It arrives at Ren-wu and first appears in Si-si, becoming a general illness of Earth. Both large and small events, good and evil, can be explained by Heaven and Earth's principles.

If one takes the year as Jia-zi, when Jia and Zi meet and unite, they should exchange and govern Heaven. Now, Geng-yin has not yet been corrected, and Wu-yin is still deficient without retreating from its position; thus, there is a meeting between Jia and Yi. The year is not too much Earth, but Wood triumphs over Vacuity by virtue of this excess. Metal then prevails again, leading to reverse transformation.

The principles of Yin-Yang in Heaven and Earth are extremely different from what you say; thus, the large and small events, good and evil, follow the intention of Heaven and Earth's laws.

21: 假令丙寅陽年太過，如乙丑天數有餘者，雖交得丙寅，太陰尚治天也，地已遷正，厥陰司地，去歲太陽以作右閒，即天太陰而地厥，故地不奉天化也。乙辛相會，水運太虛，反受土勝，故非太過，即太簇之管，太羽不應，土勝而雨化，水復即風，此者丙辛失守其會，後三年化成水疫，晚至己巳，早至戊辰，甚即速，微即徐，水疫至也，大小善惡推其天地數，乃太乙游宮。又只丙寅年，丙至寅且合，應交司而治天，即辛巳未得遷正，而庚辰太陽未退位者，亦丙辛不合德也，即水運亦小虛而小勝，或有復，後三年化癘，名曰水癘，其狀如水疫，治法如前。 Assuming that the year of the Yang is too long, and if the number of Yin years has not yet passed, even though there is a mutual hour of Yang, the Yin still governs the Heaven, and the Earth has already been rectified. The Department of Yin governs the Earth, removing the Solar Year to make the Right Excess, and immediately it becomes the Heavenly Yin and the Earthly Yin, so the Earth does not obey the Heavenly decree. When the Yin of Xin meets, the Water Resource is too weak, and suffers from the victory of the Earth, so it is not excessive, but rather belongs to the management of the Crown Prince, the Feathered Crow does not respond, and the Earth triumphs while the water changes into dew, the water again becomes wind, and this occurs in the year of Bing Xin when Bing Xin fails to attend their meeting. In the following three years, it becomes the water sickness, arriving at Jǐ Sì early and Tǐ Chên late, very fast and somewhat slow, and the water sickness comes into existence. Both small good and evil fortune can be attributed to the Heaven and Earth numbers, which are the Palace of Yin and Yin. Similarly, assuming a year of Bing Xu, Bing at Xin and merging together apply to govern Heaven and treat it as a trade, but Shēng Rì is not yet in its proper position, and in the following three years it becomes the water sickness. Its treatment law is the same as before.

22: 假令庚辰陽年太過，如己卯天數有餘者，雖交庚辰年也，陽明猶尚治天，地以遷正，太陰司地，去歲少陰以作右閒，即天陽明而地太陰也，故地下奉天也。乙巳相會，金運太虛，反受火勝，故非太過也，即姑洗之管，太商不應，火勝熱化，水復寒刑，此乙庚失守，其後三年化成金疫也，速至壬午，徐至癸未，金疫至也，大小善惡，推本年天數及太一也。又只如庚辰，如庚至辰，且應交司而治天，即下乙未未得遷正者，即地甲午少陰未退位者，且乙庚不合德也，即下乙未，干失剛，亦金運小虛也，有小勝或無復，後三年化癘，名曰金癘，其狀如金疫也，治法如前。 Assuming the year of the Yang Fire (庚辰) is too strong, and if there are extra days in the Jupiter-Rabbit (己卯) year, even though it is a Yang-Fire year, the Yin and Yang are still balanced, causing the Earth to move to its proper position. The Yang is dominant above and the Yin governs below. If there is a deficiency of Yin in the previous year, this will result in an excess of Yin on the right side, with Heaven being dominated by Yin and Earth governed by Yin. This is why we say that the Earth serves Heaven. When Metal Ox (乙巳) meets, there is a deficiency of Metal, resulting in Fire being dominant. Therefore, this is not due to an excess. Like using a metal stick to manage a dog, and when Mercury fails to apply correctly, causing Fire to dominate and create heat, while Water produces cold punishment. This results in the failure of Jupiter-Roooster (庚卯) to maintain balance, leading to the development of a Metal sickness over the next three years. It gradually reaches its peak at the time of the Dragon (壬午), then slowly at the time of the Water Rat (癸未), and the Metal sickness has fully manifested. Good and evil are influenced by the heavens, based on the number of days in the year and the Taiyi principle. Similarly, if it is like Yang-Fire (庚辰) year, and Jupiter-Rooster (乙未) year also applies and governs above, but the right position of Earth is not adjusted, and there is a lack of harmony between Jupiter-Rooster and Yang-Fire. This results in the failure of Jupiter-Ox (乙巳), with a Metal deficiency that is also small and insignificant. There is a possibility of a small victory or no effect at all, leading to the development of a Metal sore over the next three years. It is called Metal Sore, its state is similar to Metal sickness, and treatment is similar to the previous method.

23: 假令壬午陽年太過，如辛巳天數有餘者，雖交後壬午年也，厥陰猶尚治天，地巳遷正，陽明在泉，去歲丙申少陽以作右閒，即天厥陰而地陽明，故地不奉天者也。丁辛相合會，木運太虛，反受金勝，故非太過也，即蕤賓之管，太角不應，金行燥勝，火化熱復甚即速，微即徐，疫至大小善惡，推疫至之年天數及太一。又只如壬至午，且應交司而治之，即下丁酉未得遷正者，即地下丙申少陽未得退位者，見丁壬不合德也，即丁柔干失剛，亦木運小虛也，有小勝小復。後三年化癘，名曰木癘，其狀如風疫，法治如前。 If the reign of the Yin in the Jupiter year is too long, and if the number of days in the Solar term of Xin She has not yet ended, even though it later becomes the Ren Mao year, the Yin is still regulating heaven, while the Sun in Li Ch'ien is correctly positioned, and the Yang Ming is at the springs. The deficiency year is then followed by an excess year, resulting in a situation where heaven is dominated by Yin and earth by Yang Ming, so that earth does not obey heaven. When Metal and Fire meet, Wood is too vacuous, and suffers defeat to Earth, which therefore wins. This is not because of excess; it is simply the situation as represented by the trigram K'an (Man) and the hexagram Ta Ch'u, where the line in the top position does not change.

The next year, Wood and Fire meet, but because Wood is vacuous, Fire wins. This results in a situation where heat is very intense and rapid, becoming moderated only gradually. The epidemic becomes severe or mild according to whether it occurs early or late in the year, and its onset can be predicted by counting the days of the Solar term in which the epidemic occurs. If we assume that it occurs during the Solar term Jupiter-Mao, we find that the appropriate procedure is to begin treatment at the first day of the month of Earth-Wu. This means that the Lesser Yin has not yet withdrawn its influence, and this is a situation where Metal and Wood are both lacking in strength. The result is that they lose out to Fire, which wins because of its position at the bottom of the hexagram, as represented by the trigram Ch'ien (The Creative).

In the next three years, the epidemic recurs, and it is called the Epidemic of Wood. Its course resembles that of the Wind Epidemic, and its treatment is the same as before.

24: 假令戊申陽年太過，如丁未天數太過者，雖交得入申年也，太陰尚治天，地已遷正，厥陰在泉，去歲壬戌太陽以退位作右閒，即天丁未，地癸亥，故地不奉天化也。丁癸相會，火運太虛反受火勝，故非太過也，即夷則之管，上太徵不應，此戊癸失守其會，後三年化疫也，速至庚戌，大小善惡，推疫至之年天數及大一。又只如戊申，如戊至申，且應交司而治天，即下癸亥未得遷正者，即地下壬戌太陽未退位者，見戊癸未合德也，即下癸柔干失剛，見火運小虛也，有小勝或無復也，後三年化癘名曰火癘也，治法如前，治之法可寒之泄之。 Assuming that the yang years of Wù Xīn were too long, and that the yin years of Dīng Wèi were too short, although they could enter the year of Shēn Xīn, the Yīn still governs the heavens, while the earth has been corrected, the excess yin is in the springs, and the sun of last year leaves its position to become the right yang, making it the year of Dīng Wèi, and the earth as Gēng Hài. Therefore, the earth did not follow the heavenly transformations. When Dīng and Gēng meet, the fire stalk is too weak and receives the power of fire, which is why it's not excessive. If you restrain it, it will be called the illness, its law can be found in the year when the illness occurs.

If we assume that the yang years of Wù Xīn are too long, and if Wù reaches Xīn and applies for treatment, then the heavens are governed by yin, while the earth has not been corrected, the excess yin is in the springs, and the sun of last year leaves its position to become the right yang, making it the year of Dīng Wèi, and the earth as Gēng Hài. Therefore, there is no land following the heavenly transformations. If we only assume the yang years of Wù Xīn, when Wù reaches Xīn and treats it while governing the heavens, but if below we do not correct the Gēng-Ròu year, which has not yet retreated from its position, we see the meeting of Dīng and Gēng. Below, Gēng is weak and lacks rigidity, and there is a small victory or no victory at all. In the following three years, it will be called the fire illness and treated according to the previous method. The treatment law can release cold sweat

25: 黃帝曰：人氣不足，天氣如虛，人神失守，神光不聚，邪鬼干人，致有夭亡，可得聞乎？歧伯曰：人之五藏，一藏不足，又會天虛，感邪之至也。人憂愁思慮即傷心，又或遇少陰司天，天數不及，太陰作接閒至，即謂天虛也，此即人氣天氣同虛也。又遇驚而奪精，汗出於心，因而三虛，神明失守，心為君主之官，神明出焉，神失守位，即神游上丹田，在帝太一帝君泥九君下，神既失守，神光不聚，卻遇火不及之歲，有黑尸鬼見之，令人暴亡。人飲食勞倦即傷脾，又或遇太陰司天，天數不及，即少陽作接閒至，即謂之虛也，此即人氣虛而天氣虛也。又遇飲食飽甚，汗出於胃，醉飽行房，汗出於脾，因而三虛，脾神失守，脾為諫議之官，智周出焉，神既失守，神光失位而不聚也，卻遇土不及之年，或己年或甲年失守，或太陰天虛，青尸鬼見之，令人卒亡。人久坐溼地，強力入水即傷腎，腎為作強之官，伎巧出焉，因而三虛，腎神失守，神志失位，神光不聚，卻遇水不及之年，或辛不會符，或丙年失守，或太陽司天虛，有黃尸鬼至，見之令人暴亡。人或恚怒，氣逆上而不下，即傷肝也。又遇厥陰司天，天數不及，即少陰作接閒至，是謂天虛也，此謂天虛人虛也。又遇疾走恐懼，汗出於肝，肝為將軍之官，謀慮出焉，神位失守，神光不聚，又遇木不及年，或丁年不符，或壬年失守，或厥陰司天虛也，有白尸鬼見之，令人暴亡也。已上五失守者，天虛而人虛也，神游失守其位，即有五尸鬼干人，令人暴亡，也謂之曰尸厥。人犯五神易位，即神光不圓也，非但尸鬼，即一切邪犯者，皆是神失守位故也。此謂得守者生，失守者死，得神昌，失神者亡。 Yellow Emperor said: If a person's vital energy is insufficient and the heavenly energy is like emptiness, their spirit and soul will lose their guardianship. The celestial light will not converge, evil spirits will attack people, leading to premature death. Have you heard of this? Qi Bo replied: A person has five essences, one essence insufficiency leads to heavenly emptiness, which is the extreme susceptibility to evil spirits. When a person worries, mourns, and reflects, they hurt their heart, and may also encounter a shortage of yin governing heaven, which does not last long, causing heaven's emptiness. This is the same as the insufficiency of human vital energy and heavenly energy. Moreover, upon being startled, they lose their spirit, sweat flows from the heart, resulting in three forms of emptiness, and their soul and divine light lose their guardianship. The soul serves as the emperor's official, coming forth from the divine on high, the divine light loses its guardianship, and does not converge when it encounters a year without fire. Black corpses may appear and cause people to die violently. People's vital energy is damaged by overeating and tiredness, or they may encounter a shortage of yin governing heaven, which does not last long, causing the sun to become more prominent. Yellow corpse spirits may appear and cause violent deaths. Sitting for a long time in damp places can harm the kidneys, as the kidneys are the official in charge of strength and agility, coming forth from within. This results in three forms of emptiness, as the kidney spirit loses its guardianship, with the divine light not converging when it encounters a year without water. Green corpses may appear and cause violent deaths. People sometimes feel anger or sorrow, causing qi to flow counter to its proper direction, harming the liver. If there is an insufficiency of yin governing heaven, which does not last long, this is considered heavenly emptiness. This refers to both heavenly and human emptiness. Upon encountering panic and fear, sweat flows from the liver, as the liver is the general's official, coming forth with strategy. The divine light loses its guardianship, and the light does not converge when it encounters a year without wood. White corpses may appear and cause violent deaths. In conclusion, if a person loses the guardianship of the five spirits, this is heavenly emptiness and human emptiness. The divine light wanders without guardianship, leading to the attack by five corpse spirits, causing violent deaths. This is also known as the corpse evil. A person who loses the balance of the five spirits will not have a converging divine light, nor are only corpse evils the only danger. It means that those who lose the guardianship of position and die are doomed to destruction by the divine light, while those who maintain the divine light will live.

docs.title: 至真要大論
docs.text:
1: 黃帝問曰：五氣交合，盈虛更作，余知之矣。六氣分治，司天地者，其至何如。歧伯再拜對曰：明乎哉問也。天地之大紀，人神之通應也。帝曰：願聞上合昭昭，下合冥冥，柰何。歧伯曰：此道之所主，工之所疑也。帝曰：願聞其道也。歧伯曰：厥陰司天，其化以風，少陰司天，其化以熱，太陰司天，其化以濕，少陽司天，其化以火，陽明司天，其化以燥，太陽司天，其化以寒，以所臨藏位，命其病者也。帝曰：地化柰何。歧伯曰：司天同候，間氣皆然。帝曰：間氣何謂。歧伯曰：司左右者，是謂間氣也。帝曰：何以異之。歧伯曰：主歲者紀歲，間氣者紀步也。帝曰：善。歲主奈何。歧伯曰：厥陰司天為風化，在泉為酸化，司氣為蒼化，閒氣為動化。少陰司天為熱化，在泉為苦化，不司氣化，居氣為灼化。太陰司天為濕化，在泉為甘化，司氣為黅化，閒氣為柔化。少陽司天為火化，在泉為苦化，司氣為丹化，間氣為明化。陽明司天為燥化，在泉為辛化，司氣為素化，間氣為清化。太陽司天為寒化，在泉為鹹化，司氣為玄化，間氣為藏化。故治病者，必明六化分治，五味五色所生，五藏所宜，迺可以言盈虛病生之緒也。 Emperor asked: When the five energies are unified, and yin and yang are further balanced, I am already aware of this. But how can the six energies be separated and governed, those who govern heaven and earth, how is it done?

Huo Bo bowed again in response and said, It is truly a profound question. The order of heaven and the connection between humans and spirits are manifested through this. Emperor asked: I wish to hear about the great harmony above and the harmony below. Ho Bo replied: This path is what the wise follow, and what causes confusion for craftsmen. Emperor asked: I wish to hear about its way.

Huo Bo said: The Excessive Yin governs heaven, its transformation manifests as wind; the Lesser Yin governs heaven, its transformation manifests as heat; the Yin of heaven governs heaven, its transformation manifests as dampness; the Shao Yang governs heaven, its transformation manifests as fire; the Yang Ming governs heaven, its transformation manifests as aridity; and the Greater Yang governs heaven, its transformation manifests as cold. Emperor asked: How about the transformation of earth?

Huo Bo replied: The governance of heaven and earth is the same in terms of timing, and all intermediate energies are also timed accordingly. Emperor asked: What are these intermediate energies? Huo Bo replied: Those who govern left and right are referred to as intermediate energies. Emperor asked: How are they different?

Huo Bo said: The Master of the season governs according to the season, and the intermediate energies govern according to steps. Emperor asked: That is good. How should one handle being the Master of the season?

Huo Bo replied: The Excessive Yin governs heaven as wind, resides in the wells as an acidic influence; the Lesser Yin governs heaven as heat, does not reside in the wells but governs as a scorching influence; the Yin of heaven governs heaven as dampness, resides in the wells as a sweet influence; the Shao Yang governs heaven as fire, resides in the wells as a bright influence; the Yang Ming governs heaven as aridity, resides in the wells as a bitter influence; the Greater Yang governs heaven as cold, resides in the wells as a salty influence. Therefore, to treat diseases, one must clearly understand the six transformations and their divisions, and the flavors and colors that give rise to the five organs. This is already enough to describe the cause of yin and yang imbalance.

2: 帝曰：厥陰在泉而酸化，先余知之矣。風化之行也何如。歧伯曰：風行于地，所謂本也，餘氣同法。本乎天者，天之氣也，本乎地者，地之氣也，天地合氣，六節分而萬物化生矣。故曰：謹候氣宜，無失病機，此之謂也。帝曰：其主病何如。歧伯曰：司歲備物，則無遺主矣。帝曰：先歲物何也。歧伯曰：天地之專精也。帝曰：司氣者何如。歧伯曰：司氣者主歲同，然有餘不足也。帝曰：非司歲物何謂也。歧伯曰：散也，故質同而異等也，氣味有薄厚，性用有躁靜，治保有多少，力化有淺深，此之謂也。帝曰：歲主藏害何謂。歧伯曰：以所不勝命之則其要也。帝曰：治之柰何。歧伯曰：上淫于下，所勝平之，外淫于內，所勝治之。帝曰：善。平氣何如。歧伯曰：謹察陰陽所在而調之，以平為期，正者正治，反者反治。 The Emperor said: The Yin Qi is located at the source and becomes acidic. I have known this for a long time. What about the movement of the Qi in the transformation? Duke said: The Qi moves on the ground, which is the foundation, and the remaining Qi follows the same principle. Originating from heaven, it is heavenly Qi; originating from the earth, it is earthly Qi. When the Qi of heaven and earth are combined, they divide into six departments and give birth to myriad things. Therefore, it is said that being cautious about the Qi is appropriate, without missing any opportunities for recovery. The Emperor said: How does one deal with the illness? Duke said: Preparing for the season and stockpiling supplies will ensure there are no lingering diseases. The Emperor said: What are seasonal supplies? Duke said: They are the essence of heaven and earth. The Emperor said: How should I manage the Qi? Duke said: Managing the Qi is similar to managing the seasons, but it involves a surplus or deficit. The Emperor said: What does not managing the seasonal supplies mean? Duke said: Scattered, so although they have the same essence, they are different in degree, with flavors of thin and thick, uses of agitated and quiet, treatments with more or less, and transformations with shallow and deep, this is what he meant. The Emperor said: What does the seasonal lord hide? Duke said: It hides the things one cannot overcome by willpower. The Emperor said: How do I treat it? Duke said: Control the excess in the lower part, and control the treatment in the upper part, to restore balance. The Emperor said: Good. Balancing the Qi is what? Duke said: Cautiously observe the location of Yin and Yang and adjust them accordingly, with a goal of balancing.

3: 帝曰：夫子言察陰陽所在而調之，論言人迎與寸口相應，若引繩小大齊等，命曰平，陰之所在寸口何如。歧伯曰：視歲南北，可知之矣。帝曰：願卒聞之。歧伯曰：北政之歲，少陰在泉，則寸口不應，厥陰在泉，則右不應，太陰在泉，則左不應。南政之歲，少陰司天，則寸口不應，厥陰司天，則右不應，太陰司天，則左不應。諸不應者，反其診則見矣。帝曰：尺候何如。歧伯曰：北政之歲，三陰在下，則寸不應，三陰在上，則尺不應。南政之歲，三陰在天，則寸不應，三陰在泉，則尺不應，左右同。故曰：知其要者，一言而終，不知其要，流散無窮，此之謂也。 The emperor said: Zhongni spoke of understanding the location and adjusting yin and yang, discussing how speech meets response and corresponds with a single hair's breadth. If one extends the string big or small equally, he calls it level. Where is the location of yin? Boyi said: By observing the cycle of north and south, it can be known. The emperor said: I wish to hear more about this. Boyi said: In the season of northern politics, lesser yin is at the well, so the left should not respond; greater yin is at the well, so the right should not respond; greater yin is at the well, so the left should not respond. In the season of southern politics, lesser yin governs heaven, so the left should not respond; greater yin governs heaven, so the right should not respond; greater yin governs heaven, so the left should not respond. All the ones that should not respond can be seen by reversing their diagnosis. The emperor said: What about the foot measure? Boyi said: In the season of northern politics, three yin are below, so the left should not respond; three yin are above, so the foot measure should not respond. In the season of southern politics, three yin are in heaven, so the left should not respond; three yin are at the well, so the foot measure should not respond, as for left and right it is the same. Therefore, he said: Knowing its essence allows one to speak with brevity, while those who do not know its essence are scattered without end. This is what I mean.

4: 帝曰：善。天地之氣，內淫而病何如。歧伯曰：歲厥陰在泉，風淫所勝，則地氣不明，平野昧，草迺早秀，民病洒洒振寒，善伸數欠，心痛支滿，兩脇裏急，飲食不下，鬲咽不通，食則嘔，腹脹善噫，得後與氣，則快然如衰，身體皆重。歲少陰在泉，熱淫所勝，則焰浮川澤，陰處反明，民病腹中常鳴，氣上衝胸，喘不能久立，寒熱皮膚痛，目瞑齒痛䪼腫，惡寒發熱如瘧，少腹中痛腹大，蟄蟲不藏。歲太陰在泉，草迺早榮，濕淫所勝，則埃昏巖谷黃反見黑，至陰之交民病飲積心痛耳聾，渾渾焞焞，嗌腫喉痺，陰病血見，少腹痛腫，不得小便，病衝頭痛，目似脫，項似拔，腰似折，髀不可以回，膕如結，腨如別。歲少陽在泉，火淫所勝，則焰明郊野，寒熱更至，民病注泄赤白，少腹痛溺赤，甚則血便，少陰同候。歲陽明在泉，燥淫所勝，則霿霧清暝，民病喜嘔，嘔有苦善大息，心脅痛不能反側，甚則嗌乾面塵，身無膏澤，足外反熱。歲太陽在泉，寒淫所勝則凝肅慘慄，民病少腹控睾，引腰脊上衝心痛，血見，嗌痛頷腫。帝曰：善。治之柰何。歧伯曰：諸氣在泉，風淫于內，治以辛涼，佐以苦，以甘緩之，以辛散之。熱淫于內，治以鹹寒，佐以甘苦，以酸收之，以苦發之。濕淫于內，治以苦熱，佐以酸淡，以苦燥之，以淡泄之。火淫于內，治以鹹冷，佐以苦辛，以酸收之，以苦發之。燥淫于內，治以苦溫，佐以甘辛，以苦下之。寒淫于內，治以甘熱，佐以苦辛，以鹹寫之，以辛潤之，以苦堅之。 Emperor: Good. How would the vital energy in Heaven and Earth be affected if the interior was overheated? Zhouyi replied: If Yin prevails during a year of excess, the land's Qi will not be clear, the plains will be dull, the grasses and herbs will sprout early, the people will suffer from chills, their tendons will be weak, hearts will hurt, sides will feel heavy, they will have difficulty swallowing food, throats will be constricted, if they eat, they will vomit, bellies will bloat and burp loudly, upon defecation, their lower back will ache like an old man, and their bodies will become heavy. If Yang prevails during a year of excess, the flames will rise in rivers and lakes, the Yin areas will be clearly defined, people will suffer from abdominal pains that resonate constantly, Qi will invade the chest, causing shortness of breath and difficulty standing for long periods, chills and rashes will cause pain in teeth, eyes, and testicles, fever will arise like measles, lower abdomen will ache and distend, insects will not hide, menstruation will be blocked. If Taiyin prevails during a year of excess, grasses and herbs will sprout early, dampness will prevail, causing the areas to become foggy, blackened, and visible, at the junctions of Yin, people will suffer from retained food and deafness, with flames flickering, red and sore, lower abdomen will ache and distend, they will not be able to urinate, heads will ache as if pulled, necks will ache like a limb that has been wrenched, waists will ache as if broken, thighs will not bend properly, butts will be knotted and hips will feel separated. If Shaoyang prevails during a year of excess, flames will shine on the outskirts, chills and fevers will be more intense, people will suffer from bloody discharge and diarrhea, lower abdomen will ache and bleed, if it is extreme, there will be blood in their urine, Shaoyin and Shaoyang will both suffer. Emperor: Good. How should they be treated? Zhouyi replied: Regulate the Qi at its source, assist with bitter flavors, use sweet ones to calm, disperse with pungent, treat with acrid herbs. For excess internal heat, regulate with salty and cold, assist with sweet and bitter, clear with sour, release with bitter. For excess internal dampness, regulate with bitter and warm, assist with sour and astringent, dry with bitter, eliminate with astringent. For excess internal fire, regulate with salty and cool, assist with sweet and bitter, clear with sour, release with bitter. For excess internal heat, regulate with sweet and warm, assist with bitter and cold, clear with salty, moisten with mucilage, make firm with bitter.

5: 帝曰：善。天氣之變何如。歧伯曰：厥陰司天，風淫所勝，則太虛埃昏，雲物以擾，寒生春氣，流水不冰，民病胃脘當心而痛，上支兩脅，鬲咽不通，飲食不下，舌本強，食則嘔，冷泄腹脹溏泄瘕水閉，蟄蟲不去，病本于脾。衝陽絕，死不治。少陰司天，熱淫所勝，怫熱至火行其政，民病胸中煩熱嗌乾，右胠滿，皮膚痛，寒熱欬喘，大雨且至，唾血血泄，鼽衂嚏嘔，溺色變，甚則瘡瘍胕腫，肩背臂臑及缺盆中痛，心痛肺䐜，腹大滿膨，膨而喘欬，病本于肺，尺澤絕，死不治。太陰司天，濕淫所勝，則沈陰且布，雨變枯槁，胕腫骨痛陰痺，陰痺者按之不得，腰脊頭項痛時眩，大便難，陰氣不用，飢不欲食，欬唾則有血，心如懸，病本于腎。太谿絕，死不治。少陽司天，火淫所勝，則溫氣流行，金政不平，民病頭痛發熱惡寒而瘧，熱上皮膚痛，色變黃赤，傳而為水，身面胕腫，腹滿仰息，泄注赤白，瘡瘍欬唾血，煩心胸中熱，甚則鼽衂，病本于肺，天府絕，死不治。陽明司天，燥淫所勝，則木迺晚榮，草迺晚生，筋骨內變，民病左胠脇痛，寒清于中感而瘧，大涼革候，欬，腹中鳴注泄鶩溏，名木歛生菀于下，草焦上首，心脅暴痛，不可反側，嗌乾面塵腰痛，丈夫㿉疝，婦人少腹痛，目昧眥，瘍瘡痤癰，蟄蟲來見，病本于肝。太衝絕，死不治。太陽司天，寒淫所勝，則寒氣反至，水且冰，血變于中，發為癰瘍，民病厥心痛，嘔血血泄鼽衂，善悲時眩仆，運火炎烈，雨暴迺雹，胸腹滿，手熱肘攣，掖衝，心澹澹大動，胸脇胃脘不安，面赤目黃，善噫嗌乾，甚則色炱，渴而欲飲，病本于心。神門絕，死不治。所謂動氣知其藏也。帝曰：善。治之柰何。歧伯曰：司天之氣，風淫所勝，平以辛涼，佐以苦甘，以甘緩之，以酸寫之。熱淫所勝，平以鹹寒，佐以苦甘，以酸收之。濕淫所勝，平以苦熱，佐以酸辛，以苦燥之，以淡泄之。濕上甚而熱，治以苦溫，佐以甘辛，以汗為故而止。火淫所勝，平以酸冷，佐以苦甘，以酸收之，以苦發之，以酸復之，熱淫同。燥淫所勝，平以苦濕，佐以酸辛，以苦下之。寒淫所勝，平以辛熱，佐以甘苦，以鹹寫之。 Emperor: Good. What is the nature of the changes in weather? Qi Bo: The Yin and Yang forces are out of balance, leading to various ailments. In the case of too much Yin, it leads to heat and drought, causing discomfort and illnesses such as heatstroke, joint pain, and skin rashes. In the case of too much Yang, it leads to excessive heat and fire, causing diseases such as fever, chills, and diarrhea. The treatment for these imbalances involves using herbs and acupuncture to restore balance between Yin and Yang, cooling or warming the body, and addressing specific symptoms.

6: 帝曰：善。邪氣反勝，治之柰何。歧伯曰：風司于地，清反勝之，治以酸溫，佐以苦甘，以辛平之。熱司于地，寒反勝之，治以甘熱，佐以苦辛，以鹹平之。濕司于地，熱反勝之，治以苦冷，佐以鹹甘，以苦平之。火司于地，寒反勝之，治以甘熱，佐以苦辛，以鹹平之。燥司于地，熱反勝之，治以平寒，佐以苦甘，以酸平之，以和為利。寒司于地，熱反勝之，治以鹹冷，佐以甘辛，以苦平之。帝曰：其司天邪勝何如。歧伯曰：風化於天，清反勝之，治以酸溫，佐以甘苦。熱化於天，寒反勝之，治以甘溫，佐以苦酸辛。濕化於天，熱反勝之，治以苦寒，佐以苦酸。火化於天，寒反勝之，治以甘熱，佐以苦辛。燥化於天，熱反勝之，治以辛寒，佐以苦甘。寒化於天，熱反勝之，治以鹹冷，佐以苦辛。 The Emperor said: Good. How about treating the evil qi that has gained the upper hand? Duke of Shou replied: If the pathogenic factor of wind dominates, it should be treated with acrid and warm herbs to dispel cold; accompanied by bitter and sweet herbs to harmonize the middle Jiao. If the pathogenic factor of heat dominates, it should be treated with sweet and warm herbs to disperse cold; accompanied by bitter and pungent herbs to purge the excess heat. If the pathogenic factor of dampness dominates, it should be treated with bitter and cold herbs to dispel heat; accompanied by salty and sweet herbs to harmonize the middle Jiao. If the pathogenic factor of fire dominates, it should be treated with sweet and warm herbs to disperse cold; accompanied by bitter and pungent herbs to purge the excess heat. If the pathogenic factor of dryness dominates, it should be treated with moderate cold and warm herbs to dispel heat; accompanied by bitter and sweet herbs to harmonize the middle Jiao. If the pathogenic factor of cold dominates, it should be treated with salty and cold herbs to disperse heat; accompanied by bitter and pungent herbs to purge the excess cold. The Emperor asked: How do you treat the evil factors that dominate in heaven? Duke of Shou replied: If the pathogenic factor of wind dominates, it should be treated with acrid and warm herbs to dispel cold; accompanied by bitter and sweet herbs to harmonize the middle Jiao. If the pathogenic factor of heat dominates, it should be treated with sweet and warm herbs to disperse cold; accompanied by bitter and pungent herbs to purge the excess heat. If the pathogenic factor of dampness dominates, it should be treated with bitter and cold herbs to dispel heat; accompanied by salty and bitter herbs to harmonize the middle Jiao. If the pathogenic factor of fire dominates, it should be treated with sweet and warm herbs to disperse cold; accompanied by bitter and pungent herbs to purge the excess heat. If the pathogenic factor of dryness dominates, it should be treated with moderate cold and warm herbs to dispel heat; accompanied by bitter and sweet herbs to harmonize the middle Jiao. If the pathogenic factor of cold dominates, it should be treated with salty and cold herbs to disperse heat; accompanied by bitter and pungent herbs to purge the excess cold.

7: 帝曰：六氣相勝柰何。歧伯曰：厥陰之勝，耳鳴頭眩，憒憒欲吐，胃鬲如寒，大風數舉，倮蟲不滋，胠脇氣并，化而為熱，小便黃赤，胃脘當心而痛，上支兩脇，腸鳴飱泄，少腹痛，注下赤白，甚則嘔吐，鬲咽不通。少陰之勝，心下熱善飢，齊下反動，氣遊三焦，炎暑至，木乃津，草乃萎，嘔逆躁煩，腹滿痛溏泄，傳為赤沃。太陰之勝，火氣內鬱，瘡瘍於中，流散於外，病在胠脇，甚則心痛熱格，頭痛喉痺項強，獨勝則濕氣內鬱，寒迫下焦，痛留頂，互引眉閒，胃滿，雨數至，燥化乃見，少腹滿腰脽重強，內不便善注泄，足下溫，頭重足脛胕腫，飲發於中，胕腫於上。少陽之勝，熱客於胃，煩心心痛，目赤欲嘔，嘔酸善飢，耳痛溺赤，善驚譫妄，暴熱消爍，草萎水涸，介蟲乃屈，少腹痛下沃赤白。陽明之勝，清發於中，左胠脇痛溏泄，內為嗌塞，外發㿉疝，大涼肅殺，華英改容，毛蟲乃殃，胸中不便，嗌塞而欬。太陽之勝，凝凓且至，非時水冰，羽乃後化，痔瘧發，寒厥入胃，則內生心痛，陰中乃瘍，隱曲不利，互引陰股，筋肉拘苛，血脈凝泣，絡滿色變，或為血泄，皮膚否腫，腹滿食減，熱反上行，頭項囟頂腦戶中痛，目如脫寒入下焦，傳為濡寫。帝曰：治之柰何。歧伯曰：厥陰之勝，治以甘清，佐以苦辛，以酸寫之。少陰之勝，治以辛寒，佐以苦鹹，以甘寫之。太陰之勝，治以鹹熱，佐以辛甘，以苦寫之。少陽之勝，治以辛寒，佐以甘鹹，以甘寫之。陽明之勝，治以酸溫，佐以辛甘，以苦泄之。太陽之勝，治以甘熱，佐以辛酸，以鹹寫之。 Emperor: What does it mean when the six Qi are in excess? Master of the Diagrams replied: The excess of Yin is characterized by ringing ears, dizziness, nausea and a desire to vomit, cold sensations in the stomach, frequent bouts of chills, insect bites do not bother you, the Qi gathers in the lower abdomen, transforms into heat, urine turns yellow-red, pain in the stomach and abdomen area, pain in the sides, red or white discharge comes down, vomiting may occur, cold sensation at the throat which is blocked.

The excess of Shao Yin is marked by a strong heat in the lower abdomen causing appetite loss, reverse reaction below, the Qi roams the San Jiao, heat from summer has arrived, moisture turns to withered plants, nausea and annoyance, bloated stomach causing pain, excretion of red-stained discharge.

The excess of Tai Yin is characterized by fire Qi stagnating internally, pustules and boils appearing in the area, spreading externally, illness located in the lower abdomen, severe cases cause chest pain, headache at the back of the neck and strong muscles, if it wins out, then there is excessive dampness stagnating internally, cold attacking below the Dai, pain lingering at the top, causing the eyebrows to be restless, stomach full, rain arriving in large numbers, resulting in dryness appearing, bloated lower abdomen, strong pain in the hips, internal discomfort and difficulty in excretion, foot warm, heavy head and swelling of the hips and lower back.

The excess of Shao Yang is marked by heat residing in the stomach, causing discomfort to the heart, red eyes with a desire to vomit, nausea, ear pain with redness, prone to being startled, sudden fever and drying out of moisture, worms cannot thrive, bloated lower abdomen turning red-white.

The excess of Yang Ming is characterized by clear emission from within, left lower abdominal pain with discharge, obstruction within leading to external swelling and boils, coolness and calmness, killing of the flowers, worms causing damage, difficulty in breathing within the chest, obstruction leading to a sense of suffocation.

The excess of Tai Yang is marked by congealed heat arriving, not at the right time there is water turning into ice, feathers eventually change, pustules and boils emerge, cold enters the stomach causing internal pain, illness in the Yin area forming boils, hidden and not helpful, referring pain to the Yin area, muscles and tendons becoming tight, blood vessels hardening and weeping, sometimes there is bleeding, skin turning into swelling and heavy.

Emperor: How should they be treated? Master of the Diagrams replied: The excess of Yin can be treated with sweet and cool substances, supported by bitter and pungent ones, and clearing with vinegar. The excess of Shao Yin can be treated with warm and bitter substances, supported by salty and dry ones, and clearing with vinegar. The excess of Tai Yin can be treated with salty and hot substances, supported by sweet and bitter ones, and clearing with purgative methods. The excess of Shao Yang can be treated with salty and warm substances, supported by bitter and dry ones, and clearing with salty methods. The excess of Yang Ming can be treated with sour and warm substances, supported by bitter and sweet ones, and clearing with purgative methods. The excess of Tai Yang can be treated with sweet and hot substances, supported by bitter and sour ones, and clearing with salty methods.

8: 帝曰：六氣之復何如。歧伯曰：悉乎哉問也。厥陰之復，少腹堅滿，裏急暴痛，偃木飛沙，倮蟲不榮，厥心痛，汗發嘔吐，飲食不入，入而復出，筋骨掉眩，清厥，甚則入脾，食痺而吐。衝陽絕，死不治。少陰之復，燠熱內作，煩躁鼽嚏，少腹絞痛，火見燔焫嗌燥，分注時止，氣動於左，上行於右，欬，皮膚痛，暴瘖心痛鬱冒不知人，乃洒淅惡寒振慄譫妄，寒已而熱，渴而欲飲，少氣骨痿隔腸不便，外為浮腫噦噫，赤氣後化，流水不冰，熱氣大行，介蟲不復，病疿胗瘡瘍癰疽痤痔，甚則入肺，欬而鼻淵。天府絕，死不治。太陰之復，濕變乃舉，體重中滿，食飲不化，陰氣上厥，胸中不便，飲發於中，欬喘有聲，大雨時行，鱗見於陸，頭頂痛重，而掉瘛尤甚，嘔而密默唾吐清液，甚則入腎，竅寫無度。太谿絕，死不治。少陽之復，大熱將至，枯燥燔爇，介蟲乃耗，驚瘛欬衄，心熱煩躁，便數憎風，厥氣上行，面如浮埃，目乃瞤瘛，火氣內發，上為口糜嘔逆，血溢血泄，發而為瘧，惡寒鼓慄，寒極反熱，嗌絡焦槁，渴引水漿，色變黃赤，少氣脈萎，化而為水，傳為胕腫，甚則入肺，欬而血泄。尺澤絕，死不治。陽明之復，清氣大舉，森木蒼乾，毛蟲乃厲，病生胠脇，氣歸於左，善太息，甚則心痛否滿，腹脹而泄，嘔苦欬噦煩心，病在鬲中頭痛，甚則入肝，驚駭筋攣。太衝絕，死不治。太陽之復，厥氣上行，水凝雨冰，羽蟲乃死，心胃生寒，胸膈不利，心痛否滿，頭痛善悲，時眩仆，食減腰脽反痛，屈伸不便，地裂冰堅，陽光不治，少腹控睾，引腰脊上衝心，唾出清水及為噦噫，甚則入心，善忘善悲。神門絕，死不治。帝曰：善。治之柰何。歧伯曰：厥陰之復，治以酸寒，佐以甘辛，以酸寫之，以甘緩之。少陰之復，治以鹹寒，佐以苦辛，以甘寫之，以酸收之，辛苦發之，以鹹耎之。太陰之復，治以苦熱，佐以酸辛，以苦寫之，燥之泄之。少陽之復，治以鹹冷，佐以苦辛，以鹹耎之，以酸收之，辛苦發之，發不遠熱，無犯溫涼，少陰同法。陽明之復，治以辛溫，佐以苦甘，以苦泄之，以苦下之，以酸補之。太陽之復，治以鹹熱，佐以甘辛，以苦堅之。治諸勝復，寒者熱之，熱者寒之，溫者清之，清者溫之，散者收之，抑者散之，燥者潤之，急者緩之，堅者耎之，脆者堅之，衰者補之，強者寫之，各安其氣，必清必靜，則病氣衰去，歸其所宗，此治之大體也。 The emperor asked, What about the six qi conditions? Q Boya replied, Indeed, this is a difficult question. The deficiency of Yin leads to symptoms such as lower abdominal pain and cramping, acute pain and stabbing sensations in the chest, sweating and vomiting, loss of appetite, and food not entering the stomach, which then comes back out. This can lead to severe cases of affecting the spleen and causing distention and fullness in the abdomen. The Yang excess leads to internal heat, restlessness, lower abdominal pain, tongue symptoms, and mouth ulcers. There is excessive sweating, the skin feels itchy and painful, fever and thirst, body aches, and painful swelling of the limbs. Severe cases can lead to affecting the lungs and causing shortness of breath. The deficiency of Shao Yin leads to symptoms such as internal heat, restlessness, irritability, lower abdominal pain, red tongue with dry yellow coating, excessive sweating, and thirst. Severe cases can lead to affecting the kidneys and causing tinnitus. The excess of Tai Yang leads to symptoms such as internal heat and swelling, body aches, restlessness, irritability, inability to lie down, coughing with wheezing, nasal congestion, a red tongue with yellow coating, and thick sticky saliva. Severe cases can lead to affecting the lungs and causing cough with copious amounts of bloody sputum. The deficiency of Tai Yin leads to symptoms such as dampness and fullness in the body, difficulty digesting food and drinks, rising Yin to the head, hiccups accompanied by clear saliva, symptoms worsening during rainy days, skin lesions, severe headaches with dizziness, and vomiting of clear fluids. Severe cases can lead to affecting the bladder and causing incontinence of urine.
